loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is an organic and fair trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 47 years old and married with eight children who are still having Basic, Senior High School and Tertiary Education School.

Samuel believes organic oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan so that he can purchase a Malaysian knife to help him prune and harvest his oil palm fruit.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Samuel Yaw Adu

texts.en: Samuel is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 57 years old and married with eight Children, two of which are still having tertiary education and the rest having Senior High School and Basic Education. Samuel believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that he can purchase a Malaysian knife to aid him in pruning and harvesting of oil palm

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Osei

texts.en:
Osei is an organic and fair-trade certified palm oil farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 65 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are still having a senior high school education.

Osei believes organic palm oil is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva microloan to buy a knife for the harvesting and pruning of his cocoa and palm oil.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 49 years old and married with 5 children, who are having their basic Education. George believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a knife for harvesting and pruning of his oil palm fields.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 50 years old and married with five children, two of his children are  having Senior High School education and others basic education. Kofi believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a Malaysian knife for pruning and harvesting of oil palm fields.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Olange

texts.fr: Olange revend des produits alimentaires à domicile. Cela fait huit ans qu’elle s’adonne à cette activité. Elle y gagne de quoi nourrir sa famille et faire un peu d’épargne. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter des caisses de jus embouteillé.
texts.en:
Olange resells food products at home. She has been involved in this activity for eight years now. 

She earns enough to feed her family and to put aside a little savings. She is requesting a loan to buy some cases of bottled juice.

loans.use: to buy some cases of bottled juice.

loans.name: Myrlina

texts.en:
Myrlina lives in Mahaplag, Leyte with her family. She is a mother of four children, ages 1 to 8 years old.. Myrlina is happy to have her family. Her children are her inspiration and she continues believing that, in the future, they can have a better standard of living.

To help her husband augment their income she started her own business raising pigs. She has been doing this for three years. Myrlina is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs. Myrlina wants to enhance this business in the future so she could have enough money to provide a good education for her children for them to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé est une femme divorcée qui vit avec ses deux enfants à charge. Résidant à Tokoin, Ayélé est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar au bord de la route. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Ayélé demande ce crédit pour commander des balles de friperies en vue de mieux revendre puis gagner des bénéfices pour venir en aide à  ses enfants et pouvoir subvenir aux diverses charges quotidiennes qu’elle éprouves.
texts.en:
Ayélé is a divorced woman who lives with two children in her care. She lives in Tokoin and is a second-hand clothes saleswoman. She stocks up on the clothes four times per month at the market and resells them under a shelter at the side of the road. 

Ayélé is requesting a loan to gain a large stock of clothing and maximise her profits to cater for the numerous requests of her clients. 

She hopes to order two bales of second-hand clothing with a view to sell on more and earn profits to help her children, and to be able to pay for the various daily expenses that she must maintain.

loans.use: to buy two bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan is 42 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She has five dependent children, two of whom are in still in school.

Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for 20 years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 30,000 KHR per day and save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is the sixth micro loan for Yan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek another loan. Yan, who is the group leader, will use her potion to buy rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children. He deals in cocoa farming and selling which is supplemented by a salary. He started farming in 1997 to raise income to support the family’s increasing demands.

Pius' desires are to buy more land and increase cocoa growing, build a permanent house and be able to educate his children. His business is affected by unpredictable changes in weather and high labor costs hindering his returns. Being a loving father he would love to see all his children attain the best education possible.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, who is in his early 30's, is married with three children, two in school. He has been selling rice for six months now. She works from 4 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be John's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase his rice stock and has been able to pay his loan successfully.

John is happy with the previous loan. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and he also covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase his rice stock and meet his customers' demand. He dreams of expanding his business and buying other items like beans, maize, and millet to sell.

John will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his rice stock and meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a Kiva borrower. He has four children. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a welding business where he makes metallic doors, chairs and other items.

William has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regulars. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more welding materials. He hopes that in the future, he will have a wholesale business.

This is William's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more welding materials.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a 52-year-old married mother of five children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Ma. Luisa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as sugar and rice.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar and rice.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 37-year-old married mother of three children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan for her husband’s fruit-selling business. Her husband owns a fruit shop and covers household expenses. He likes to sell seasonal fruits.

Now he wants to buy bananas in large quantity to sell because its season is going on and its price is very low. Therefore, Ghazala requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that her husband can buy bananas, apples, oranges and other fruit in bulk. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon. Ghazala is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal and fresh fruits such as bananas, apples, and oranges for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Jenny Lissette

texts.es:
Jenny, está solicitando un nuevo crédito por la facilidad que le dan para abastecer el inventario de su negocio, piensa comprar variedad de prendas de vestir que estén de moda, así como también maíz para continuar vendiendo tortillas, tiene como objetivo continuar trabajando para dar mejor alimentación a su familia.
Con la buena administración de los créditos y sus ganancias mantiene su negocio en el mercado, además ella comente tener estabilidad económica, sus clientes están satisfechos y comprarte con su familia mejores condiciones de vida, manifiesta no haber enfrentado dificultades para mantenerse trabajando durante todo este tiempo.
texts.en:
Jenny is requesting a new loan to supply the inventory of her business. She would like to buy a variety of clothes that are in fashion, as well as corn to continue selling corn tortillas. Her goal is to continue working to provide better food to her family.

With the loan and her earnings she will be able to keep her business in the market, and also will have economic stability. Her customers will also be satisfied and she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life, which she has been working towards for a long time.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes that are in fashion, as well as corn to continue selling corn tortillas

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: Edoh est une femme mariée avec deux enfants à charge. Edoh est âgée de 33 ans et habite à Tokoin où elle exerce son activité de revendeuse de céréales. Edoh s’approvisionne de ses marchandises une fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar  là. Edoh sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs et de riz afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à son mari aux besoins de sa famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Edoh is a married woman with two children in her care. Edoh is 33 years old and lives in Tokoin where she resells cereals. 

Edoh stocks up on her supplies once a month at the market and resells them there under a shelter. Edoh is requesting this loan to order bags of maize and rice, in order to increase her profits. 

With these profits she hopes help out her husband with the family's needs and to improve the daily living conditions of their children.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of maize and five bags of rice.

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Sima is 18 years old and she is a student, living in the Baku region with her lovely family. Her father is a taxi driver and mother is a housewife. She was accepted for university this year. She is a literate girl and she will receive a grant to help pay some of the costs.

She has applied to the Komak company for a loan. She needs her first loan in the amount of 2300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan she wants to buy a new computer and to pay for her education costs. In the future Sima wants to continue for a master's degree and to find a job. She is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy a new computer and to pay for her college education.

loans.name: Safnawaty

texts.en: Safnawaty is a 24-year-old woman who is married and has three children. Last month, she began a kiosk business that sells goods such as cooking oil, sugar, instant noodles, coffee, shampoo, soap, etc. Safnawaty intended to put more stuff in her kiosk but she did not have adequate capital to afford that. When she heard about TLM's loan product, she took the chance and joined with an existing group that has received a loan before. Safnawaty has requested a loan of IDR 1,750,000. This loan would allow her to buy some more stock such as cooking oil, instant noodle, soap, sugar, coffee, tea, candies, etc. Safnawaty hopes that by using this loan, her business can be well-developed in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her kiosk such as cooking oil, instant noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en: Mylyn is a 25-year-old, married woman with three children. She is a resident of Liposong, Ozamiz City. She provides for her children's needs from the little amount of 3,000 PHP she gains from her own hog raising business as an aid to the income gained from her husband as a farmer. In 2015 Mylyn became a member of GDMPC, and she applies for a loan from GDMPC Microfinance of 5,000.00 PHP to buy piglets and feeding supplies. Mylyn wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman who describes herself as prayerful. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years.

Irene hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 36 years old, married and a mother of four children living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family’s expenses.

Now Shazia’s husband wants to buy a new auto rickshaw to provide proper transportation services but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to buy it. Therefore Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Shazia's husband can purchase the auto rickshaw and provide proper transportation services to earn income.

Shazia and her family are thankful to Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw for her husband's transportation service.

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en:
Sokna is single and aged 23 years. He lives in a rural village of Mea Chey district. He earns a living through working as a marketing at one company in the local area. Having been in this job for two years, he is able to earn about 10 USD per day. 
Sokna is just applying for a loan with VisionFund in this cycle and he is going to use the loan to pay for his school fees. He hopes this loan will enable him to have a good job in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is a married woman with four children. When asked to describe herself in a single word, she said, “Innocent.”

For the past five years Hidaya has sold clothes and shoes in a busy location to local people. She says her biggest business challenge is seasonal changes.

This will be Hidaya’s third loan through Kiva's field partner SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the 51,000 KES loan to buy more shoes and clothes to sell. She will use her anticipated profits to add more to her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tehmine

texts.en:
Tehmine lives with her husband and two children in Ddmashen village of the Gegharkunik region. Her husband works as a driver. Tehmine is a teacher with a higher pedagogical education who teaches Armenian language and literature. Tehmine is a very patient and greatly beloved teacher who properly explains her subjects and helps her pupils overcome hardships in their lessons. She also gives private courses and prepares pupils for entrance exams. Tehmine successfully repaid her first Kiva loan.  

Tehmine is requesting a 690,000 AMD loan to buy a computer and some methodological literature which will be very useful and helpful in her teaching and tutoring activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer and methodological literature which will be very useful and helpful in her teaching and tutoring activities

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita, 48, is married and has twelve children, six of whom are in school. For the past twenty years she has worked hard at her bakery to earn a living.

Marlita has applied for a 25,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy ingredients such as flour and sugar for her business. She hopes to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour and sugar for her bakery.

loans.name: Truth Group

texts.en:
Mable, a 35-year-old married woman, is a resident of Teshie province. This woman is blessed with three sons under school age.

To make a living to support her husband, she is selling hardware equipment such as coal port, powder, shea butter, aluminum pots, sweeping brooms and standing brooms and working for others for a fee. The monthly income of this woman is about 200 GHS a mouth. Seeking financial assistance to boost capital is the main challenge to the business.

In the 'Truth' group of two, she is the leader, and she will use her loan to buy more hardware items to sell to her buyers.

She hopes that she can earn more income to improve the living conditions of her household.

loans.use: to buy more hardware items to sell to her buyers.

loans.name: Paula Marlene

texts.es: Paula de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace 8 años a la venta de minutas y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Paula quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes y encementando el piso pero no posee de suficiente capital por esa razon esta solicitando un credito a INTEGRAL para la compra de los materiales de construccion necesarios para poder tener una vivienda mas comoda.
texts.en:
Paula is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. For eight she has worked selling shaved ice cones and with the profits she makes she manages to pay some of the household expenses.

Paula wants to improve her house plastering the walls and cementing the floor, but she doesn't have sufficient capital. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy the construction materials needed in order to have a more comfortable house.

loans.use: to buy the construction materials she needs.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is a married man. he has 6 children. he operates a retail business where he sells sugar, soap, sweets, bread and other items. he has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals. he describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. he will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, sweets and other items. His business goal is to own a supermarket within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, sweets and other items

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking woman with six children. She fishes to support her family in the Philippines.

Rosalie took out and successfully repaid a previous loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has applied for a 19,500 PHP loan to buy a new fishing net and other equipment. She always puts her savings back into developing her business.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Oryem Can Karacel Group

texts.en:
Henry is a member of Oryem Can Karacel Group, with his hand raised in the group photo. He is a resident of Boroboro, a married man with five school going children all dependent on the retail shop. He started his retail shop after the northern war insurgency.

He has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 to boost his retail business. He will buy stock of general merchandise such as beverages, rice, corn flour, stationery and toiletries among other items. This will help him to beat the competition and also increase his sales and profit. He is grateful to UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd and Kiva funders. The lady at the extreme right wearing a budge is the UGAFODE credit officer in charge of group monitoring,

loans.use: to buy general merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin is a thirty-year-old married man with two children aged 7 & 4 years old, both attending school. He deals in a retail shop and works 14 hours a day and seven days a week. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda.

Godwin also supplements his income with rentals, which give him extra income monthly, and he uses it to cater for the needs of his two extra family members whom he looks after.

His uppermost vision is to increase his income and expand his business into a wholesalers. However, this is not so possible since he faces a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the growing demand.

Godwin hopes to repay his first Kiva loan from Hofokam Limited on time. He is requesting for a loan to purchase more general merchandise like soap, sugar, sweets and crates of sodas for selling.

loans.use: to purchase more general merchandise like soap, sugar, sweets and crates of sodas for selling.

loans.name: Crispus

texts.en: Crispus is a married woman with two kids. She is a mixed farmer on a small scale but also operates a retail business along Mirama Hill Road in Ntungamo. She deals in home use products. She looks up to her shop for her family's financial support. She would like to buy more stock for her business and has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from UGAFODE to buy stock of daily household use items to meet her customers' demands and raise profit.

loans.use: to buy more stock of kitchenware and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a maize farmer from Ba'awa village. As a Babban Gona member, Yusuf is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona's support, Yusuf can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yusuf no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Yusuf hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Dahiru is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Dahiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Dahiru can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Dahiru has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Dahiru is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to feed his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is married and is the mother of two children. She lives in Nakuru, Kenya. Mildred works together with her husband in the local market where they sell carrots, cabbages, sweet potatoes, paw paw and pumpkins. They have been in this business for over five years, and she dreams of expanding it. With her Kiva loan, Mildred will be able to purchase stock and to increase both her retail and wholesale supplies to satisfy her customers' demand.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her fruit and vegetable stall, including sweet potatoes, paw paw and pumpkins.

loans.name: Isiya

texts.en:
Isiya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Isiya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Isiya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support Isiya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Isiya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. 

Isiya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kanan

texts.en:
Kanan is 26 years old and single. He lives in Baku. For many years, he built houses business. Currently, Kanan is a taxi driver. He transports passengers between various areas of the Baku region. 

Kanan requested another loan from Komak Credit Union for 1,500 AZN, which he will use to buy a new motor for his car. Kanan wants to get married and to have his own family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor for his car

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeledo la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace varios años e inicio con capital propio, gracias a su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes y cambiando las puertas pero como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizarlo esta solicitando un credito para la compra de todos los materiales de contruccion necesarios para hacer las mejoras en su casa.
texts.en:
This young woman's face is pixelated because she is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area. For a number of years she has worked selling clothes and shoes. She began with her own capital. Thanks to her work she has been able to meet some of the household expenses.

She lives in a home she owns with her husband and daughter. She wants to improve her home by plastering the walls and replacing the doors, but since she lacks sufficient capital to do this, she is seeking a loan to buy all the necessary construction materials to make these improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy necessary construction materials.

loans.name: Alh. Danjuma

texts.en:
Alh. Danjuma is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alh. Danjuma has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Danjuma would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Danjuma can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Danjuma will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alh. Danjuma is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school; the rest are grownups. She owns a house that has solar energy and no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cashew nuts selling business. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

Mwanajuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With this KES 20,000, she wants to purchase more stock of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon is 33 years old, a married factory worker with three grownup children. Her husband is 36, a construction worker. Two of her children are students. They all live in Takeo Province, Cambodia.

Sokhon and her husband can earn approximately $14 per day.

Now Sokhon would like to request a loan to buy cows for breeding and calves to sell.

This loan will help her earn more income from selling the calves.

In the future, she is going renovate her house and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy cows for breeding and calves to sell.

loans.name: Siuli

texts.en:
Siuli is 29 years old and a single woman with two children. For the past two years she has run a small business selling pancakes in her community.

In 2014 Siuli joined Kiva's field partner SPBD to take advantage of its services and capital. She has applied for a 1800 WST loan to buy bags of flour, baking powder, cooking oil, a frying pan, etc. Siuli will save her earnings to start a new business so as to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, baking powder, cooking oil, a frying pan, etc. for her pancake business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 42 years old, married and has one child. For the past two years she has run a small business selling pancakes in her community.

In 2014 Susana joined Kiva's field partner SPBD to take advantage of its services and capital. She has applied for a 1,000 WST loan to buy a gas oven, bags of flour, baking powder, cooking oil, etc. for her business. With her earnings Susana plans to build up her enterprise so as to earn more money to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a gas oven, bags of flour, baking powder, cooking oil, etc. for her pancake business.

loans.name: Kulangwa Group

texts.en:
SAID, who is in his late 30's is married with three schooling children. He has had a transporting business (bajaji) tricycle for one year now. He works from 05 am to 08 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be SAID's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy new spares for the bajaji and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group, which is doing great.

He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, bought land, sofa sets, a TV set, a radio, started building his house and covered household expenses.

He will use this loan to service his tricycle to make movement easier. He dreams of buying another bajaji.

Said will share this loan with his loan group, Kulangwa, which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to service his tricycle to make movement easier.

loans.name: Thắm's Group

texts.en:
Thắm is 32 years old and married. She builds houses, which she has been doing for two years in Quang Xuong district where she lives. It is a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village and her job is unstable. The main hardship that Thắm faces is lack of capital.  

Thắm is requesting her ninth loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, which she will use to purchase construction supplies to build house for clients. She joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution in 2008 to improve her  business. With her business profit, Thắm hopes that her family is healthy and happy, her business does well, and her children do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to build house for clients

loans.name: Maendeleo

texts.en:
Maendeleo is a married man. He has two children. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports goods and also customers. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather, which affects transport.

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle.

He hopes that in the future he will create jobs. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

He will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Sugito

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Sugito. Sugito is one of the Ruma agents who live in South Tangerang, located about two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married, and he and his wife have been blessed with two sons.

As the head of the family, his main source of income comes from selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving utility bill payments to his surrounding community. He joined Ruma because he wants to learn how to become an entrepreneur, as well as contribute more to his community.

As the business runs, Sugito hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile airtime and bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends.

In the near future, Sugito plans to add more products from Ruma, such as e-commerce for low-income communities.

Sugito is the one who is seen in the photo, together with his sons. He feels thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community

loans.name: Atiqa

texts.en:
Atiqa is the age of 33, the mother of three children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has sold fresh fruits at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the fruits.

Therefore, Atiqa requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more seasonal fruits. Atiqa thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a fresh and seasonal stock of fruit for her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace 8 años y con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito pero en esta ocasion es para mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcnza para realizarlo esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales de construccion necesarios y asi tener una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
This young woman, whose face has been pixelated because she is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area, has been making a living selling fish for 8 years. With the profits she makes from her sales, she manages to pay some of the household expenses.

She lives in her own home with her life partner. She is requesting a loan once again, but this time it is to improve her home by stuccoing the walls. What she makes from her sales does not go far enough to accomplish this. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of the construction materials, in order to have a better home.

loans.use: to buy necessary construction materials.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman. She has five children. She operates a retail business where she sells cattle. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more cattle.

Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

The previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to boost business.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Asiasiga

texts.en:
Asiasiga is a 54 years old single woman with six children. For the past two years she has made and sold donuts in her community to earn a living.

Asiasiga joined Kiva's field partner SPBD in 2014. She has applied for a 1500 WST loan to buy a gas oven, bags of flour, yeast, cooking oil, icing, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a gas oven, bags of flour, yeast, cooking oil, icing, etc. for her donut business.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo con 41 años de edad,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su hijo, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 4 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cuál no tendrá problemas en vender su producto. Adicionalmente se dedica a cultivos como maíz, fréjol, yuca, ingresos adicionales que le permites solventar el crédito.

Ricardo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido 3 créditos de los cuáles los dos últimos han sido de S/ 1000 del cual a pagado bien. Firma con aval.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 41 years old. He lives in a home he owns made of rustic material, with his son, in the district of Pomahuaca, in the province of Jaén, in the department of Cajamarca, in Perú. He has very good references, both personal as well as professional from the inhabitants of the area. The people in that region work primarily in agriculture, business, and cattle raising.

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has 4 years experience in this area. The loan he will receive he will use for agricultural tasks, such as the application and incorporation of phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and labor for his harvest. This will lead to physiological, morphologic and productive improvement of his crop. He will also have a timely harvest, and as a result will have greater production and a better quality product, so that he will have no problem selling his product.

He also grows corn, beans and yucca, which yield additional income that will allow him to pay off the loan. Ricardo is a recurring borrower with Edpyme Alternative. He has had 3 loans, two of which were for 1000 PEN, and which he has paid off well. He is signing with a guarantor.

loans.use: with agricultural tasks, such as application and incorporation of phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a 42-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. For many years, her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidered dresses by machine in his nearby town. He also brings some material home for her, because she helps him in the completion of embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his arts and appreciate his efforts.

He wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance. For this purpose he requires some capital to buy desired inventories, but he does not have sufficient cash on hand. Therefore, Naheed made this humble request to BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Through this loan her husband would be able to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

She is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La familia es originaria de Las Varas, Nayarit. Doña Andrea se dedica a trabajar en labores del campo así como del hogar. En el campo su principal labor es trabajar en los plantíos de guanábanas y  cacahuate. Doña Andrea desea brindarle a su hija y a sus nietos las oportunidades que ella no tuvo, por lo que solicita tu apoyo para recibirlos en una casa adecuada para toda la familia.
Desde hace más de 13 años Ana Bertha, hija de Doña Andrea se caso con Leonel, con él que construyó una casita de madera y lamina, procrearon a sus 4 hijos de los cuales los tres más grandes estudian. Ana Bertha  se dedica a las labores del hogar mientras que Leonel trabaja en el campo.
Conforme han ido creciendo los niños, han enfrentado diversos problemas por la falta de servicios, principalmente la necesidad de que los niños puedan seguir estudiando. Gracias a la ayuda de los familiares, hace aproximadamente dos años, adquirieron un terreno en una de las colonias de Las Varas, Nayarit, lo que les motivó y llevó a buscar una alternativa para poder construir su vivienda y de esta manera poder tener una vida diferente que les brinde la oportunidad de poder dar estudio a sus hijos así como otras alternativas de empleo.
Ana Bertha tiene sus  estudios en educación preparatoria y piensa que al venirse a vivir a Las Varas, le permitirá adquirir un empleo y así poder contribuir al gasto familiar. Sus sueños al tener una casa propia y en un lugar en donde haya servicios, les brindará un mejor futuro a ellos y a sus hijos.
Consideran que el quedarse en el mismo lugar en donde han estado por tanto tiempo, sólo les ocasionará seguir viviendo con muchas deficiencias y sin oportunidades de desarrollo para todos ellos y no les gustaría que el día de mañana sus hijos paguen por una mala elección.
texts.en:
The family is originally from Las Varas, Nayarit. Andrea works in field labor as well as keeping her house. In the fields her main work is working with guanábana (soursop) and peanut plants. Andrea wants to provide her daughter and her grandchildren the opportunities she never had, so she is requesting your help in receiving them in an adequate house for the whole family.

More than 13 years ago Ana Bertha, Andrea's daughter married Leonel, and with him built a small house of wood and laminate. They have four children, the three oldest of them study. Ana Bertha does the housework while Leonel works in the fields.

As the children have grown they have faced a number of problems due to the lack of services, principally the need for the children to continue their studies. Thanks to the help from family about two years ago they acquired a plot of land in one of the neighborhoods of Las Varas, Nayarit. This has led them to look for an alternative to be able to construct their house. In this way they can have a different life which provides them the opportunity to educate their children as well as other employment opportunities.

Ana Bertha has her diploma in Early Education and thinks that coming to live in Las Varas would allow her to acquire work and she could contribute to the family expenses. Her dream is to have her own house in a place where services exist to provide a better future for her children.

They think that living in the same place they have been for so long, will only mean they live with many shortcomings and without the opportunities to development for all of them. They don't want their children to pay for their bad choice in the future.

loans.use: to give her daughter and grand-children a proper place to live.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Saul con 43 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cuál brinda servicio de transporte,con 10 años de experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría y comercio de animales de corral como son gallinas, patos, pavos, etc. Solicita préstamo para invertir en arreglos y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil y gastos familiares

Saul es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa,este es su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Saul is 43 years old. He is in a common law marriage and lives with his partner and their two children in the district of Pucará, in the province of Jaén, in the department of Cajamaraca, in Perú. He has very good references, both personal and professional, from the inhabitants of the area. The people in that area work primarily in agriculture, business and cattle.

Saul provides public transportation services. He has his own motorcycle taxi with which he provides transportation services. He has 10 years experience in this field. In addition, he works raising and selling barnyard animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, etc. He seeks this loan to invest in repairs and maintenance for his mobile unit and family expenses.

Saul is a recurring borrower with Edpyme Alternativa. This is his second loan.

loans.use: to invest in repairs and maintenance for his mobile unit, and family expenses.

loans.name: Mumbagane Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a 22 year old married lady with 2 children all living in Fort Portal Uganda. She owns a business of general retail selling items like local brew known as waragi, beer, soda, spirits, foods like sugar, rice, cooking oil and many others the business she has been running for two years now. She started on a small scale selling local brews like waragi, Kwete and Mkomboti. She is charged with the responsibility of being a house wife and attending to her retail shop. Hardships like customers who delay to pay her and inadequate capital resources are a major hindrance to her goal of building a permanent house and becoming a wholesaler in her village.

She has asked for a group loan as a member of Mumbagane Tukwatanize Group to help her stock of local brew, beers, sodas, spirits, sugar, rice, soap and cooking oil for selling during this Christmas season. The babies in the photo, are with their mothers who are members in the same group and are still breast feeding, so by the time the photo was taken they were with their parents.

loans.use: to buy more stock of local brew, beers, sodas, spirits, sugar, rice, soap and cooking oil for selling

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret is a married woman six three children, all of whom attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no  piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Sothea's Group

texts.en:
43-year-old Sothea is a farmer living in Battambange province. She is married and blessed with two dependent children. She and husband support their family’s living through growing cassava and working for others for a fee. Lacking of working capital is the main challenge for her business.
In a group of two members.

Sothea is the leader and she is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and pay for labor fees to improve crop productivity. She hopes to get more yields from her farming business to make better living and keep her child in school until graduation.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pay for labor fees to improve crop productivity.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a 32-year-old married woman who lives with her one child in Lahore, Pakistan. She has run a beauty salon for about four years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials.

Due to her great service, she has become very well known on her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a larger variety of cosmetics products. However, she only has a small amount of cash, so she contacted BRAC Pakistan and applied for a loan. She wants to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

Sidra is hopeful that in time she can cater to more customers. She expects a boost in her earnings due to her loan, and she plans to spend a part of her profits on her family. SIDRA thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Danäsabe

texts.en:
Danäsabe is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Danäsabe has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Danäsabe would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Danäsabe can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Danäsabe will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Danäsabe is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor con 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia,junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú,en una zona rural.Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de la zona se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de la crianza y venta de animales menores (aves de corral),su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales (cerdos) , dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor diversidad de animales. De esta manera ayudara en maximizar sus ventas. El mercado es favorable ya que el distrito de Zaña y sus alrededores esta creciendo y hay más demanda.

Leonor es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, con 02 créditos anteriores lo cuales viene cancelando de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Leonor is 33 years old and in a common law marriage. She lives in a house she owns, with her partner and their children, in the district of Zaña, in the province of Chiclayo, in the department of Lambayeque, in a rural area of Perú. She has very good references, both personal and professional, from the inhabitants of the area. The residents of that zone work primarily in agriculture, business, and cattle raising.

Leonor works raising and selling small animals (barnyard birds). Her business is located at her home. She seeks a loan to buy animals (pigs). The investment will allow her to have a greater diversity of animals. This will help maximize her sales. The market is favorable since the district of Zaña and the surrounding areas are growing, and there is increased demand.

Leonor is a recurring borrower with Edpyme Alternativa, with 2 prior credits which were paid off in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to buy animals (pigs).

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis con 33 años, de estado civil soltero,vive en casa familiar, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados como lo son la menestra cocida y ají molido en el interior del mercado de Cayaltí, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 02 años,cuenta con si propio local comercial. Solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo ya que quiere dar mantenimiento a su local comercial y hacer unos arreglos que en le generará ingresos con este negocio.

José Luis es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
José Luis is 33 years old and single. He lives in his family home, in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, in the department of Lambayeque, in Perú. He has very good references, both personal and professional, from the residents of the area. The inhabitants of that area work primarily in agriculture, business and cattle raising.

José Luis works selling prepared foods, such as vegetable stew and a paste made from hot peppers (ají molido), inside the Cayaltí market. He has more than 2 years experience in this field, and has his own commercial locale. He seeks a loan for working capital, as he wants to provide maintenance to his commercial locale and make some improvements, as he will continue to generate income with this business.

José Luis is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to obtain working capital as he wants to provide maintenance to his comercial locale and make some improvements.

loans.name: Archangel

texts.en:
Archangel is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who grows bananas and also rears pigs in order to raise money to support his family. He is a good father and desires to educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification and expand his farming activities, despite challenges of inadequate capital.

Archangel needs the loan to buy more pigs and expand their shed.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and expand their shed.

loans.name: Bumu Development Group Nakasero Market

texts.en:
Susan is a repeat client of Ugafode Microfinance. She is a married woman with children.

She is a business woman who operates a retail shop in the city outskirts, selling home product items, especially sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, beverages, bread and sugar, among other items.

In abid to increase her working capital /expand the business, she has applied for a loan of 1,500,000. She will use the loan to buy stock of plastics, kitchen ware, toiletries, beverages and groceries for sell. She is faced with a challenge of competition and limited capital.

Susan and the group members are very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to them since they are now able to fund their businesses.

loans.use: To boost his retail trade business

loans.name: Alhaji Jafaru

texts.en:
Alhaji Jafaru is a maize farmer from Gadanga village. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Jafaru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Jafaru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Alhaji Jafaru can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alhaji Jafaru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Alhaji Jafaru hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Honest Farmers Group

texts.en:
Dậu is 49 years old and she is married.
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.
Dậu lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in the Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village.  The region often suffers natural disasters such as floods and droughts. 

The main hardship that Dậu faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.
In 2014, Dậu joined the Thanh Hoa micro finance institution to improve her  business. Dậu has successfully repaid 8 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

Dậu hopes to use her business profits for her family to be healthy and happy. She wants her children to do well in school, and to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more calves to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Định's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Định is 41 years old, and she is married with two children. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.

Định lives in Hau Loc district, in a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her household was recognized by the local government as poor, moreover this job is unstable. The main hardship that Định faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

This is Định's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the 01 Thôn 08,Liên Lạc Group, which consists of four members. In future, Định hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mary Ann dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 22-year-old married woman with one child, which is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Analie has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Analie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

Analie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Analie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a hardworking 33-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He has got a motorcycle with which he operates a transport business. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for four years.

He is happy about the progress of his business despite the hardship of poor roads that lead to constant mechanical breakdown. Christopher dreams of buying land to construct a good house for his family. He requests a loan to repair his motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a  widowed woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the 25,000 KES she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to having a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married business lady and a mother of two children who does her trade in Kisenyi near the bus terminal. Her main business is bale breaking, where she sells clothes in bulk and later takes the remaining clothes to her small boutique. She has done this business for two years and it's her main source of income. Gladys intends to expand her businesses to meet the high demands for Christmas sales. That is the reason why she is sourcimg for more funding from Kiva lenders through UGAFODE Microfinance.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 and her character and conduct plus her culture of banking allows UGAFODE to recommend the amount applied for above.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Alhaji Mohmmadu

texts.en:
Alhaji Mohmmadu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Mohmmadu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Mohmmadu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Mohmmadu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Mohmmadu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Mohmmadu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
The person in the photo is called Tom. He is 42 years old, married, and a father of four. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014.

He raises sheep as his business. He has benefited much from HiH EA training on enterprise management and record keeping that has enabled him to manage his business well.

He is borrowing from Kiva lenders to purchase more sheep that will consequently increase his production and income. This will assist him in catering for his family's needs such as food and medicine and in paying school fees for his children.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep that will consequently increase his production and income.

loans.name: Virak

texts.en:
Virak is a 24- year-old single student, and he resides in the Phnom Penh City of Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in economics in his four year at university in the city.

Virak lacks the finances to pay his university fees for the fourth year, so he has decided to take out a loan. He will be able to graduate successfully and learn the skills for his future job with this loan.

In the future, Virak dreams of having a better job with a decent salary. Therefore, he will be able to help his parents to improve the family’s living standards.

loans.use: to pay his university fees for the fourth year

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are locals.

Emmah describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to stock and sell.

loans.name: Alfredo Luis

texts.es:
Alfredo con 47 años de edad, de estado civil soltero,vive en casa familiar, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de productos y servicios naturales, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 20 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de insumos para preparación de medicinas naturales y otros gastos personales. De esta manera atenderá al demanda insatisfecha en el lugar.

Alfredo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, con pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 47-years old and is single.  He lives in the family home in the district of Zaña, part of the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of Peru. 

He has excellent references both personally and professionally from people in the area. Most residents of the area make a living from farming, trade and livestock.

He sells natural products and services and has more than 20 years of experience in the area. He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for the preparation of natural medicines and for other personal expenses. In this way, he will cater for the unsatisfied demand in this place. 

Alfredo is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa, with punctual payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the preparation of natural medicines and for other personal expenses.

loans.name: Alliance Group

texts.fr: Alliance (2) vient de finir son 1er prêt kiva. le remboursement a été fait normalement. Orokia, membre représentatif remercie tout le personnel et les prêteurs de kiva pour le soutien. Avec le prêt, Orokia avait pu payer la matière première pour la fabrication du savon afin de vendre. Elle a eu un bénéfice qui lui a permis de payer des habits pour ses enfants, de faire de l'épargne et surtout d'augmenter son activité. Orokia a encore besoin de prêt pour continuer son activité. A l'issue de ses ventes son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité et de s'occuper des besoins familiales.
texts.en:
Alliance (2) has just finished its first Kiva loan. The repayments were regularly done. Orokia, the representative member, thanks all the staff and Kiva lenders for their support.

With the loan, Orokia was able to pay for raw materials to make soap for sale. She made a profit which allowed her to buy clothes for her children, to make some savings and especially to increase her activity.

Orokia again needs a loan to continue her activity. The profit on the outcome of her sales will allow her to continue her activity and to take care of family needs.

loans.use: to buy materials for making soap.

loans.name: Maxwell

texts.en: Maxwell is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 46 years old and married with three children. His children are having their Basic and Senior High School education. Maxwell believes Organic Oil Palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that he can buy a Malaysian knife for pruning and harvesting of cocoa and oil palm.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Marie Michelle

texts.fr: Marie Michelle a 36 ans. Elle vit en union libre et à deux enfants à sa charge. Elle revend des produits cosmétiques et des boissons alcoolisées pour avoir de quoi nourrir sa famille. Son projet est de devenir autonome financièrement et être en mesure d’offrir de bonnes conditions de vie à ses enfants. Elle demande un microcrédit qu’elle compte utiliser pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Marie Michelle is 36 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and takes care of two children. She resells cosmetics and alcoholic beverages in order to have enough to feed her family. Her plan is to become financially independent and to be able to provide good living conditions for her children. She is requesting a micro loan that she intends to use to increase her stock.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 48 years old and married with three children, two of which are still having Basic education. Frank believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a Malaysian knife for pruning and harvesting of oil palm and cocoa.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 62 years old and married with nine children. Three of his children have completed senior high school education and others are still having Senior High School and Basic education. Isaac believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan purchase a Malaysian knife for harvesting of his oil palm fruits.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is an Organic and Fair trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. She is 75 years old with 7 children. All of them have completed school. Felicia believes Organic Oil Palm is sustainable and helps develop her community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, she wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that she can purchase a Malaysian knife for harvesting and maintenance of her oil palm field.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. She is 37 years old and single with a child. Ernestina believes Organic Oil Palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, she wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a harvesting/pruning knife for harvesting and maintenance of her farm.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is an Organic and Fair trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Ntronang near Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. She is 51 years old, married with 5 children. Her children are having Senior high School education and Tertiary Education.  Mary believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, she wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a knife for harvesting and pruning of her oil palm fields for more yield.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Ntronang near Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. She is 40 years old and married with seven children, two of which are still having Senior High School education and others having basic education. 
Emelia is interested in Organic Oil Palm because it’s sustainable. In this regard, she wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that she can buy a knife to help her prune and harvest her cocoa and oil palms.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Korletey

texts.en:
Korletey is an organic and fair trade-certified palm oil farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the eastern region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 49 years old and married with four children, who are receiving their primary school education.

Korletey believes that organic palm oil is profitable and helps to protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro-loan to purchase a knife for harvesting palm oil and pruning his palm oil fields.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is an organic and fair trade-certified palm oil farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the eastern region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 54 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still receiving senior high school education.

Edward believes that organic palm oil is sustainable and that it helps to develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro-loan in order purchase a knife for harvesting and maintenance of his farm.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is an organic and fair trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa.

He is 43 years old and married with 10 children. 5 of his children have completed their senior high school education, while 3 are still completing senior high school and basic education.

Ibrahim believes organic oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and fair trade infrastructure projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva microloan so he can purchase a pruning and harvesting knife for the maintenance of his farm.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting and pruning knife.

loans.name: Abubakari

texts.en:
Abubakari is an organic and fair trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 75 years old and is married with 11 children. 5 of his children have completed their senior high school education, 2 are still attending senior high school, while the rest are taking their basic education.

Abubakari believes organic oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and fair trade infrastructure projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva microloan so he can buy a knife for harvesting and pruning his oil palm fields.

loans.use: to purchase a harvesting and pruning knife.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is an Organic and Fair trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa.

She is 48 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are enrolled in Senior High School, while the others are at the Basic level of education.

Joyce believes Organic Oil Palm is sustainable and helps develop her community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects.

In this regard, she wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that she can buy a harvesting knife for the harvesting and maintenance of her oil palm fields.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is an Organic and Fair Trade Certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa.

She is 75 years old with 6 children. All of them have completed school.

Akua believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop her community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects.

In this regard, She wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that she can purchase a Malaysian knife for harvesting and maintenance of her oil palm field.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn stocks dried fish, red eggs, fresh eggs, and cooking oil for nearby villages and municipalities. He just started this business one year ago. He is thankful that he has been able to manage it well.

Glenn starts selling at 7 o'clock in morning and finishes at 3 o'clock in the afternoon. Aside from selling dried fish, he also raises hogs to have additional income for his family. Glenn's wife is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW).The couple is blessed with four children, that's why they both work hard for the future of their children.

Glenn would like to borrow additional capital of PHP30,000 to be used in buying 45 boxes of dried fish to sell. He would be grateful if his requested loan is granted.

loans.use: to buy 45 boxes of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Efouwa

texts.fr: Efouwa est une femme  mariée avec deux enfants à charge. Efouwa est âgée de 34 ans et habite à Tokoin où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice  de riz et de l’igname frit.
