Efouwa s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Efouwa sollicite ce crédit pour commander des calebasses d’ignames, des bidons d’huile et des cartons de poulets afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à son mari aux besoins de sa famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Efouwa is a married women who takes care of two children. She is 34 years old and lives in Tokoin where she carries out her trade as a caterer of rice and fried yams. Efouwa gets the necessary items for the preparation twice a month at the market and resells in front of her house.

Efouwa is requesting this loan to order gourds of yams, barrels of oil and boxes of chicken so as to earn more profits and to help her husband with the family needs, and to improve the daily standard of living of their children.

loans.use: to buy 6 gourds of yams, 2 barrels of oil and 3 boxes of chicken.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Abdul. Abdul is one of the Ruma agents who lives in South Tangerang, a suburban area located about two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.

As the head of the family, Abdul's main source of income comes from selling "nasi uduk" (one of the main beverages for local people in Jakarta), small drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and accepting utility bill payments for his surrounding community. He joined Ruma because he wants to learn how to become an entrepreneur, as well as contribute more to his community.

As the business continues, Abdul hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile airtime and bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends. In the near future, Abdul plans to add more products from Ruma to the things he sells, such as e-commerce for low-income communities. Abdul is the one who is seen in the photo. He feels thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a food business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are regular.

Victor describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. He hopes that in the future, he will have a more productive business.

This is Victor's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ghislaine Marinne

texts.es:
Ghislaine con 40 años de edad,vive en casa familiar de material rústico,junto a sus tres menores hijos, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de humitas así como también de espesado por recorrido, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 10 años.El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de un molino electrónico. De esta manera le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Ghislaine es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa,firma sola.
texts.en:
Ghislaine is 40 years old. She lives in the family home, built of rustic material, together with her three children, in the district of Pucara, province of Jaen, department of Cajamarca, in Peru. She has many very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of her area. The inhabitants of this locality mainly work in agriculture, commerce and ranching.

Ghislaine works selling ground corn and also "espesado' [a local traditional dish] by travelling around. She has more than ten years of experience in this field. The loan will be to invest in buying an electric grinder. In this way she will be able to generate a larger income and thus improve her quality of life.

Ghislaine is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa, and she signs for herself.

loans.use: to buy an electric grinder

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a hardworking lady who is an entrepreneur for her family, managing her family finances through running a tea stall from her house. With the tea, she also offers some snacks which are so yummy that they get sold as long as they come to the stall.

Her business is going well but now she wants to introduce some varieties of snacks and tea. For that purpose, she needs to invest an amount of 50,000 PKR. She is further thankful to the Kiva team and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her tea stall business.

loans.name: Sran

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Sran is aged 27 years and married with two children; one is in school while another one is still young. For more than 2 years, she and her husband have been farming rice as primary source of family’s income to make a living and her husband works as a paid worker to earn additional income. They can earn about KHR40,000 per day and manage to save about KHR17,000 each day for the future needs.

Sran is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is requesting a loan to buy cows to supporting her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production to make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cows to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Abdl-Azeez

texts.en:
Abdl-Azeez is a 39-year-old, married man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Abdl-Azeez took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Abdl-Azeez will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Abdl-Azeez’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Abdl-Azeez appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 36-year-old, married man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Mohammad’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Hằng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hằng is 45 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has operated a food stall selling fish for 8 years. Hằng lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Hằng faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the 09 Hưng bắc, Hưng Lộc, which consists of 4 members.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Mary Ailyn

texts.en:
Mary Ailyn is a 29-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has two children, ages 6 and 3. Her husband is a farmer. Mary Ailyn is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been running this business for a year.

Mary Ailyn and her husband work together to provide for the needs of their children. She is asking for a loan to buy feed for her hogs and gasoline to sell. She is engaged in other business opportunities, such as selling gasoline. She wants to improve her sales and increase her profit. In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for hogs and gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda Nicolasa

texts.es:
Mientras el gallo cacaraquea a las 5:00 am, Yolanda empieza su rutina de trabajo a la misma hora con la ayuda de su esposo, calentando el horno para empezar a elaborar los panes dulces, para continuar con el pan simple y terminar de cocinar a las 10:00 con el pan tostado. Rutina que se repite a las 2:00 pm y finaliza a las 1:00 am, siempre con el objetivo de brindar un producto de calidad a sus clientes. Todo inició hace más de 22 años, cuando ella y su marido compraron un terreno. Fue entonces cuando empezaron a construir un horno artesanal y con la ayuda de sus vecinos, fueron obteniendo tejas, zinc y bloques para poder finalizar su casa y panadería. 
Yolanda y su visión de emprendedora a los 48 años de edad, la han llevado lejos, pues ahora es reconocida por su vecindario, no solo por su excelente pan, sino también por su historia inspiradora y grandes deseos de superación. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar harina, aceite, levadura, azúcar, entre otros productos vitales para la elaboración de tan oloroso producto. Con esto podrá elaborar más y mejores productos de calidad, que le permitirán seguir sustentando a su familia y ahorrar para que en un futuro pueda sustituir su moto por un vehículo y poder abarcar más mercado.
texts.en:
While the rooster crows at 5:00 am, Yolanda starts her work day with the help of her husband, heating the oven to begin cooking sweet breads, continuing with plain bread, and finishing cooking at 10:00 am with toast. She repeats this routine at 2:00 pm and finishes at 1:00 am, always with the aim of providing a quality product to her customers. It all started over 22 years ago when she and her husband bought some land. That's when they started to build a craft oven, and with the help of their neighbors, were getting shingles, zinc and blocks to construct her house and bakery.

Yolanda and her entrepreneurial vision at 48 years of age have taken her far, as she is now renowned in their neighborhood, not only for her excellent bread, but also for her inspiring story and desire to succeed. She is currently requesting a loan to buy flour, oil, yeast, and sugar, among other products needed to create her great-smelling product. With this she will be able to produce more and higher quality products, allowing her to continue to support her family and save so that in the future she can replace her bike with a car and cover a greater market.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, yeast, and sugar, among other products.

loans.name: Abdl-Nasser

texts.en:
Abdl-Nasser is a 28-year-old, married man from Gaza city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Abdl-Nasser took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Abdl-Nasser will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Abdl-Nasser’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Abdl-Nasser appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a 27 year old, married lady who, with her husband, faced some financial obstacles in the beginning of their marriage. ‎Ola and her husband chose not to surrender to anything and find ways to survive, so Ola started a small home business ‎selling bed sheets and blankets and women`s clothes.

Now she wants to expand her business and buy more products as the demand for them is higher. So she applied for this youth loan in order to get a clothes collection that can be sold ‎in the neighborhood and to buy new blankets to sell to be ready for the winter season.

loans.use: to get a clothes collection that can be sold ‎in her neighborhood and to buy new blankets to sell, ready for the winter season.

loans.name: Jose Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo tiene 64 años de edad, es de estado civil soltero, el se dedica hace 40 años a la agricultura, el es una persona responsable, dedicada y muy constante con sus cultivos, El solicita del crédito para poder comprar fungicidas para que sus sembríos no tengan ninguna maleza, y al momento del cultivo tener un producto de buena calidad, y así poder obtener mayores ganancias para poder seguir ayudando a su madre que ya es de muy avanzada edad que está a cargo y cuidado  de él.
texts.en: 64-year-old Guillermo is single and has worked in agriculture for 40 years. He is a responsible, dedicated and persevering person. He is requesting this loan to be able to buy fungicides to avoid his crops developing weeds. The fungicides will help him grow high quality products and improve his earnings, which will in turn allow him to continue supporting his aging mother.

loans.use: to buy fungicides for his crops.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Historias inspiradoras como la de Martha, son las hace que las personas se sientan motivadas para empezar sus propios negocios. Desde las 5: 00 am hasta las 5:00 pm termina el día laboral de esta emprendedora de 51 años, con el objetivo de sustentar a su familia, con la ayuda de sus hijas y de su esposo. Anteriormente ella había solicitado un préstamo para comprar maíz, masa, sillas y mesas para su negocio. Esto le permitió tener un excelente ingreso, de manera que agradece de corazón a todas las personas que la ayudaron con ese crédito.  
En estos momentos Martha sueña con seguir cumpliendo sus metas, entre ellas establecer una miscelánea, por el momento solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar masa, bolsas, maíz, gas, sillas y mesas para el alquiler de estas últimas dos. Este insumo le permitirá ahorrar en la compra y obtener mejores ganancias, así como el alquiler de esos activos fijos, le ayudarán a tener otro ingreso más para su hogar. En un futuro ella también sueña con mejorar su casa y seguir mejorando su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Inspired stories like Martha's are what make people feel motivated to start their own businesses. The workday runs from 5:00 am until 5:00 pm for this 51-year-old entrepreneur who has the goal of supporting her family and with the help of her daughters and her husband. Previously she had requested a loan to buy corn, flour, chairs and tables for her business. This allowed her to have an excellent income such that she gives a heartfelt thanks to all of the people that helped her with this loan.

At this time, Martha dreams of continuing to reach her goals, among them is starting a small store. For now she is requesting a new loan to buy flour, bags, corn, gas, chairs and tables; the last two items will be leased out. The loan will allow her to save on the purchase, and obtain better profits as well as leasing the fixed assets. They will help her to have another form of income for her home. In the future, she also dreams about improving her house and continuing to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, bags, corn, gas, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica es una emprendedora de 46 años de edad, que lleva dos años impulsando y dando lo mejor de sí con su pulpería. Esta madre de tres hijos, siendo de once años el menor, es esposa de un marido que la apoya tanto moral, como económicamente, familia que la hacer sentir motivada a mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella inició con sus propios ahorros, después de haber trabajado en varias empresas, pues su edad y su deseo por tener su propio negocio, sirvió para cumplir con su sueño. 
Esta emprendedora, tiene como misión mejorar cada día más, tanto personal como profesionalmente. Razón por la cual Verónica solicita un préstamo para comprar aceite, arroz, frijoles, sardina, azúcar, pan, entre otros productos básicos para sus clientes. Esto le permitirá tener mayor inventario para vender y por ende mejores ingresos. En un futuro ella sueña con convertir de su negocio una distribuidora y poder comprar su propio vehículo.
texts.en:
At 46, Veronica is an enterprising woman who has spent two years promoting and giving her best to her grocery store. She is a mother of three children; the youngest is 11-years-old, and she is a wife to her spouse who supports her both morally and financially. This family makes her feel motivated to improve their quality of life. She started her own savings, after having worked for several companies, due to her age and desire to have her own business. This helped her to complete her dream.

This businesswoman aims to improve both personally and professionally everyday. This is the reason for which Verónica is soliciting a loan to buy oil, rice, beans, sardines, sugar, and bread, among other basic products for her customers. This will allow her to have more inventory to sell and therefore better income. For the future she dreams of converting her business into a supplier and of being able to buy her own vehicle.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, sardines, sugar, and bread, among other items.

loans.name: Brenilda

texts.es:
Brenilda con 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,país Perú, en una zona rural. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, gallinas, pollos, etc,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 10 años, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales y arreglos de su corral, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los habitantes de la zona.

Brenilda es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido dos créditos de S/.1000,00 y S/.1000,00 los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Brenilda is 34 years old. She is in a relationship and lives with her husband and four children in the district of Oyotun, province of Chiclayo, in Peru. It is a rural area. She has many very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the area. The inhabitants of this locality mainly work in agriculture, commerce and ranching.

She works raising and selling animals such as roosters, hens, and chickens. She has over ten years of experience in this business, which is located at her home. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals and to repair her corral. This investment will be useful since she will be able to have a larger variety of animals and greater productivity, which will have a great influence on her business. In this way she is thinking to expand her stock of animals to be able to attend to the diverse tastes and necessities of the inhabitants of her area.

Brenilda is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa. She has had two loans of 1000 PEN each, which have been paid off in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to buy more animals and make repairs to her corral

loans.name: Anne Dumancia

texts.fr: Âgée de 58 ans, mère d'un enfant, Dumancia est divorcée. Elle tient un petit restaurant qui représente sa seule source de revenu. Elle vend des plats à bats prix aux riverains. Pour profiter des opportunités que cette activité présente pour elle, Dumancia a besoin d'un microcrédit pour augmenter son fonds de roulement. A l'avenir, elle espère accroître ses revenus pour offrir de meilleures conditions de vie à son enfant.
texts.en: Dumancia is 58 years old, divorced, and the mother of one child. She owns a small restaurant that represents her only source of income. She sells prepared dishes at low prices to the local residents. To make the most of the opportunities that this business offers her, Dumancia needs a microloan to increase her working capital. In the future, she hopes to increase her income to provide better living conditions for her child.

loans.use: to have working capital.

loans.name: Edisson Fernando

texts.es: Edison tiene 23 años de edad, es un joven soltero y muy trabajador, el se dedica desde que tenía 15 años a este trabajo muy duro, para esta actividad no hay un horario fijo, el solicita del crédito para poder sembrar en mayor cantidad, para así obtener mayores ganancias ya que él es la persona encargada de seguir adelante con su madre y su hermana.
texts.en: Edisson is 23 years old.  He is a young, single, very hard-working man.  He has worked since he was 15 years old at this hard job. This occupation does not have a fixed schedule.  He is requesting the loan to be able to sow a greater quantity of potatoes and thus have greater earnings since he is the person responsible for supporting his mother and his sister.

loans.use: to enlarge his potato fields

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Amavi est une veuve femme âgée de 59 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère de six enfants, Amavi est une revendeuse de produits alimentaire qu’elle revend à  la devanture de son domicile. Amavi s’approvisionne de ses marchandises trois fois par mois au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches, des bols de piment et des épices.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Amavi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider ses enfants à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Amavi is a 59-year-old widow with six children and lives in Tokoin. She is a food products reseller who sells in front of her home. She stocks up on her supplies three times a month at the market. Amavi wants this loan so she can order baskets of fresh tomatoes, and bowls of piments and spices. With the profit margin that will result from good sales, Amavi plans to improve her offerings, and help her children in their personal development and to get a good school education.

loans.use: to buy 2 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 20 bowls of piments (hot peppers) and 4 bowls of spices.

loans.name: R.sandhya's Group

texts.en:
R. Sandhya is a young lady standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is married to a carpenter and has one infant daughter in her care.

With a limited source of income, R. Sandhya has access to limited resources. She does not have an appropriate toilet at her home, for which she has to face a lot of difficulties. Absence of a toilet compels her to travel a long distance in order to defecate and urinate in an open field. She feels that this kind of unsanitary practice can hamper her health severely in the long run.

Therefore, R. Sandhya, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a well-equipped toilet with all necessary sanitary fittings attached to it, and to install a hand pump.

The loan amount will ultimately help her in increasing her convenience and hygiene, and to lead a healthy, disease-free life. R. Sandhya is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support.

loans.use: to build a well-equipped toilet with all necessary sanitary fittings attached to it, and to install a hand pump.

loans.name: Nuri

texts.en:
Nuri is a divorced woman. She has one child. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are regular.

She will use the KES 51,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: M.sushila's Group

texts.en:
M. Sushila is a young and hardworking lady. She is standing in the middle in the photograph. She is a farmer by profession and cultivates green vegetables on her small piece of land. She hails from a small village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is married to a mason and has one school-going son in her care.

With a limited source of income, M. Sushila has access to limited resources. She does not have an appropriate toilet at her home, for which she has to face a lot of difficulties. Absence of a toilet compels her to travel a long distance in order to defecate and urinate in an open field. She feels that this kind of unsanitary practice can hamper her health severely in the long run, and she feels vulnerable to crimes.

Therefore, M. Sushila, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet with all necessary sanitary fittings attached to it, and to install a hand water pump.

The loan amount will ultimately help her increase her convenience and hygiene, and lead a safe and healthy, disease-free life.

M. Sushila is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet with all necessary sanitary fittings attached to it, and to install a hand water pump.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married father of 3 children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a tailoring shop where he makes clothing. He has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Charles' business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

Charles hopes that, in the future, he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 32-year-old lady, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities for her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a rickshaw for several years. His income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s engine and body, but he does not have sufficient cash on hand to fix the problem.

Therefore, Asia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be able to buy the moto rickshaw's body and can fix its engine.

She hopes that she would be able to make enough savings until the time comes for her children to marry in the future.

loans.use: to help her husband to purchase a rickshaw body and to fix its engine.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself as God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular.

This is Agnes' sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and she has successfully repaid her previous loans. She will use this KES 52,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and shoes and will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie is 46 years old and married with nine children. With four children in school, Lailanie works very hard to provide for them.

Lailanie has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Lailanie has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Lailanie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana works hard to support her family.

She earns a living with a farming sugarcane business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing and food vending businesses. Diana is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Diana has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is 30 years of age and lives with her husband and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband provides the services of changing the seat covers of vehicles. He purchases ready-made seat covers and stitches as well. His shop is situated in the vehicle workshop market. He approaches customers one by one and convinces them to change the seat covers of their vehicle.

He does not take up much of his customers' time and quickly changes the seat covers. Earlier he was providing services only for motorbike seats; now he wants to provide services for the various cars as well. For this purpose, he wants to buy various colors and types of Rexine so that he can show his craftsmanship for sewing car seats also.

Therefore, Amna requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy various types of Rexine. Amna thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy Rexine (imitation leather) for her husband's vehicle seat cover sewing and selling business.

loans.name: Shehzada

texts.en:
Shehzada is 59 years of age, married and living with her husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son has been running a fruit shop for three years now. He is a very humble man and works with great dedication. He is popular for his honesty and that is why he sells the fruit before the evening and earns a healthy profit.

However, since the last month he is facing difficulty in buying the stock so his mother Shehzada applied for a loan to bring ease in her son's business routine and also to kick start it once again to keep moving the wheel of their lives. Shehzada is confident about her son's sales skills and that he will be able to return the loan amount regularly. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To invest in her son's fruit shop.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a married man. He has two children. He operates a farm where he grows maize and beans. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a fertile area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be floods.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to pay workers who will be cultivating his farm.

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another farm.

loans.use: to pay workers who will be cultivating his farm.

loans.name: Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her late forties, is single with four children, one who is still in school while the other three are grown up. She has been a food vendor for ten years now. She works from 6 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the food stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciated Kiva for the support of their group, which is doing great. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, repaid the loan, started building her house and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the food store. She dreams of finishing building her house.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group Nia Njema which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the food store.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 35-year-old sick lady. All her devotions are for her husband who is earning a very low income. She is the mother of four children and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband provides services for sheltering for houses under construction. Most of his work depends upon the contract and most of the time he is unable to get any contract for sheltering services.

Recently her husband has gotten a huge contract but he does not have enough sheltering material to provide proper services. Shehnaz requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more sheltering material to provide his best services.

Shehnaz is very thankful to the Kiva and BRAC Pakistan, and she is hopeful that the Kiva lenders take pity on her and support her in the form of raising the loan.

loans.use: To buy sheltering material for services.

loans.name: Jacent

texts.en:
Jacent is a married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of six children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in cocoa farming and selling plus operating a coffee business as a source of additional income.

Because of the need to take good care of his family, he is engaged in businesses that have supported him to start on his projects like constructing his family house. He intends to use the loan to buy cocoa and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and coffee to sell

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is 41 and she is married. She lives with her husband and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Shazia purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband and sells them in her locality. She has been doing this for many years, and now she has gotten enough experience and knows the clothing business very well. She wants to utilize her experience and wants to generate more profit, but she needs to take a loan due to her poor financial condition. Due to winter season, the demand for warm clothing has increased as well.

This is the reason Shazia showed interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She would like to buy a variety of warm clothes to sell. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming clothes for her children.

loans.use: to buy warm clothing for her clothes selling business from her home.

loans.name: Brave Farmers Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tứ is 56 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture, raising pigs, for more than 10 years. Tứ lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village; moreover, this job is unstable.

The main hardship that Tứ faces is lack of capital. In 2013, Tứ joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Tứ has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is now requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

With her business profit, Tứ hopes to remodel her house, and she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Dimwe Group

texts.en:
Mozart, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two school-going children. She has been selling second-hand clothes for three years now. She works from 8 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mozart's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy clothes in the latest styles to increase her clothing stock. She dreams of opening a wholesale clothing shop.

Mozart will share this loan with her loan group Dimwe Group, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes in the latest styles to increase her clothing stock.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza is a bright and capable girl. One month ago she has started working in the business sphere. She will work in a business with the help of her parents. She hopes with their help she can get a good profit. She is unmarried. She helps her parents and loves them. She wants to get a good profit from the business and to buy necessary things for a wedding.

She wants to use this loan for buying sheep and a cow. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni with this aim.

She hopes with your help and mercy, she will get married as soon as possible when she gets a good profit from her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep and cow for developing a new business.

loans.name: Kopra Group

texts.en:
Astuti (the group leader, who is standing in the middle of group) is 24 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has been operating a copra business since early this year to get extra income.

Twice a week Astuti and husband usually buy around 500-1,000 coconuts and process it in to copra. From the sales, Astuti receives IDR 500,000 – 800,000 for the net profit.

Like Astuti and her group members, the only hardship they found in running their businesses is lack of capital. Therefore they formed Kopra Group and requested loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000 for their business expansion.

Astuti will spend the loan to purchase 2,000 more coconuts for copra.

Astuti hopes that her business can grow well in the future so she can be a successful entrepreneur in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 2,000 more coconuts for copra.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a Kiva borrower. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans, carrots and cabbages. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 52 years old; she is married with four children.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business, farming root crops in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Merlinda has been farming root crops for 10 years now, and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
Apollo is a married man. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items.

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

He hopes that in the future, he will buy land. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Hương's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương is 52 years old and she is married with two children. Hương lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the Hương's Group, which consists of three members.

Hương has had a retail business selling milk, sugar, salt, cake, and general items for more than 10 years. Her family lives in a low-income household in her village where the market need is low.

The main hardship that Hương faces is lack of capital. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase more milk, sugar, salt, cake, and general items to resell.

In 2012, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more milk, sugar, salt, cake, and general items to resell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be caring. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows cabbages, tomatoes, onions and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to own a large scale farm within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rachel requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sea-foods to sell.

She has been in this business for thirty years.

In the future, Rachel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea-foods to sell.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 56-year-old lady, living with her spouse and five children in Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities to her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.
Her son has been driving an auto-rickshaw for many years but his income is insufficient to feed the entire family. He has to maintain the auto-rickshaw body but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem.

Therefore, Safia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can replace the auto-rickshaw body.
She hopes that she will be able to make enough savings by the time her children are getting married. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her son's transportation services. .

loans.name: Nassuru

texts.en:
Nassuru is a 28 years old married man living in Bundibugyo Uganda. He is a father of 3 children and retailer and at the same time trading in cocoa that adds him more income. He is faced with challenges of inadequate capital that hinder progress of his business. However, he has hopes of expanding his retail business and also building a permanent house for his family.

Nassuru has asked for a loan to buy merchandise like cosmetics, rice, maize flour and many others to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like cosmetics, rice, maize flour and many others to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 45 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and she is the mother of five children. Her husband has been running a crockery store for 15 years.

Kalsoom is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan because her husband has to purchase different types of crockery i.e jugs, glasses, plates, dinner sets etc. This loan will help her husband to purchase these items for reselling purpose. In this way he can earn maximum profit and increase the daily sales. He can also use the profit amount as savings to fulfill the future needs.
Kalsoom is much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's crockery shop.

loans.name: Love Kids Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly is 27 years old and she is married with one child. Ly lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village.

Ly has had a service business cutting hair for 3 years. In 2014, Ly joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Ly has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. The main hardship that Ly faces is lack of capital, moreover the market need is low in this region. She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies to maintain her hair salon.

Ly is a reputable person in the community. She is the leader of her "Love kids" solidarity group.

With her business profit, Ly hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to maintain her hair salon.

loans.name: Tám's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tám is 34 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has worked in agriculture raising cattle for 6 years.Tám lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family's household is low-income. Moreover, the market demand is low in this region.

Tám is a reputable person in her community. Although this is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, all members of her group voted her as the leader of the solidarity group.

The main hardship that Tám faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future. With her business profit, Tám hopes for her business to do well, for her children to excel in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Flordelita

texts.en:
Flordelita is 39 years old and she lives with her spouse and children at Solana. She has been raising hogs for about five years now. She uses her profits to maintain the business and for the daily food requirements of her family.

She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hog-raising business.

In the future, she hopes to further develop her small hog-raising business and improve the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Maxi

texts.en:
Maxi is a 35-year-old farmer who is married to Rosmeli, a 32-year-old woman. They have been blessed with a daughter, Nikita, 9, who is an elementary school student.

Maxi has 2 acres of land and it is planted with vegetables such as spinach, swamp cabbage, and basil. He has been involved in the agriculture business for the last 15 years. He started farming by using a small amount of capital to buy the seeds and the insecticides. The income generated from his harvest enables him to meet his family's needs.

At the moment, Maxi intends to buy more seeds and fertilizer as well as gasoline for the water pump on his land. He has requested a loan from TLM amounting to 2,500,000 IDR.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and fertilizer as well as gasoline for the water pump on his land.

loans.name: Dameano

texts.en:
Dameano is a teacher at a vocational school in Kajara- Ntungamo, married with 3 children, all school going. He is also a mixed farmer in his village. Lighting his home has been a dream he has pursued for quite long time.

This solar will provide lights for himself and children during reading hours. He has applied for a loan of UGX1,000,000=/ from Ugafode to realise his dream

loans.use: to buy a solar energy unit

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en: Muborak is a very kind and capable woman. She is a careful mother of four children. She works with her husband in farming and animal husbandry. In the time she has worked in this business sphere she understands that this business can bring a good profit. She will use this profit for her children’s wedding. She wants to buy cows and sheep for developing new business. She needs money to develop her business; that’s why she is asking for a loan of 3800 with this aim. She hopes that with your help and mercy she will get a good profit. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy sheep and cows for developing new business.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertudes is 60 years old and married with six children.

Gertudes works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Gertudes has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Gertudes aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 73-year-old widow with 13 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional stocks of goods to sell.

Virginia has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 15 years, and she also earns income from selling vegetables.

Virginia aspires to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory of goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Liên's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Liên is 61 years old and she is married with 4 children. Liên lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has worked in agriculture raising cattle for more than 10 years.
Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this job is unstable .

Liên is a reputable person in the community. Although this is her first loan in Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, all members agreed to vote her to be the leader of solidarity group.
The main hardship that Liên faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Funny Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lan is 50 years old and she is married with 2 children.

She has had a manufacturing business making wood furniture for more than 10 years.
Lan lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

Lan is a reputable person in the community. Although this is her first loan in Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, all members agreed to vote her to be the leader of solidarity group.
The main hardship that Lan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more wood for making and selling wood furniture.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for making and selling wood furniture.

loans.name: Misael Geova

texts.es: Misael tiene 55 años de edad, es de estado civil casado tiene una hija, Fernanda de 17 años de edad, quien estudia en una institución cerca de su localidad, el es una persona muy responsable en su hogar y de igual manera con su trabajo, él se dedica hace 10 años al comercio de leche, esto se ha convertido para él como una fuente de trabajo, el solicita el crédito para invertir en otra vaca de leche para aumentar su producción y por ende sus ganancias y así poder seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Misael is 55 years old and in a common law marriage. He has a 17 year old daughter, Fernanda, who studies at an institution near their town. He is a very responsible person both at home and at work.

For 10 years he has worked in the milk business. This has turned into a source of work for him. He seeks a loan to invest in another dairy cow to increase both his production and his earnings, in order to be able to continue moving his family forward.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pierina De Los Angeles

texts.es: Pierina ya es una socia antigua. Actualmente se encuentra realizando practicas en una identidad financiera. Se encuentra cursando el octavo ciclo de su carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas e Informática. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder seguir pagando sus pensiones de la universidad. Ya se encuentra a un año de terminar sus estudios. Ademas esta muy agradecida con las personas de Kiva por creer en ella y ayudarla a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Pierina is already an old partner. Currently, she is doing an internship at a financial institution. She is in her eighth cycle of the career of Systems and Computer Engineering. She requested a loan to continue paying for her college tuition fees. She only has a year left to be finished with her studies. Also, she is very grateful to the Kiva people for believing in her and for helping her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition fees.

loans.name: Phirum

texts.en:
Phirum is a 21-year-old single student studying English literature in her first year at a university in the city. She is from Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Her father is a construction worker and her mother is a rice farmer.

Phirum is requesting a loan because she needs finances to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year. With the loan, she will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully.

For her future dreams, Phirum hopes to have a good job with a reasonable salary and she also wants to renovate her house.

loans.use: to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 42-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. She is a housewife, only taking care of her child, and her husband is covering their needs. He is a taxi driver and also works in the agriculture field.

Due to the hard financial situation, and the fact that the new school year is near, she is in need of borrowing a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the school fees.

She said that she is very happy and eager always to borrow additional loans to help her children continue their education suitably.

loans.use: to pay the school fees.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 63 years old and is married with 6 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elvira has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 29,500 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

Elvira has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Nedelma

texts.en:
Nedelma is a 56-year-old widow with 5 children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nedelma has been farming vegetables for 30 years, and she also earns income from raising livestock and selling rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Enalyn

texts.en:
Enalyn is 36 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She has a general store and a farming rice business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy an additional stock of groceries to sell.

Enalyn has been in this business for 13 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Enalyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Estrella Del Rosario

texts.es:
Estrella dice haber tenido un impacto positivo en su negocio de venta de antojitos y tortillas con la inversión del préstamo anterior, su negocio ha crecido, tiene ingresos estables y así ha podido cumplir con sus compromisos familiares y financieros.
Nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar harina, tomates, maíz, papas, condimentos, etc., con estos ingredientes preparara la venta de antojitos y tortillas satisfacera los gustos de sus clientes, espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Estrella says a previous loan had a positive impact in her business selling snacks and tortillas. Her business has grown. She has stable income and has been able to fulfill her familial and financial obligations.

She seeks another loan to buy flour, tomatoes, corn, potatoes, condiments, etc. With these ingredients she will prepare for the sale of snacks and tortillas, and she will satisfy the desires of her customers. She hopes to continue progressing.

loans.use: to buy flour, tomatoes, corn, potatoes, condiments, etc., with which to prepare for the sale of snacks and tortillas.

loans.name: Maria Elvia

texts.es: María tiene 50 años de edad es de estado civil casada, su esposo es jornalero, tienen tres hijos, Luis de 15, Andrés de 14 y Michel  de 11 años de edad, todos ellos estudian en una institución de su localidad, María se dedica a la compra y venta de chanchos, esta actividad se convertido en un sustento para su hogar, ella solicita del  crédito para poder aumentar el número de crías y así obtener  mayores ingresos para poderle ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and her civil status is married. Her husband is a day laborer and they have three children, Luis is 15, Andrés is 14, and Michel is 11 years old. They all go to school in a local institution. 

María's business is buying and selling pigs, and this activity has become a source of support for the household. She is requesting this loan so she can increase the number of pigs she is raising and in this way increase her earnings and be able to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy and sell pigs.

loans.name: Mosharif

texts.en:
Five years ago, Mosharif began her farm. She has two children. She is a very kind and responsible woman.

Over the past five years she has earned a good profit, and now she wants to enlarge her business. She wants to buy seeds. She owns 0.2 hectares of land, and she wants to have a good harvest and profit for the next year.

Mosharif hopes to enlarge her business by purchasing not only seeds for sowing potatoes, cabbage, onion, and carrot, but also mineral fertilizer such as nitrate and carbamide. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 TJS with this aim in mind.

Mosharif hopes she will reach her goal with your help. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing.

loans.name: Erickmar Josue

texts.es: Erickmar ya casi finaliza su carrera de Medicina está en quinto año, está muy entusiasmado porque al finalizar la carrera podrá servirle a su país y podrá atender a todas las personas que lo necesiten. Para culminar sus estudios Erickmar necesita un crédito para pagar el último año de su carrera y el título. Después de obtener su título Erickmar podrá estudiar una especialidad y ser un profesional para que sus padres se sientan orgullosos.
texts.en: Erickmar is almost finished with his university degree in Medicine.  He is in his fifth year.  He is very excited because when he finishes his degree, he will be able to serve his country and care for all the people who need it.  In order to finish his studies, Erickmar needs a loan to pay for the last year of university and his degree fees.  After earning his degree, Erickmar will be able to study a specialty and be a professional, which will make his parents feel very proud.

loans.use: to pay for the last year of university and his degree fees.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a repeat client of Ugafode Microfinance who took a loan of UGX1,000,000. He deals in the transport sector in Kampala.

He is greatful to the Kiva funders and his goals will be achieved when he purchases another taxi to increase his source of income.

His business challenge is that there are many means of transport in Kampala and the increased capital city fees. He hopes to benefit from increased funding from Kiva.

Andrew (right) and the Ugafode credit staff appear in the photograph.

loans.use: to top off a purchase for a Toyota Premio for transportation.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is a jolly woman who is engaged in the selling of jewelry, retailing, and a livestock business. Even though she has a monthly sustenance from her daughter living abroad, Arlene is still striving for their future. Her husband is a company driver. Arlene wants to expand the business; that’s why she is planning to borrow P25,000. She plans to use the loan to buy groceries and jewelry to sell. Arlene hopes to earn and save more to be able to invest again in another source of income.

loans.use: to buy groceries, and jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Leah works hard to support her family. She has a business selling soft drinks in the Philippines.

Leah is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional stocks of soft drinks to sell.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Edis Otilia

texts.es:
Edis vive con sus hijos, su esposo se encuentra viviendo en otro lugar pero aun así les apoya con los gastos familiares, Edis puede generar ingresos mediante la crianza de cerdos y pollos, su negocio funciona desde hace cuatro años, ya es reconocida en su localidad como una persona emprendedora, responsable y honesta.
Para fortalecer su negocio ha solicitado un préstamo que piensa utilizar en la compra de cerdos y pollos, al tener su negocio surtido ofrecerá a sus clientes mejor mercadería y un buen servicio, pretende aumentar su clientela y generar más ingresos para subsistir con su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son ser un ejemplo de superación y honestidad para otras personas, de la misma manera que espera que sus hijos sigan su ejemplo para aportar cosas positivas a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Edis lives with her children; Her husband is currently living somewhere else, but nonetheless, he continues to help support the family expenses. 

Edis is able to generate income by raising pigs and chickens, a business she has been running for 4 years. She is already well known in her area as an enterprising, responsible, and honest person. 

To strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan that she plans to use to buy pigs and chickens. With her business well stocked she will be able to offer better products and a good service to her clients. She hopes to increase her clientele and generate more income to support her family. 

Her aspiration is to become an example of self-improvement and honesty for other people, in the same way she hopes her sons will follow her example in order to bring positive things to society.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens to stock her business so she can offer better products and a good service to her clients.

loans.name: Ana Yanci

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer que cultiva frijoles y otras hortalizas, además practica la crianza de cerdos, aprendió a trabajar en el campo desde su niñez cuando lo hacía junto a sus padres, tiene cinco años de estar realizando dicha actividad junto a sus esposo, trabaja todos los días, Ana tienen una edad de 29 años es casada y su esposo tiene 32 años de edad, juntos han procreado tres hijos los cuales tienen 8, 6 y 3 años de edad.
Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de insumos agrícolas, cerdos y en el pago del alquiler del terreno en que sembrará frijoles, con ello tendrá un negocio más productivo y fortalecido, se siente optimista en que tanto las ventas como sus ganancias serán mayores.
Su visión es utilizar el crédito de la mejor manera, mejorar la calidad de vida familiar y apoyar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman who grows beans and other vegetables and raises pigs. She learned this type of work as a child, when she did it together with her parents. She has been doing this work together with her husband for five years and she works every day. Ana is 29 years old, married, and her husband is 32 years old. Together they have three children who are 8, 6, and 3 years old.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of farming supplies, pigs, and to pay rent for the land where she will plant beans. This will allow her to have a more productive and strong business. She feels optimistic that her sales and her income will increase.

Her vision is to use the loan in the best way possible, improve her family's quality of life, and support her children so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies, pigs, and pay rent for the land where she will plant beans so she will have a more productive and strong business.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su padre e hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes y encementando el piso, pero como no posee suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales de construccion necesarios para poder mejor su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dora is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her father and her son. 

She has been selling fruits and vegetables for several years, and manages to make a living with her earnings. 

She wants to improve her house by plastering the walls and cementing the floor, but since she doesn't have the necessary capital she is requesting a loan to buy the building materials needed to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy the building materials needed to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Haminton Alex

texts.es: Hamilton es un socio antiguo. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando en una empresa de publicidad. Y esta trabajando en su proyecto de abrir su propia empresa de publicidad. En sus ratos libres le gusta tocar la guitarra para asi tratar de distraerse de todo.El solicito el préstamo para pagar sus pensiones atrasadas que tenia en la universidad. Se siente muy agradecido con todas las personas de Kiva por ayudarlo a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Hamilton is an old partner. Currently, he is working at an advertising company, and he is working in his project of opening his own advertising company. In his free time, he likes to play guitar for distraction. He requested a loan to pay for old college fees that he owed at his university. He feels very grateful to all the Kiva people for helping him achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition fees.

loans.name: Walter Guido

texts.es: Walter es un joven de 29 años. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando en una mecánica. El decidió estudiar la carrera de Mecánica de mantenimiento porque desde muy pequeño le gustaba ya que miraba a su padre trabajar también como mecánico. Ademas en sus ratos libres trabaja como taxista para así poder solventar sus gastos de su hogar. El solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios de mecánica en un instituto. Se siente muy agradecido con las personas que le pueden ayudar a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Walter is a 29 year old young man. Currently, he is working as a mechanic. He decided to study the career of Mechanics, because since he was very young he liked it when he used to watch his father work also as a mechanic. Additionally, in his free time he works as a taxi driver so he can pay for his household expenses. He requested the loan to pay for his college fees in the career of Mechanics at an institution. He feels very grateful with the people who can help him achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for the institution's tuition fees.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will improve living standards of his family. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
Nazokat is a polite woman with three children. She is working on a farm with her husband. She wants to start own business and to make a good profit. She took part in a course “To Get Ahead” of women organization and got a certificate.

She is asking a loan for buying cows and sheep and for organizing her new business and to get a good profit. She wants to open her own big farm in the future. Her husband will help her business.

She is asking for a loan of 2000 with this aim. She hopes with your help and your support she will reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy a cow and sheep for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Suzi

texts.en:
Suzi is a married 33-year-old Lebanese mother living with her husband and two children. All of her children are still studying. Her husband is the main income earner for the family. He is a retired soldier in the Lebanese army and works as a security officer in a mall in his town.

Today, Suzi is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. in order to pay the school fees for her children. She is very happy that she will be able to ensure her children a good education. She is also very happy and thankful for Kiva.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Ma. Nian

texts.en:
Ma. Nian is a married woman with 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Nian is 36 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Ma. Nian has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Ma. Nian has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cherryl Rose

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Cherryl Rose works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines. Cherryl Rose is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell for her frozen food retailing business.

Cherryl Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Elnora operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition in her place of operation.



With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: El Mana Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL EL MANA ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO MUJERES Y UN VARON PADRES Y MADRES RESPONSABLES CON QUINCE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD. SON ORIGINARIOS DE SANTA ROSA DEL PEÑON SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL. EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE SU FAMILIA, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DIA A DIA PARA SALIR ADELANTE, Y BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS LA ESTABILIDAD QUE NECESITAN. 


GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, LA CORDINADORA ES  ANGELA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA ELABORACIO Y VENTA DE TORTILLAS, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION, EL DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO  Y COMPRA UN QUINTA DEL MAIZ PARA LA VENTA DE TORTILLAS, EL MANA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVESIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS,
texts.en:
El Mana communal bank is made up of eight women and a man who are responsible parents with a total of fifteen children to care for. They are from Santa Rosa del Peñon, and can be described as hardworking, responsible people who want to succeed. In their free time they like to enjoy being with their families. They are striving every day to get ahead and give their children the stability that they need.

Thanks to her desire for personal growth, Angela is their coordinator. Her business is making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home. She spends twelve hours each day selling her products. Her objective for this loan is to invest in working capital and buy 100 lbs of corn for selling tortillas. El Mana group appreciates the help that Kiva investors offer people with very limited resources.

loans.use: to buy 100 lbs of corn for making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Aahida

texts.en: Aahida is a 45 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and eight children. Three of her children are still attending school. Her husband represents the income source in the family in order to fulfil their family needs and improve their lifestyle. He owns a mini market in his town and works in the agriculture sector. Aahida doesn’t work, she is only focusing on her family members. Today, she is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the education fees for her children. It makes her very happy that she will be able to ensure them a suitable education.

loans.use: to pay the education fees for her children

loans.name: Duyên's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Duyên is 31 years old and she is married. She has been a fisherwoman for seven years. Duyên lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Duyên faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fishing net for fishing.

In 2015, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Duyên has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Duyên hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net for fishing

loans.name: Dara

texts.en: Dara is a 26-year-old single carpenter. He resides in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. He has been earning his main income from carpentry since 2011, earning approximately $7 per day. He lacks the finances to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and family use, therefore is requesting a loan. With the motorcycle from the loan, his family will be able to have better traveling condition and reduce traveling expanses. For his future plans, Dara is going to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and family use

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Roxana es casada, vive con su familia, dependen de ella únicamente un hijo de ocho años de edad, no cuenta con apoyo económico de sus parientes, su actividad productiva es atender un chalet, en el que ofrece meriendas, boquitas, bebidas, etc., inicio su negocio como medio de subsistencia para su familia, cuenta con 9 años de experiencia.
Piensa comprar pan, dulces, aceite, bebidas, etc., al tener nuevos productos y en mayor cantidad su inversión será menor, Roxana busca atender mejor a sus clientes, aumentar las ventas y el margen de ganancias.
 Sus sueños son ampliar su negocio y adquirir un mejor equipo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Roxana is married and lives with her family. Her only dependent is an 8-year-old son. She has no financial support from her parents. 

Her business is to run a cafe where she sells snacks, sandwiches, drinks, etc. She began this work as a way to support her family and now has 9 years of experience.  

She wants to buy bread, sweets, oil, drinks, etc. With new products and a better stock, her investment will be less. Roxana is hoping to better serve her clients and increase sales as well as her profit margin. 

Her dream is to expand her business and obtain better equipment for her work.

loans.use: to buy bread, sweets, oil, drinks, etc. With new products and a better stock, her investment will be less.

loans.name: Mazalo

texts.fr: Mazalo est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à charge. Mazalo est âgée de 35 ans et vit à Tokoin où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice de pâtes bandées et de l’igname frit. Mazalo s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Mazalo sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs et des calebasses d’ignames en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à son mari aux besoins de la famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Mazalo is a married woman with four children to support. She is 35 years old and lives in Tokoin, where she operates a restaurant business selling pâtes bandées [a polenta dish] and fried yams. She gets her supplies of necessities for making her goods twice a month at the market. She resells in a stall in front of her home.
