Mazalo is requesting this loan to order sacks of corn and calabashes of yams with the aim of having good sales and then earning more profit. She could then help out her husband in meeting family needs and improve their children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of corn and 2 calabashes of yams

loans.name: Melissa Fiorella

texts.es: Melissa es una joven universitaria. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el septimo ciclo de su carrera de Enfermería. Ella decidió estudiar esta carrera porque le gusta mucho cuidar de las personas. Además de ser una joven muy aplicada en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a jugar basquetball con sus amigas. Para obtener algún ingreso trabaja esporadicamente como cuidadora de bebes. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios. Ya se encuentra a un año y medio de terminar su carrera. Se siente muy agradecida con los socios de Kiva por ayudarle a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Melissa is a young college student. She is currently in her seventh semester studying in a Nursing program. She decided on this major because she really likes taking care of people. Besides being a very hardworking young woman, she also enjoys going out to play basketball with her friends in her free time. To earn some income, she works occasionally caring for babies.

She requested this loan to be able to pay for her tuition. She will finish her degree in a year and a half. She feels very grateful to Kiva members for helping her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en: Fotima is a widowed woman. She is a professional seamstress. She is very a kind and responsible woman. She has two children, one daughter and one son. They are both adults and are studying at the university. She wants her children to be educated people. During the four years she has been working as a seamstress she has been the only income-earner of her family. It’s hard for her to be the income-earner of the family and pay the university contracts for her children's studies. That’s why she needs money. She is asking for a loan of 5,300 to pay for the university tuition. She hopes for your mercy and your help.

loans.use: to pay for her children's university tuition.

loans.name: Christa

texts.fr: Christa est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et a deux enfants. Elle revend des chaussures. C’est une activité qu’elle connaît très, car cela fait 13 ans qu’elle l’exerce. Elle a demandé un prêt pour acheter un nouveau stock de chaussures à l’occasion des fêtes de fin d’année. Elle veut profiter des opportunités de vente en cette période.
texts.en: Christa is 39 years old. She is married and has two children. She sells shoes. It is work that she knows very well, since she has been operating this business for thirteen years. She has asked for a loan to purchase a new inventory of shoes for the year-end holidays. She wants to take advantage of the opportunities for sales during this period.

loans.use: to purchase a new inventory of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, trabaja en una empresa privada desde hace varios años y con lo obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su madre, el quiere mejorar su vivienda repelando las paredes para tener una mejor casa por esa razon solicita un credito a INTEGRAL para la compra de los materiales de construccion necesarios como cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
The young man's face is pixelated because he is 21 years old and lives in a high risk zone. He has worked for a private company for several years and with what he makes in sales, he has managed to pay some of the household expenses.

The young man lives in his own house with his mother. He wants to improve his housing by plastering the walls so the house is better. That is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy the necessary building materials, such as cement and sand, and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials, such as cement and sand, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es: rosa de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 6 años al cultivo de caña de azucar y comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. She has worked for the past six years growing sugar cane and selling it in the neighboring towns. She has many regular clients. With what she makes from her sales she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is once again requesting a loan to buy more fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. to continue with her work which generates good earnings.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has no piped water but has electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanamkuu has operated a tailoring business for the past three years. She makes women's and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Lagm-Pengwendé 3 Group

texts.fr: Lagmè-pengwendé (3) vient de finir son 1er prêt Kiva. Le remboursement a été fait normalement. Assétou, membre représentatif remercie tout le personnel les prêteurs de kIVA pour le soutien. Avec le prêt, Assétou avait pu payer le petit mil, le sucre, et du tamarin pour faire Jus appelé ZOOM KOOM dans la langue mooré afin de vendre. Elle a eu un bénéfice qui lui a permis de payer des habits pour ses enfants, de faire quelques dépenses pour sa famille et surtout d'augmenter son activité. Assétou a encore besoin de prêt pour continuer son activité. A l'issue de ses ventes son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité et de contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en: Lagmè-pengwendé (3) just finished its first Kiva loan. The repayments were made normally. Assétou, the representative member, says thank you to all Kiva personnel and lenders for the support. With this loan, she was able to buy pearl millet, sugar, and tamarind for making a juice drink, called ZOOM KOOM in the Mooré language, to sell. She had a profit enabling her to pay for clothing for her children, to cover some expenses for her family, and especially to augment her business. Assétou still has need of loans to continue her business. After her sales, her profit will allow her to continue her work and help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy grains (10 sacks).

loans.name: Julia Elizabeth

texts.es: Julia de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace mas de 3 años tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos ya que tiene una variedad de productos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Julia is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She has had a store located in her place of residence for more than three years. She has many clients especially her neighbors as she has a variety of products. With the earnings she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, pastries, etc to be able to have greater income for a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Jembatan Group

texts.en:
Sesama Jembatan is one of TLM's Sesama groups, and consists of five women led by Henderika, a 33-year-old woman. The members agreed to named their group Sesama Jembatan because they lives nearby a bridge.

These five women have their own businesses and are mostly entrepreneurs and traders. One of the members is Safira (standing in the middle of the picture). Safira is married and has six children. Safira sells vegetables in a local market from 4 am to 9 am; then from 3 pm to 7 pm she sells boiled corn around the community. She usually buys enough vegetables for two days for about IDR 400.000, and enough corn for three days in the amount of IDR 250.000.

Nowadays she needs more capital in order to increase her income and because the price of the vegetables has soared. That is the reason why Safira agreed to group herself in a Sesama group with the other four women in the community who need more capital for their own businesses. Then the group applied for an IDR 11.250.000 loan from Kiva through TLM. Each members used the loan to purchase their business needs.

Safira herself used the loan to buy vegetables and corn in larger amounts than before. She wishes that through the loan there will be an enhancement in her income, which will enable her to meet the children's school fees and the family's other needs too.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and corn in larger amounts than before.

loans.name: Zeynegul

texts.ru: Зейнегул успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 8 коров, 42 овцы и 1 лошадь. На 1,60 Га собственной и 0,50 Га арендованной земли она выращивает картофель, люцерну и ячмень для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Зейнегул составляет 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов коров. Доходы от кредита Зейнегул планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и образование детей.
texts.en:
Zeynegul successfully repaid her loan, after using for its intended purpose.  She is thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who have helped her to obtain this previous financing.  She currently has eight cows, 42 sheep, and one horse on her farm.  She also grows potatoes, alfalfa, and barley for resale on 1.6 hectares of her own land and 0.5 hectares of leased land.  She makes a monthly income of 22,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further grow her farming business, she has once more contacted Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and she is taking a loan of 150,000 (KGS) som to buy a few additional cows.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her farming business and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a few additional cows in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 61 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosario has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, personal care products, school supplies, and other groceries. 

In the future Rosario would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat is 48 years old, living in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son owns a fish shop in which he sells a variety of fishes. He buys fish from far off places to sell in his shop. He has been selling fish for several years now and offers various kinds according to customer’s demand. His major problem is the lack of a lump sum amount, which is required for investment. Therefore, Farhat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy fish for resale. Farhat is very happy after taking this loan and says thanks to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To invest in her son's fish selling business.

loans.name: Sabali Ye Sigidia Group

texts.fr:
AROUNA est le Monsieur qui tient le mouton à sa main sur la photo. Il est Malien alphabétisé, âgé de 40 ans, cultivateur, marié et père de 07 enfants âgés de 16 ans à mois dont 2 fréquentent l’école. Sa femme est une ménagère.
En plus de l’agriculture, AROUNA fait l’éleveur des moutons depuis 07 ans. Il s’approvisionne sur les marchés environnants et revend ses animaux dans les mêmes marchés. Le profil qu’il gagne lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille comme la santé l’alimentation etc….
AROUNA est un client solvable du RMCR ; Plein d’initiatives il emprunte de l’argent pour pouvoir augmenter son pouvoir d’achat afin d’accroitre ses revenus. Il se sent à l’aise dans l’exercice de ce métier car il trouve que c’est une activité bien rentable. 
Ayant souvent confronté aux problèmes de rareté de marché, son rêve est de devenir un exportateur d’animaux dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
AROUNA is the gentleman holding the sheep in the photo. He is Malian, educated, 40 years old, a farmer, and the married father of seven children, aged from ___ months to 16 years, of whom two are attending school. His wife is a homemaker.

In addition to farming, AROUNA has been raising sheep for seven years. He is supplied from nearby markets and resells his animals at the same markets. The profit he earns will enable him to meet family needs, such as healthcare, food, etc.

AROUNA is an RMCR client in good standing. Full of initiative, he is borrowing money to increase his buying power in order to increase revenues. He feels comfortable in his trade of his, since he finds it to be quite profitable.

Having often confronted problems with market scarcity, his dream is to become an exporter of animals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise and then resell

loans.name: Badenya-Ton Group

texts.fr:
SEKOU est le monsieur qui  tient le bélier par sa corne sur la photo. Il est  un  malien  non scolarisé âgé de 58 ans, marié et  Père de 07 enfants, âgés de 1 à  25 ans dont 3  sont scolarisés. Sa femme est une ménagère.
 SEKOU fait  l’élevage des béliers, Il prend le prêt avec le RMCR pour acheter des béliers après six mois il les vends. Il s’approvisionne  dans  les foires environnantes  et revend  ses béliers  en ville.  Il  exerce ce métier, il y a plus de 15 ans. Dans ses ventes, il gagne environ  13 000 FCFA de profit par tète de Béliers. Le profit qu’il gagne lui permet de subvenir à certains besoins de sa famille entre autre habillement, frais médicaux et scolaires.  SEKOU est solvable ; il travaille avec le RMCR depuis 3ans.
Dans l’avenir, SEKOU souhaite avoir un prêt  plus  élevé pour acheter beaucoup plus  de béliers.
texts.en:
SEKOU is the gentleman holding the ram by the horns in the photo. He is Malian, uneducated, 58 years old, and the married father of seven children, aged 1 to 25 years old, of whom three are in school. His wife is a homemaker.

SEKOU raises sheep. He is taking out a loan with RMCR to purchase some rams. After six months, he sells them. He is supplied from the nearby fairs and resells his rams in town. He has been in this trade for over fifteen years. With his sales, he makes about 13,000 francs CFA of profit per head. The profit he earns will enable him to meet certain family needs, including clothing, medical care, and schooling. SEKOU is in good standing; he has worked with RMCR for three years.

For the future, he would like to have a bigger loan to purchase more rams.

loans.use: to raise sheep to resell

loans.name: Manolito

texts.en: Manolito has managed his farm for 30 years. He grows rice in his field. Manolito believes that aside from natural disaster, the one factor also that will affect the value of his crops is not applying the right amount of fertilizers and herbicides to the crops. He and his wife help each other so they are able to harvest more and make a larger income. Manolito wants to borrow a loan of P50,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his crop. He will also use the loan to pay for the labor cost in farming. Manolito will do his best to ensure a good harvest provided it is not affected by storm and drought.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his crop.

loans.name: Chrispinus

texts.en:
Chrispinus is 32 years old. He is married with 4 children. 

He has had a motorcycle transportation business for 1 year. He will be using the loan to purchase an asset motorcycle for him to do motorcycle transportation.

He will use the anticipated profit to repay his loan and to educate his children by paying school fees and buying books.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to live a successful life together with his family.

loans.use: to purchase an asset motorcycle for him to do motorcycle transportation.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 39 years and a second hand clothe trader at Mtopanga, Mombasa, Kenya. She is a mother of two who has been in this business for the last ten years and doing well.

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business after successfully repaying her first loan. She will use the requested loan to purchase second hand clothes for resale and the anticipated profit to educate her children. She hopes to own a boutique in future.

loans.use: to purchase second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nurbubu

texts.ru: Нурбубу, 48 лет, вдова, есть 4 детей. Нурбубу в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 20 лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Нурбубу имеет в хозяйстве 3 коровы, 31 овцу и 2 лошади. На участке мерою 1,20 Га арендованной и 1,65 Га собственной земли, выращивает ячмень и люцерну. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме до 35,000 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что сельскохозяйственный бизнес рентабелен, Нурбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 6 бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Нурбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, улучшение материального благосостояния семьи.
texts.en: Nurbubu is a 48-year-old widow and the mother of four children.  For the past 20 years, she has been involved in agriculture and animal husbandry, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has three cows, 31 sheep and two horses on her farm.  She also grows barley and alfalfa on 1.2 hectares of leased land and 1.65 hectares of her own land.  She makes up to 35,000 som (KGS) every month from her combined activities.  Having realized that her farming business could be profitable, she has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy six steers for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her farming business and to improve her family's material well-being.

loans.use: to buy six steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 32 and lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband owns a fish shop in which he sells a variety of fish. He buys fish from far-off places and sells them in his shop.

He has recently started selling fish and offers various kinds according to his customers' demand but a major problem is the lack of money, which is required for the investment. Because of this, Asia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy fish to resell.

Asia is very happy because of this loan and is thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's fish selling business.

loans.name: Sherkhon

texts.en: Sherkhon is a bright and capable boy. He is studying at the university with good and excellent marks. He is a first year student. He is studying very well. He wants to become the best specialist. His favorite subjects are history, chemistry, and psychology. He participates in a lot of circles.  The financial condition of his family is not good. His parents have a small income. It’s hard for him to pay his tuition contract at the University. He is asking for a loan of 4250 TJS with this aim. He hopes for your help and mercy.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Poor Women Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngọc is 46 years old and married with 4 children. She has raised poultry for more than 10 years. Ngọc lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family lives in a village and her household is low-income.

The main hardship Ngọc faces is lack of capital. In addition, market demand for poultry is low in her area. Because of these factors, Ngọc is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in future.

This is Ngọc's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the Poor Women Group, which consists of 3 members. With her business profit, Ngọc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase young cows to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en: Lubna is age 29; she is a mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband provides local rural transport services to the people of his society. For the last three years he has been running a horse cart for rural transport services. Now he wants to provide transport services by running an auto rickshaw. He hopes that by running a auto rickshaw he will be able to get more income to financially support his family. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new auto rickshaw. Therefore, his wife Lubna has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new auto rickshaw. Lubna is very thankful to Kiva and it's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase a rickshaw.

loans.name: Erenie

texts.en:
Erenie is 32 years old and has three children. She is married and all three children attend school.

Erenie is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Erenie requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Erenie has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Erenie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.fr: Mère d’un enfant, Rosaline est une femme mariée âgée de 31 ans résidant à Tokoin. Rosaline est une coiffeuse qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché des mèches et tissages et les revendent dans son salon de coiffure. Rosaline nécessite ce crédit pour commander des unités de mèches et tissages en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner des bénéfices afin d’appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge de leurs enfants et les besoins en nourriture et santé de la famille.
texts.en: Rosaline, 31, is a married woman and the mother of one child.  She lives in Tokoin and works as a hairdresser.  She stocks up twice a month at the market and buys hair extensions and braids which she resells in her beauty salon.  Rosaline needs this loan to buy hair extensions and braids in order to increase her sales and profits.  Her goal is to help her husband to take care of the children's nutritional and healthcare needs.

loans.use: to buy 21 units of hair extensions and 21 units of braids.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Agée de 44 ans, Adjovi est une femme mariée avec trois enfants à charge. Pour exercer son activité, Adjovi vit à Tokoin et vend des bijoux en circulant les quartiers environnant pour ainsi gagner son revenu. Adjovi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des douzaines de boucle d’oreilles et de chaines, Adjovi demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat en vue de bien revendre et avoir un gain pour aider ses enfants à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Adjovi, 44, is a married woman with three children in her care.  She lives and works in Tokoin and sells jewelry as an itinerant seller in the surrounding neighborhoods.  This is how she makes a living.  Adjovi stocks once a month at the market.  She is taking this loan to buy earrings and chains.  Her goal is to increase her sales, make a profit, and see her children blossom and receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy 20 dozen pairs of earrings and 13 dozen chains.

loans.name: Gulbiby

texts.en: Three months ago Gulbiby started working in a farm for crop-growing in the agricultural sphere. Her husband is a businessman. She has four children and they are adults. She is a very kind and responsible woman. She is successful working in an agricultural sphere. She has good experience in this sphere. Gulbiby raised her children from agricultural profits. She has four hectare of cotton, four hectare garden of trees, such as peaches and apricot. She intends to sow two hectares of wheat, four hectares of cotton, and a half hectare of onions. Every year she gets a good harvest. She works with her children and young brides and  they help her in her activities. She wants to make a new planting and that’s why she needs money. She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for new planting. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for a new planting.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is 54 years old. She is married with 7 children.

Priscah has run a dairy farming business for 15 years. She will use her loan to buy more animal feed for her cows to enhance their milk production and earn her more income. With the anticipated profit, she will repay her loan and improve her housing structure.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a happy life.

loans.use: to buy more animal feed for her cows so they will produce more milk and earn her more income.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 36 years old. She is married with 3 children.

Evaline has run a tailoring business for 5 years. She will use her loan to purchase more materials to make clothes for her customers. With her anticipated profits, she plans to repay her loan and to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a successful life together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 28 years old and married, with four children. She grows produce to sell, such as maize and beans, as her main source of income, along with other food crops and a retail shop for additional income. She started the business to sustain her family and construct for her family a dream house. She hopes to educate her offspring and expand her farm. Price fluctuations, weather vagaries, pesticides, and diseases are a great challenge to what she plants, thus affecting her expected harvests.

Shamim intends to use the loan to weed and buy chemicals for spraying her farm.

loans.use: to weed and buy chemicals for spraying her farm.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Ninfa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Ninfa is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 34-year-old married mother of three children living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been a rickshaw driver for the past 4 years and he has worked for some contractors in the past. His rickshaw has not been working properly for the past several days, and because of this he has been unable to generate any income. He wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible, but due to lack of money, he is unable to cover the cost of repairs.

Maryam has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Maryam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his rickshaw.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is the age of 32, living in the rural area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband runs a hotel. He is very hard-working and a gentleman. He owns a small hotel in which he offers types of delicious foods, two times a day. He has been running this hotel for 15 years, earning good profit from this business. He offers tea to his customers.

Now, he wants to establish his restaurant by purchasing new plastic furniture, utensils, cauldrons, etc. Due to household expenses, his savings are insufficient to buy the desired things.

Therefore,Gulshan requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, utensils, cauldrons, etc. She thanks Kiva and appreciates the warm support to her.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's hotel business.

loans.name: Domiana

texts.en:
Domiana is 28 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 children. For the past 10 years, Domiana has earned a living running a retail shop and farming. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

This is Domiana's 2nd loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and a water pump to improve farm production. She plans to use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Katleho Group

texts.en:
Mamohau is a 45 year old mother of 3 children aged between 21 and 13 years. Her husband recently died and she now lives with her elderly mother and her youngest children in a traditional hut that is not well ventilated nor warms up well in winter. Neither she nor her eldest children work proper jobs and hence earn very little.

She works long hours on her farm with 1 of her children, the other one is employed on other peoples' farms, and the youngest at 13 is still going to school during the week and helping in the field on Saturdays and Sundays. Together with her eldest child, Mamohau has to wake up very early between 4am and 5am during the week, to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water, and warming the house for her family before going out to attend to daily work because she can not afford any other means. 

However, with little money she makes while working, plus her mother's pension money which is not much, and the little money that the other child makes, she is now able to afford to buy gas and paraffin which are both very expensive. She finds herself having to pay about R500 to R600 a month to have sufficient gas, paraffin, and groceries which include candles for lighting and charcoal for her traditional home made heater; this is money she hardly makes. Not only is gas expensive for Mamohau and many like her, but it is highly flammable and when inhaled can lead to lung diseases and even death. Candles have proven to cause a lot of fire accidents, even deaths, because they are often forgotten and not blown out which is dangerous. The the traditional heater is bad for Momohau's family of young children and Mamohau's elderly mother. 

Mamohau has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to be able to purchase clean cook stoves for her and 11 other people from her village who are living in similar circumstances.  This means the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families.  The stoves do not require a lot of wood which is hard to find in Lesotho, nor expensive paraffin and gas. This stove can be started with the use of very little, readily available biomass like dry twigs and dry cow dung that do not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the home. This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones, and a mini LED lamp. A life improving package for these people.

This stove saves them time to be with their family, saves energy, eliminates toxic inhalation, house burning, and has given them the freedom to have a better lit home to see better in the evening while cooking and enables children to do their homework. For stove info, please check www.africancleanenergy.com

loans.use: to pay for the ACE cook stove which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel, and the time she spends collecting firewood.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es: Diego es un joven universitario de 23 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el sexto ciclo de su carrera de Psicología. El decidió estudiar esta carrera porque para el es muy importante la salud emocional de la persona. Ademas de ser un joven aplicado en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a jugar fútbol con sus amigos. Para obtener algún ingreso trabaja esporadicamente como asistente en un consultorio. El solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios. Ya se encuentra a dos años de terminar su carrera. Se siente agradecido con las personas que le pueden ayudar a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Diego is a young, 23-year-old college student. He is currently studying in sixth semester as a Psychology major. He decided to study this field because, to him, a person's emotional health is very important. Besides being a studious young man, in his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends. He works off and on as an assistant in a doctor's office to earn some income.

He is requesting the loan to be able to pay his college fees. He is now two years away from graduating. He is grateful to the people who can help achieve his goals.

loans.use: pay for college fees.

loans.name: Inversionistas Chichina Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal INVERSIONISTAS CHICHINA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de CCatca, provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Lucila tiene 38 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera poder continuar trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Inversionistas Chichina village bank. The bank is located in the district of Cataca, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. The member Luclia is 38 years old, has 3 children and is single. The member alternates her daily activities, dedicating herself to agriculture. The member has been working at her business for a good time, which is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts forth to her business every day. The member is an entrepreneurial woman who hopes to be able to continue working so that in this manner she continues supporting her family.

The member is applying for the loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. The members in general are thankful for the loan granted and they commit themselves to complying with their established payment installments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Makich

texts.en: Makich is 32 years old and he lives in Tsovagyugh village in the Gegharkunik region. Makich is not married and he lives with his parents. This young man is a farmer and has been since a very young age. On the farm he has great variety of cattle such as cows, calves, a heifer, bulls, pigs, piglets, sheep, lambs, and chickens. Makich, with the help of his parents, organizes the sale of his great variety of farm products. He sells his farm meat, milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, butter, and eggs. Makich also does agricultural work with his father and they cultivate potato, cucumber, tomato, and peppers on their land. This young farmer will be greatly thankful if Kiva lenders help him with loan amount of 690.000 Armenian drams that he plans to use on the purchase of animal fodder for his cattle for the long winter months.

loans.use: to purchase animal fodder for his cattle for long winter months

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en: Nabeela is 26 years old and is living in the rural area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband runs a hotel. He is very hard working gentleman. He owns a small hotel in which he offers types of delicious foods three times in a day. He has been running this hotel for 12 years and earning a handsome profit from this business. He offers tea to his customers also. Now he wants to establish his restaurant by purchasing new plastic furniture and several utensils. Due to household expenses, his savings are not enough to buy the required inventory. Therefore, Nabeela requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy plastic furniture and utensils. She thanks Kiva and appreciates their support for her.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's hotel business.

loans.name: Winners Women And Men Association Salama Group

texts.en:
Amina is a repeat client of Ugafode Microfinance and she previously took a loan of 500,000 UGX. She is a married woman with children.

Amina is a business woman and she owns a shop. In a bid to increase her working capital and expand her business, she has applied for a loan portion of 1,000,000 UGX to buy stock of sugar, soap, corn flour, beverages, groceries, stationary, and other items to sell in her retail shop. She hopes this will increase her sales and income.

Amina is very grateful for the support of Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: to boost her wholesale business by buying more stock.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is a friendly, young woman. She has three children. Her husband helps her in the business. She works with her husband with planting and harvesting crops. They sell crops at the market.
 
At this time, she is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for new planting. Nasiba will be able to works more effectively and efficiently in order to increase the produce from the crops and increase her income. Nasiba and her family are very happy and satisfied with their livelihood and hope to be able to always continue in their family tradition. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 TJS for this goal. This loan will help her achieve her goals and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for new planting

loans.name: Jahir Alvaro

texts.es: Jahir es un universitario de 19 años. Actualmente se encuentra hacien practicas en una empresa como asistente. El decidió estudiar la carrera de Administración y Sistemas porque el considera que es necesario contar con profesionales capaces de tomar decisiones que generen valor económico y social en una empresa. Además de dedicarse a su trabajo y estudios en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos. Comenta que quiere especializarse en Recursos Humanos. El solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de la universidad. ya se encuentra a 1 año y medio de terminar su carrera. Se siente muy agradecido con los socios de Kiva por ayudarlo a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Jahir is a university student, 19 years old. Currently, he is found doing an internship in a business as an assistant. He decided to study the degree of Administration and Systems because he considers that it's necessary to have professional capacities of making decisions that generate economic and social value in a business. In addition to dedicating himself to his work and studies, in his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends. He comments that he wants to specialize in Human Resources.

He is applying for the loan to be able to pay for his university board expenses. He is already a year and a half away from finishing his degree. He feels very thankful with the Kiva partners for helping him to fulfill his goals.

loans.use: to pay for college board expenses.

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es: Rosa de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante desde hace varios años gracias a sus ventas y las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir su viveinda pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un credito para la compra de los materiales de construccion necesarios y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener una vivienda mas comoda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 30 years old, lives in her own house with her parents. She has worked selling clothing on foot for several years. Thanks to her sales and the profits she obtains, she achieves covering the expenses that she faces. She wants to improve her home, finishing the construction of her home.

Since she doesn't have enough capital, she is applying to Integral for a loan for the purchase of the necessary construction materials and to pay for labor and to therefore be able to have a more comfortable home.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en: Saeeda  is a 58-year-old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her son, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Saeeda  has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 40,000 PKR for her son to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers. Saeeda  is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to the customers.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is a 34-year-old mother of 6 residing in a small area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She and her husband have a peaceful home, but recently, they have been facing hard times. Her husband earns a living driving a taxi and his vehicle needs repairs; this has prevented him from earning enough to support the household.

Gulnaz is well-versed in her husband's matters and she has applied for a loan from KIVA and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She hopes that the family's issues can be resolved and they can live the life they dream to live. She is thankful to the KIVA Team and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's taxi repairs.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 61 years old. She is married and blessed with 7 children. She has been in the farming business for 10 years, earning a monthly income of 4,000 KES.

This is Annah's 3rd loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs of seeds and fertilizers. With the profits from the expanded business, she plans to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have educated children and a better business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs of seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with 3 children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Bahati has operated a retail shop business for the past 6 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, Bahati wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Kunti's Group

texts.en:
Kunti is a humble and sensible lady standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a small tribal village in Sonepur, Odisha, India. She is married to a farmer and has two grown-up sons who are continuing their studies in college. With a limited source of income, Kunti has access to limited resources. She does not have an appropriate toilet at her home. Because of this, she has to face a lot of difficulties. The absence of a toilet compels her to travel a long distance in order to defecate and urinate in an open field. She feels that this kind of unsanitary practice can hamper her health severely in the long run and she will end up in spending all her savings on the hospital.

Therefore, Kunti along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a well equipped toilet with all necessary sanitary fittings attached to it.

The loan amount will ultimately help her to increase her convenience and hygiene and lead a healthy disease-free life.

Kunti is eagerly awaiting your kind help and generous support.

loans.use: to build a well-equipped toilet with all the necessary sanitary fittings attached to it.

loans.name: Nazarkhotun

texts.en:
Nazarhotun is a widow and the caring mother of 2 younger children. She is a very kind and responsible woman. She is responsible for feeding her entire family.

For the past 2 months, Nazarthoun has baked cakes and small rolls and prepares hotdogs and coffee. She wants to enlarge her business but she needs to money to do so. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy flour, butter, and other items for developing her new business. She hopes for your mercy and your help. With your support, she can enlarge her new business and earn good profits.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, and other items for developing her new business.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman and has been blessed with 4 children, all of whom attend school. She lives with her husband and children in their own house, which does not have electricity nor piped water.

Bahati has operated a fish selling business for the past year, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. With the 30,000 KES loan, Bahati wants to purchase stock of dried fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her current business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Collettah

texts.en:
Collettah is 58 years old. She is married and blessed with 2 children. She has been in the farming business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

This is Collettah's 2nd loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow. With the increased profits, she plans to expand her farming business to improve production.

Collettah hopes and dreams for better lives for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lona Grace

texts.en:
Lona Grace is 46 years old and married with 7 children.

Lona Grace is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Lona Grace has been raising pigs for the past 15 years, and she has borrowed 16 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Lona Grace is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed mother of 6 children, all of whom are now adults. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past seven years, Fatuma has operated a business selling clothing door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces major challenges in her business, including the high cost of transportation and seasonality. She dreams of expanding her current business and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the 50,000 KES loan she is requesting, Fatuma wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Berta

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 60 años de edad se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos y gallinas, actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años, por lo que cuenta con clientes fijos que adquieren sus productos, obteniendo excelentes ganancias. Ella vive con su hijo de 40 años de edad y sus dos nietas de 14 y 15 años de edad que son su mayor alegría. María desea invertir en mayor cantidad de productos, ya que en época navideña sus ventas aumentan, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: pollos, gallinas, vitaminas, concentrado y vacunas para su granja de pollos y gallinas y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas y ganancias en época navideña.
texts.en: María is a hardworking woman who at age 60 is engaged in the raising and selling of chickens. She has had this business for 6 years, so she has regular customers who buy her products, and she obtains excellent profits. She lives with her 40 year old son and her two granddaughters, aged 14 and 15, who are her greatest joy. María wants to invest in more products, because at Christmastime sales increase, so she is requesting a loan with FUSAI to buy: chickens, hens, vitamins, feed and vaccines for her farm of chickens and hens. Thus she will increase her sales and profits at Christmastime.

loans.use: to buy chickens, hens, vitamins, feed and vaccines for her farm of chickens and hens.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old. She is married with three children.

She has had a dairy farming business for one year. She has requested a loan of Ksh 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya. She will be using the loan to buy animal feed for her cows.

She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children and to buy another cow.

Her hope and dream for the future is to live a happy life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her cows.

loans.name: Khatima

texts.en:
Khatima is a single lady in her mid-30's who runs a business selling clothing. She has run this business for the past 7 years. She works daily from 3pm to 8pm and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Khatima's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to increase her clothing stock and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy to have used her increased profits to repay her loans and cover household expenses.

Khatima really appreciates Kiva's support, which she says has changed her life. With the new loan, she plans to buy the latest clothing styles to sell during the Christmas season. She dreams of further expanding her business. She promises to be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the latest clothing styles to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Muhammadu

texts.en:
Muhammadu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Muhammadu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Muhammadu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Muhammadu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Muhammadu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Muhammadu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike to do business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Bishadini's Group

texts.en:
Bishadini is an older lady standing on the extreme left hand side in the photograph. She hails from a small tribal village in Sonepur, Odisha, India. She is married to a butcher and has two grown-up sons who are continuing their studies in college and a daughter who is unmarried.

With a limited source of income, Bishadini has access to limited resources. She does not have an appropriate toilet at her home for which she has to face a lot of difficulties due to her old age. The absence of a toilet compels her to travel a long distance in order to defecate and urinate in an open field. She feels that this kind of unsanitary practice can hamper her health severely in the long run and she will end up in spending all her savings in the hospital, leaving hardly any savings for her daughter's marriage.

Therefore, Bishadini along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan to build a sanitized and hygienic toilet with all the necessary sanitary fittings attached to it. The loan amount will ultimately help her to increase her convenience and hygiene and lead a healthy disease-free life.

Bishadini is in dire need of your kind help and generous support.

loans.use: to build a sanitized and hygienic toilet with all the necessary sanitary fittings attached to it.

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan is a father of a big family, and with his wife, two daughters and a son lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. Vahan is farming, and on his farm he has cows, calves, a lamb, sheep and chickens. The sale of his farm products, such as milk, meat, macon (a national dairy product), cheeses and eggs, is the only source of income for his large family and its numerous needs.

Since Vahan is the only bread-winner in the family, all the time he is looking for some other way of earning more money for providing better living conditions for his children. This loan can be very helpful and important for his family and his farm, as well. The loan of 690,000 Armenian drams Vahan requests for the purchase of one more cow for his farm and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow for his farm and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 39 years old and married with 8 children, 6 of whom attend school.

Emely is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has raised pigs for the past 5 years and she has borrowed 12 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Emely would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sabeena

texts.en: Sabeena, 31 years old, is a married woman who has three children. Her husband is shown in the photo. He provides painting services in his locality, and earns sufficient income to meet the family's expenses. For the improvement of her husband’s business, Sabeena has sought a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR  to purchase buckets of paint in different colors, along with good quality paint brushes, to cater to the maximum number of customers to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase buckets of paint in different colors, along with good quality paint brushes to cater to the maximum number of customers to increase her income.

loans.name: Manabhangi's Group

texts.en:
Manabhangi is a simple and an innocent lady standing to the extreme right-hand side in the photograph. She is married and is a blessed mother of an 8-year-old daughter who is pursuing her studies in school.

She is a humble resident of an interior tribal village of Sonepur, Odisha, India. The household income of Manabhangi is very low, because of which she does not have access to a toilet at her home. And for this reason, she is bound to depend upon public toilets and open fields in order to relieve herself. She does not find this practice feasible and safe, as she finds herself open to contagious diseases and crimes.

Therefore, Manabhangi, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and hygienic toilet and incorporate steel water pipes in it. Access to a toilet will enhance Manabhangi's convenience, safety and hygiene.

Manabhangi is in dire need of your help and is eagerly awaiting the same.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet and incorporate steel water pipes in it.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
This young man is 22 years old and he lives with his parents and sister in Zovaber village in the Gegharkunik region. Karen has no higher education but thanks to his greatly laborious character, he is already a skilled farmer and takes care of his farm cattle. He is also engaged in land cultivation. On his farm, Karen has calves, lambs, sheep and chickens. Potato cultivation is the main and the greatest part of farming that helps him earn his family's living. His land’s potato, Karen sells both from his farm and at the city’s wholesale market and in both cases, his customers are re-sellers. As he mentions, he is happy and feels great responsibility. Even with hardships, he still manages to cover his family’s needs.

This loan is rather important for his agricultural work and with the 200,000 Armenian, Karen plans to make the purchase of potato seedlings long before the spring sowing activities, as now the purchase is cheaper than it will be at the end of winter.

loans.use: to purchase potato seedlings long before the spring sowing activities, as now the purchase price is cheaper than it will be at the end of winter.

loans.name: Abdulahamid

texts.en:
Abdulahamid is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abdulahamid has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulahamid would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdulahamid can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abdulahamid will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Abdulahamid is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Hae

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Hae. Hae is a housewife who has been blessed with one daughter and her husband, who works at a local private company. She realized that they have to save more money to continuously support their daughter’s education. To help support her family, Hae runs a business selling mobile phone airtime credits and facilitating utility bill payments in her community.

As a stay-at-home mom, Hae has the advantage of selling to her peers, who are mostly housewives in her neighborhood. These customers are getting familiar with mobile phones and the internet, which is a good thing. Hae will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends.

Hae is pictured here and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 41-year-old, working woman who has two children; one of her sons is also shown in the photo.

After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition, so she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education.

Nasreen is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently, she needs a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Mwambisi Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her early 30's is married with three children. She has been running a gengeduka for eight years now. She works from 7 am to 9 pm daily and she's able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the genge and opened a shop famously known as "duka". She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is doing great.

She used the profit to take care of her family, to repay loan,reinvest in business and pay school fees. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the genge duka store. She dreams of expanding her business into a whole selling store.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group Mwambisi which has 2 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: restock the out of stock items

loans.name: Maceline

texts.en: Maceline is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she makes and sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of tailoring materials. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  She will save the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Yantolin

texts.en:
Yantolin joins with Tetus Group as the 8th member. He interested to be part of it because he could get loan access for his business development. Yantolin is 29 year old man and is married to Henderina a 28 year old lady with 2 children under 5 years old. 

As a laborer who works at bricks production house, Yantolin could not produce much money except for his everyday needs. A start up business like selling cakes would enable Yantolin and wife to gain extra income, and that business will be tackled by Henderina. Therefore Yantolin requested a loan totaling to IDR 1,750,000 to Kiva through TLM to realize their plan. When the loan is in his hand he would spend it for wheat flour,cooking oil, kerosene, and other kitchen utilities.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour,cooking oil, kerosene, and other kitchen utilities.

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.en: Bernabe manages a farming business at Solana where his family lives too. He hires laborers who help him do farming activities such as sowing, planting and harvesting rice to sell. He would like to improve crop production that is why he is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides use in farming. This will help improve his crop production and continue gaining productive harvest someday. He will save additional revenue to save fund for family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides use in farming

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a male Kiva borrower. He has 4 children. He operates a car wash business. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy car wash equipment. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy car wash equipment.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana is 44 years old and all five children are in school.

Ana has a general store business in the Philippines. Ana requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Ana has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Ana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rabuia

texts.en:
Rabuia’s is 30-years old married woman living with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore Pakistan. Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years with regularities.  With the passage of time it has been getting depreciated which reached till disposal. His children are growing old and their needs as well. He was worried for many days that how to buy new auto rickshaw so he can abstain from maintenance cost, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw. 
Rabuia has been making savings for many years to buy new auto rickshaw for her husband but at the time of purchasing some money became short. Therefore, Rabuia requested from Kiva's field partner Brac Pakistan loan for her husbands so he can buy new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.  
Rabuia hopes that now her husband would be able to buy new rickshaw and she is thanks to Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw for her husband's transportation services

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en:
Musrat is 40 years old. She is a married woman shown in the photo with her husband. She is a mother of three children. Some years ago, she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Mvazi

texts.en:
Mvazi is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es un señora casada ama de casa que trabaja en ventas por catalogo desde su domicilio para apoyar a su esposo quien trabaja como obrero en una fábrica. Sufre de fuertes dolores en sus molares inferiores ya que presenta una fuerte infección debido a que no se trato a tiempo por la falta de recursos económicos. Necesita un tratamiento regenerativo para evitar la perdida de sus piezas dentales.
texts.en:
She is a married woman and a homemaker. She also works in catalog sales from her home to support her husband who works as a laborer in a factory.

She suffers from intense pain in her inferior molars as she has a bad infection due to not treating it on time. This was due to a lack of financial resources. She needs a regenerative treatment to avoid losing her teeth.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 28 years old. She is a married a single mother, blessed with 2 children.

She has had a M-pesa as well salon business for 5 years, currently earning a monthly income of KSH. 25,000. She has borrowed KSH. 60,000 from VisionFund Kenya, as her second loan after paying the previous loan successfully. 

She will be using the loan to expand her business by purchasing hair products and beauty accessories to sell at the salon. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established mobile banking and salon services and also enjoy a better live with her family."

loans.use: by purchasing hair products and beauty accessories to sell at the salon

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 52 years old and married with three children.

Janet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Janet has been in this business for 13 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Janet aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tweimukye Bukumi Group

texts.en: John is a Ugandan, male aged 57 years, living in Kagadi-Uganda. He is married with 10 children aged between 14 and 36 years. He deals in produce buying and selling to earn a daily income and also earns income from a retail shop, serving the rural people. His dream is to expand his business, make it more stable and educate his 4 children who are still in school. He faces a challenge of bad roads especially during the rainy seasons when the roads are impassable. He wants a loan to buy beans and maize for selling. He is a member of Tweimukye Bukumi Group where members guarantee each other to get credit as they don't pledge physical securities.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for selling.

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Emily is a 40-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Emily has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Emily described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Emily’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una joven que su mayor deseo siempre fue arreglarse los dientes que se encuentran severamente desalineados, por lo que en ocasiones es motivo de burla. Trabaja como empleada doméstica y su esposo es empleado en una fabrica. Desgraciadamente no puede costearse el tratamiento de ortodoncia que necesita. Su deseo es arreglar su dentadura para mejorar su imagen y buscar un mejor empleo.
texts.en:
She is a young woman whose greatest wish has always been to fix her teeth as they are severely misaligned. From time to time she has been teased for this.

She is a domestic worker and her husband is employed at a factory. Unfortunately, she cannot pay for the orthodontic treatment she needs.

Her wish is to fix her teeth so that she can improve her appearance and look for a better job.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una señora pensionada anteriormente se sometió  a un tratamiento para mejorar su salud dental, ahora necesita la  elaboración de una placa dental fija para poder recuperar fuerza en su dentadura, lamentablemente su pensión no le alcanza para solventar la compra de su placa dental y no cuenta con ningún apoyo.
texts.en:
She is a retired woman who previously underwent a treatment to improve her dental health. Now she needs a fixed bridge made to be able to recover the strength of her dentures.

Unfortunately her pension is not enough to cover the cost of the bridge and she does not have any other support.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 40-years old, married woman living with her husband and a child in the area of Rawalpindi,Pakistan. Her husband owns a general store in which he sells shampoo, bath soaps, detergents, biscuits, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, his some relatives like to purchase from his general store. Due to his behavior, he has built up very good relation with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town that is the reason his business running well. But he does not have sufficient stock to cope the demand.

Therefore,Suriya requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, She hopes that lenders will support her and this loan will prove productive for the business as well.She is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle system; she is thankful to the lenders

loans.use: To invest in her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem, who is shown in the photo with her husband, is a hardworking woman.

She has been successfully running a business selling bed sheets and bedspreads for many years. She always has a good collection to offer and has attained a regular list of customers.

Now she wants to grow her business, so she has requested a Murabaha loan of 50,000 PKR to buy more bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs, which will help her to inflate her sales.

Tasleem wishes to spend part of her revenue on her family expenses, and she also wants to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen es una  universitaria de 20 años. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando en una pequeña empresa como secretaria. Ella decidió estudiar la carrera de Administración porque ella considera que es muy importante la toma de decisiones que generen valor económico y social en las empresas. Además de dedicarse a su trabajo y estudios en sus ratos libres le gusta leer libros, revistas y internet para estar muy informada de todo lo que sucede. Comenta que quiere especializarse en Finanzas. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de la universidad. ya se encuentra a 2 años de terminar su carrera. Se siente muy agradecida con los socios de Kiva por ayudarla a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Karen is a 20-year-old university student. Currently she works as a secretary at a small business.

She decided to study toward a degree in administration because she believes that making decisions that lead to financial and social value in business is very important. In addition to dedicating herself to her work and her studies, in her free time she likes to read books, magazines and the internet to keep herself well informed. She mentions that she wants to specialize in finance.

She is requesting a loan to be able to pay for her university fees. She is already two years away from finishing her degree. She is very grateful to the Kiva members for their help in achieving her goals.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
As for many women, it was financial constraints that played an important part in encouraging Shehnaz to approach the Kashf Foundation in search of a loan.

Shehnaz is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of 5 children. In order to support her husband (shown in the photo) in taking care of the family, she began a business selling milk. She owns buffaloes for milking, and she is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated.

Shehnaz has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo in order to inflate her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo in order to inflate her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Janiffer

texts.en:
Janiffer is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Janiffer has been operating a tailoring business for the past three years. She makes women's and men's suits, so her potential clients are both ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth, materials and sewing thread for her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena was living a tough life some years ago; it was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She is 31 years old, married and has been running a business selling milk for many years with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo).

She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation Now, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase her milk sales and earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales and earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.name: Carolyne's Group

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 49-year-old proud mother of seven children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Carolyne has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Carolyne described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.
