With this loan, Carolyne’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nazima

texts.en:
Nazima is a hardworking lady and a 30-year-old married woman. She initiated her business selling milk as it was difficult to run the household activities with only her husband's small income (her husband is shown in the photo). She has buffaloes and cows for milk production, and then her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Nazima’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family.

However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore Nazima has requested 50,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo in order to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo in order to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Nandini's Group

texts.en:
Nandini is an innocent and hardworking lady standing on the extreme right hand side in the photograph. She is married and is a blessed mother of a daughter and two sons. She is a humble resident of an interior tribal village in Sonepur, Odisha, India. The household income of Nandini is very low and for this reason, she does not have access to a toilet at her home. So she is forced to depend upon public toilets and open fields in order to relieve herself. She does not find this practice feasible and safe, as she finds herself open to harmful contagious diseases, crimes and molestation.

Therefore, in order to increase her safety and restore her privacy, Nandini, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean toilet and incorporate steel water pipes in it. Access to a toilet will enhance Nandini's convenience, safety and hygiene.

Nandini is in dire need of your help and is eagerly awaiting the same.

loans.use: to build a clean toilet and incorporate steel water pipes in it

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 47 years old. He is married to Joyce and they are blessed with three children.

He has had a transportation business for 10 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES 25,000.

He has borrowed KES 50,000 from VisionFund Kenya as his fifth loan, after paying his previous loan successfully.

He will be using the loan to purchase spare parts and service his motor vehicle. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful transportation and dairy business as his secondary business and enjoy a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and service his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 30-year-old, married woman shown in the photo with her husband. She has been in the business of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She dreams of a bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou is from Siem Reap province, Cambodia. His dad died when he was 15 and he grew up with a single mother who earns around $1 per day. She takes care of Thou’s nephews and nieces as well while their parents left home to work as construction workers in Thailand. 
Thou is a 24 years old student whose dream is to become an IT manager. He began his first job in 2013 at DDD as a data management operator. He works in the morning and goes to school in the evening. He also uses his free times in the afternoon by working as volunteer in IT work to gain extra experience.
He is grateful to be part of DDD’s work-study program where he receives a partial scholarship for his bachelor degree. However, Thou needs a matching educational loan to help him cover the remaining tuition and earn a degree by end of 2017. 
Thou sees education as very important in life and wants to support his siblings to go to school. Thou hopes to save money for his future business startup in IT field.

loans.use: to complete the his bachelor degree in IT Network Engineering in the next 2 years.

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Kosal is 24 years old from Pursat province, Cambodia. His family earns a living growing rice. Kosal has a dream to become a manager then an entrepreneur. Hence, he needs to continue to higher education and develop his professional skills. However, his family doesn’t earn enough to pay for his higher education. 
Kosal was recruited by DDD to participate in a work-study program where he is a data management operator. Kosal works in the morning at DDD to gain experience and make a modest salary then attends school in the evening followed by studying. Kosal receives partial education scholarship from DDD but this does not cover his entire tuition. With this loan, he will be able to finish his study as a stepping stone in reaching his dream job. Kosal sees the value in education and he hopes to make a good income to send his younger siblings to school.

loans.use: to finish year 2 and year 3 of his bachelor degree in Business Management

loans.name: Dara

texts.en:
At 25 years old, Dara dreams to be CEO of a company. Dara is from a farming family in the rural province of Takeo, Cambodia. He is the oldest of 5 siblings. His family earns about $1 per day for living.

Dara joined DDD work study program as a data management operator (part time job). Dara won an award for public speaking from Pannastra University of Cambodia 2015. He uses his weekends and free time to learn, practice and improve his English. Dara manages his time well by following his clear work and study schedule.

He is proud that he can attend university with a DDD partial scholarship for his bachelor degree to realize his dream. 

To help cover the remaining tuition, Dara needs a matching educational loan for him to earn a degree by he end of 2019.

After graduating, Dara wants to spend his first 5 years as a marketing manager in tourism and eventually reach his life goal as a CEO of his own tourism company.

loans.use: to complete his 1st and 2nd year of his bachelor degree in Entrepreneurship

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, tiene una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 9 años adiconal a eso tambien cosmetologa, bgracias a su trabajo y a sus ventas es como ha podido salir adelante con sus gastos, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young woman's face is pixelated because she is 27 years old and lives in a high risk area. She runs a store out of her home and has been in business for nine years. She is also a cosmetologist. Thanks to her work and sales she has been able to get ahead and cover her expenses.

She lives in her own home with the family. The loan she is requesting is to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. to improve her income and lead a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a 52-year-old woman from Clarin, Bohol. She is married and has three adult children. Her husband is a painter and works hard to make a better living. 

Maxima helps her husband financially by doing a hog-raising business. She successfully started this business five years ago.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feed as well. Maxima is still thinking of other business opportunities that will help augment their livelihood. In the future, she wants to improve her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa e hijos, tiene  una familia unida que se dedican a trabajar para tener un bien común, don José es un hombre que realiza una actividad económica personal para generar ingresos la cual es vender ropa y ofrecer el servicio de transporte en su vehículo personal, su negocio lo tiene desde aproximadamente 5 años por lo que ya es muy reconocida en el lugar donde reside.
Con el capital José podrá pagar el mantenimiento y mejoramiento de su vehículo, de esta manera brindara un servicio seguro y disponible cuando sus clientes lo requieran, espera cubrir otras zonas para atender a nuevos clientes y así incrementar sus ingresos para suplir las necesidades de su familia.
José aspira a ser un buen ejemplo para sus hijos y que estos a su vez sean  hombres de bien en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and children. They are a united family who work for a common good. Jose runs a business selling clothing and also provides transportation services with his own vehicle. He has been in business for approximately five years and is very well-known in the area where he lives.

Jose will use the loan to pay for maintenance to improve his vehicle. This way he can provide safer service and also be available whenever customers need him. He plans to cover other areas to attract new customers and increase his income to cover family necessities.

Jose wants to set a good example for his children so that they will be good citizens in the community.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance to improve his vehicle in order to provide a safer service and be available whenever the customers need him.

loans.name: Rosa Virginia

texts.es: Rosa de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfumes, desde hace 5 años ejerce este oficio y cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para comprar mas mercadería por mayor y asi seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, 53, lives in her own house with her life partner and her two children. She sells clothing and perfumes and has been in business for five years. Because of her many steady customers she is able to keep the business afloat. The earnings from sales are used to cover some of the household expenses.

The customer is requesting a new loan to buy more merchandise wholesale and continue her sales to generate a good profit.

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfume wholesale.

loans.name: Dinora Xiomara

texts.es: Dinora de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pupusas desde hace 20 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con los gastos del hogar,  ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles, tomates, repollos, etc. ya que la va bien en sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Diner is 34 years old and she lives in her own house together with her partner and three children. She has been making a living preparing and selling corn tortillas for 20 years. She has many customers due to her good pricing and kindness when selling. Thanks to her work she has been able to cover the household expenses.

She is requesting again a loan to buy more corn, cheese, pork, beans, tomatoes, cabbages, etc, since she is doing well with her sales and, in this way, she will earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy more corn, cheese, pork, beans, tomatoes, cabbages, etc.

loans.name: Jhannet Deysi

texts.es: Jhannet es una  universitaria de 25 años. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando en una pequeña empresa como asistente del area de contabilidad. Ella decidió estudiar la carrera de Contabilidad porque ella considera que es muy importante los balances, activos, pasivos, patrimonio en todas las empresas. Además de dedicarse a su trabajo y estudios en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar voley. Comenta que quiere especializarse en Finanzas. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de la universidad. ya se encuentra a un año de terminar su carrera. Se siente muy agradecida con los socios de Kiva por ayudarla a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Jhannet, 25, is a university student. She works in a small company as an accounting assistant. She dediced to study Accounting because she believes balances, assets, liabilities, and net worth are important to every company.

Besides her work and studies in her free time she enjoys playing volleyball. She says she wants to specialize in Finance. The loan she has requested is to pay university fees as she is in her last year of studies.

She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for helping her reach her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Inreca

texts.en:
Inreca is a native from the town of Sikatuna. She earns a living by the means of raising and selling hogs. She is a 50-year-old married woman and has four grown children. Her husband is a farmer who grows and sells rice.

For the past year, she has been selling hogs to locals and town settlers in her place. She needs funds to support her existing project. With more income, she could raise and sell quality hogs. She would like to increase the number of livestock in order to improve her income.

Inreca has requested a loan to purchase piglets and feed. These could boost her income, and in a few months she could start to raise quality hogs, which means she will be able to support her family and provide better living conditions.

She is hoping that, someday, she will improve her livelihood and start to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married mother but has no kids. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the 50,000 KES loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lucy's Group

texts.en:
Lucy, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Lucy will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Lucy plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Lucy’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light							.

loans.name: Intego Sub Group B

texts.en:
Speciose, age 48, is the group leader. She is married with four children between 20 and 28 years old. The group is called INTEGO, which means “the goal” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses and buy more items to sell for a better future.

She sells cattle and has been running this business for the past 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cattle for sale. With the profits from the business, she would like to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace mas de 10 años, experiencia que le ha dado la oportunidad de vender una buena calidad de producto por esa razón posee clientes fijos, el cliente está solicitando un crédito ya que necesita comprar las herramientas necesarias para continuar con su trabajo como: trasmallos, redes y darle mantenimiento a la lancha que muestra en la fotografía ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y de ingresos
texts.en:
Carlos, 37, lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has been working in artisan fishing for over ten years. The experience has given him the opportunity to sell a good quality product so he has a steady stream of customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy the tools he needs to continue his work such as trammels and fishing nets, and to pay for maintenance of the boat seen in the photo, since it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy trammels and fishing nets, and to pay for boat maintenance.

loans.name: Iqra

texts.en:
Iqra is 21 years old and a single woman. She is shown in the photo with her mother on the right side. She is a hardworking lady helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy stitching materials such as spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is 32 years old and married with one child. He has had an electrical shop business for five years. 

He will be using the loan to purchase assorted goods. With the anticipated profits, he will be able to improve sanitation in his home and buy more stock. His hopes and dreams for the future are to send his child to university.

loans.use: purchase assorted goods.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
This young man is 27 years old and his name is Gagik. He lives with his nice wife and pretty daughter in the frontier village of Sarigyugh in the Tavsuh region. Nor Horizon is so happy with Kiva lenders who help the families living in the frontier villages of our republic, especially the young families who, despite of a lot of hardships and every day danger, are ready to stay in their native villages and develop their farms.

Gagik works as a contractual serviceman and is also engaged in poultry. He has over 230 chickens on his farm and he sells a lot of poultry, chickens and eggs. He also has a fruit garden and from it he gathers a harvest of nuts, persimmons and figs, which go both for sale and for his family use as well. Gagik decided to ask for this loan of 350,000 Armenian drams because he must repair his hen coop, making it safer and warmer for winter months and he must also buy more chickens for his farm.

loans.use: to repair his hen coop, making it safer and warmer for the winter months and buy more chickens for his farm.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is 40 years old and a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for the last several years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Azra's husband needs to do maintenance for his vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle is not so good. Maintenance for his taxi is required. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do maintenance for his vehicle. Therefore, Azra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Azra's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. In this way, he can provide better transport facilities to earn profitable income..Azra also plans to make savings with the profit of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Azra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband in repairing his taxi.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
In Vanadzor City of Lori Region, Gurgen lives with his wife. Their children are married, and they live with their families. Gurgen has a car of his own, and he gives taxi services in it. He not only drives his taxi in Vanadzor but also transfers people from Vanadzor to Yerevan and from Vanadzor to Georgia as well.

He mentions that he has a lot of regular customers who particularly prefer his taxi among all the other taxis since his car is always clean and he drives very attentively and carefully. People are sure that it is very safe to travel such long distances in Gurgen’s taxi. Gurgen needs this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams as he must buy winter tires and settle gas for his car, which will greatly reduce his waste of petrol use (which is very expensive).

loans.use: to buy winter tires and gas for his car.

loans.name: Zonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Zonia vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda del esposo logran soleventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Zonia lives in a house of her own with her husband and her two children. She has made a living selling personal products for several years. Her business is located in her place of residence. Also, she sells on the streets through the different communities. With the profits obtained and the help of the husband, they manage to pay some household expenses.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, etc., everything wholesale, and thus be able to continue with her work to have better income.

loans.use: for wholesale purchase of perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Pamela's Group

texts.en:
Pamela is 58 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very trustworthy person. Even though Pamela is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group, which was formed by nine farmers in Teso District, Kenya.

Pamela started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, she decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Pamela’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so the group will also receive a total of three solar lights with this loan.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Raibari's Group

texts.en:
Raibari, a lady with seer wit and patience, is the one standing in the middle in the photograph. She is a humble resident of an interior tribal village in Sonepur, Odisha, India. Raibari is married to a farmer and has two sweet daughters in her care. The uncertain source of her income has never allowed Raibari to build a toilet in her house. For this reason, she treks a long distance in order to find a suitable place to relieve herself at odd hours. She does not find this unsanitary practice safe.

Therefore, Raibari along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean, well-equipped and hygienic toilet and attach a commode in it.

This loan amount can save her from harmful contagious diseases and promote cleanliness in the community.She is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support.

loans.use: to build a clean, well equipped and hygienic toilet and attach a commode in it.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is 33 years old. He is married with two children. 

He has had a motorcycle transportation business for two years. He has requested a loan of 118,779 KES from VisionFund Kenya. He will be using the loan to purchase an asset motorcycle for transportation service.

He will use the anticipated profit to repay his loan and to buy clothes for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to live a long life full of happiness.

loans.use: to purchase an asset motorcycle for transportation service.

loans.name: Ginmar Antonio

texts.es: Ginmar de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el tiene un negocio de venta de ropa ubicado en el mercado municipal desde hace 6 años y adicional a eso tambien se dedica al transporte, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas ya que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Ginmar, 39 years old, lives in a house of his own with his wife and his daughter. He has had a business selling clothes, located in the municipal market, for 6 years. In addition to that, he also works in transportation. With what he gets from his work and his sales, he manages to pay some household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy more clothes wholesale to be able to continue with his sales as they generate him good profits.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Intego Sub Group A

texts.en:
Cecile is a 33-year-old group leader. She is married with three children, aged between 3 and 8 years. The group is called Intego, which means “the goal” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses so that they can have more profits and hence have a better future.

Cecile sells foodstuffs and has been running this business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more foodstuffs such as rice, Irish potatoes, and cassava to sell. With the profits from the business, she would like to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more rice, Irish potatoes, and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona d alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de zapatos su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con lo que obtiene ayuda en los gastos del hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su madre y su hermana, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de variedad de zapatos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas  y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young 22-year old man has had his face pixelated because he lives in a high-risk area. He has been working selling shoes in his business located in his home for 6 years. With what he earns he helps with the household expenses. He lives in his own home with his mother and sister. He is asking for a loan to buy a variety of wholesale shoes to be able to continue with his sales and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of wholesale shoes.

loans.name: Las Brisas Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Las Brisas” La cual  está constituida por 06 socios honrados y responsables con deseos de superarse. Este es el caso de Fanny de 41 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica  a la venta de comidas como arroz con pollo pollo broster y muchas variedades más. Hace más de 8 años que se desempeña en dicho negocio.  Su mayor deseo es poder terminar de construir su casa. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de pollo, arroz fideos y verduras. La Alcancía “Las Brisas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitarles este crédito. Fanny  es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
This is the “Las Brisas” group which includes 6 honored and responsible members with wishes of exceeding. This is the case of Fanny who is 41-years old, married and has 3 dependent children. She works selling foods like chicken and rice, fried chicken and many others. She has been working in this business for more than 8 years. Her biggest wish is to be able to finish building her house. She is asking for a loan to buy chicken, rice, noodles and vegetables. The "Las Brisas" group thanks the Kiva investors for providing this loan to them.
Fanny is the first to the left.

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, noodles and vegetables.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José con 42 años de edad,de estado civil casado, vive en casa propia de material rústico,vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 6 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

José es un socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha trabajado con un crédito de S/.1000 el cuál lo realizó con pagos puntuales.Firma con su esposa.
texts.en:
José is 42-years old. He is married and lives in his own home made of rustic material, with his wife and children in the district of Pomahuaca, Jaén province and department of Cajamarca in Peru. He has very good personal and work references from the people in the area. The people who live here mainly work in agriculture, business and livestock.

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee, with an experience of 6 years. The loan that will be given to him will be used in agricultural jobs, applications and incorporations of plant protection products, fertilizers, and to pay labor for his crops. This will help him with the physiological, morphological and productivity improvement of his crops, as well as having a timely harvest and thus a better production and better product quality. Thus, he will not have problems selling his product.

José is a reactivated member of Edpyme Alternativa. He previously had a loan of 1,000 Soles which he carried out with punctual payments. He signs this loan with his wife.

loans.use: in agricultural jobs, applications and incorporations of plant protection products, fertilizers, and to pay labor for his crops.

loans.name: Rabecca's Group

texts.en:
Rabecca is a 37-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Teso District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2015, Rabecca has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Rabecca described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Rabecca’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation				.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал житель Кабадиянского района. Ему 29 лет он женат и имеет детей. На протяжение многих лет он занимается бизнесом. Продает фрукты и миндаль. От этого бизнеса Акмал имеет не плохой доход, что дает ему и его семье возможность строить планы на будущее. Но для осуществления этих планов Акмалу  необходимо купить миндаль, фрукты и расширить свой бизнес. С этим благим намерением он обращается к вам в надежде на понимание.
texts.en: Akmal is a resident of the Qubadiyon district of Tajikistan.  He is 29, married, and a father.  He has been involved in small business for many years, selling fruits and almonds.  He makes a decent income from this activity, which allows him and his family to make plans for the future.  In order to achieve his plans though, Akmal needs to buy more almonds and fruits, so that he can increase his business.  With these goals in mind, he is turning to you and relying on your understanding.

loans.use: to buy almonds and fruits and increase his business.

loans.name: Maria Dinorath

texts.es: Maria de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón asadas desde hace 9 años, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra para tener una vivienda segura.
texts.en: Maria, who is 36 years old, lives in at home with her husband. For 9 years she has made a living from selling roasted cashew nuts, and with the income that she makes from her sales she manages to pay some of her household bills. She wants to improve her home by changing the roof, but as she does not have sufficient resources she is once again applying for a loan in order to buy metal sheets, poles and in order to be able to pay her workforce so that she can have a safe home.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, poles, and to pay workforce.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with six children, none of whom attend school because they are grown-ups. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Maria Miriam

texts.es: La vivienda en la que vive María está hecha de bajareque, pero ella con esfuerzo el repello hace unos años, para mejorarla, y en ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 20 y 15 años de edad. María se dedica a la agricultura, además junto a su compañero de vida cuentan con un taller de mecánica automotriz, lo que le permite salir adelante. María desea mejorar su vivienda, y para ello construirá de cemento y ladrillo las paredes d su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
The walls of Maria's home are made from mud, but she managed to fill emerging cracks with plaster a few years ago in order to improve her house, where she lives with her life-partner and two children who are 20 and 15 years old. Maria makes a living from agricultural work, and together with her partner they also have a car mechanic workshop which allows them to keep moving forwards. 

Maria wants to improve her home, and therefore she will build new walls from cement and brick. For this she is asking for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron in order to build walls for her home.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron in order to build walls for her home.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: La señora Blanca es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella trabaja como comerciante de ropa y su marido destaza ganado. En  la comunidad donde habitan  no hay energía eléctrica y la señora Blanca requiere este sistema de refrigeración para poder guardar las carnes y a la vez para guardar los productos perecederos para el consumo del hogar, este sistema solar de refrigeración será instalado en la casa de habitación y será de gran beneficio para los miembros del hogar, la señora Blanca estaría muy agradecida si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para poder comprar el sistema solar.
texts.en: Blanca is married and has two children. She works selling clothes and her husband butchers livestock. In the community where they live there is no electricity and Blanca needs this refrigeration system to be able to keep the meats and also other perishable products for household consumption. This solar refrigeration system will be installed in her home and will be of great benefit for the household members. Blanca will be very grateful if she is given the opportunity of this loan to be able to buy the solar power system.

loans.use: to buy a solar refrigeration system.

loans.name: Ercilia

texts.es: Ercilia tiene 45 años de edad y vive junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 13 años de edad, que se encuentra estudiando. Ella cada día muestra sus deseos de salir adelante, y su mayor motivación es su familia, por lo que se dedica a la venta de tamales, queso y crema, para sostener a su familia. El techo de la vivienda de Ercilia fue reparado, gracias al crédito otorgado anteriormente, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y ladrillo para construir una fosa séptica, que le permita brindar sanidad a su hogar.
texts.en: Ercilia is 45 years old. She lives with her life's companion and their 13 year old daughter, who is in school. She shows her desire to get ahead every day, and her biggest motivation is her family. She sells tamales, cheese and cream to support her family. The roof on Ercilia's home was repaired thanks to the previous loan, so she is asking FUSAI for another loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron and bricks to build a septic tank, which will allow her to have better hygiene in her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron and bricks to build a septic tank, which will allow her to have better hygiene in her home.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José, es un hombre casado que vive con su esposa, sus hijos ya se independizaron; él tiene una mueblería la cual administra personalmente y la esposa se dedica a atender una funeraria que es de su propiedad, el comenta que aprendió este oficio gracias a su padre, Jose tiene ya 25 años de tener su propio negocio y lo atiende todos los días desde las 7:30 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. 
José solicita un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de madera de diferentes tamaños al por mayor, ya que esto le permitirá cumplir con sus pedidos, ya que en vista que se acerca la temporada navideña y las comerciales le piden bastantes muebles, la inversión le permitirá generar mayores ingresos y poder tener una vida más tranquila para su familia.
José tiene muchos sueños y uno de ellos es poder tener un negocio estable para que la competencia no sea problema, además de poder crecer económicamente junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a married man who lives with is wife. Their children are already living on their own. He has a furniture shop which he runs himself. His wife runs a funeral home that she owns. He says that he learned this trade thanks to his father. Jose has had this business for 25 years and he tends o it every day from 7:30 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

José is asking for a loan to invest in buying wood in different sizes wholesale. This will allow him to fill his orders. The Christmas season is coming and businesses ask him for a lot of furniture. The investment will allow him to generate more income and have a more peaceful life for his family.

Jose has a lot of dreams and one of them is to have a stable business so that the competition won't be a problem. He also wants to grow financially with his family.

loans.use: to buy wood in different sizes wholesale, because this will allow him to fill his orders, since the Christmas season is approaching.

loans.name: Optaciano

texts.es: Optaciano a sus 65 años de edad se dedica al cuido de sus cultivos, lo cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia, lo cual ha realizado toda su vida. Optaciano ha logrado vive con su esposa y su hija de 15 años de edad, a la que buscan la manera de sacar adelante. Él con su crédito anterior construyo un muro en su vivienda, ya que deseaba brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y un inodoro para construir un servicio y fosa séptica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
At 65, Optaciano makes a living caring for his crops, which allows him to support his family. He has done this work all of his life. He lives with his wife and his 15-year-old daughter, who both look for ways to get ahead.

With his previous loan, Optaciano built a wall at his home, which he wanted in order to provide better security for his family. Now he is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and a toilet in order to build a bathroom and a septic tank at his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and a toilet in order to build a bathroom and a septic tank at his home.

loans.name: Rosa Ovilia

texts.es: Rosa de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos (queso, crema, quesillo, requesón) desde hace varios años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia gracias a su trabajo es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas productos lácteos por mayor ya que la va bien en sus ventas y asi podra tener mejores ingresos economcios.
texts.en: Rosa is 62 years old and she lives in her own home with her husband. Rosa has worked selling dairy products (cheese, cream, soft cheese and cottage cheese) for many years. Her business is located in her home. Thanks to her job, she can cover some of the expenses of her home. Rosa is seeking a new loan to purchase more wholesale dairy products because her sales are going well and this way she can obtain better economic earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale dairy products.

loans.name: Ana Gricelda

texts.es: Con 45 años de edad Ana vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos e 14, 12 y 11 años de edad, que se encuentran estudiando con el apoyo de Ana y su compañero de vida. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, por lo que ya cuenta con clientes que esperan de sus productos. Ana desea construir un muro para brindar seguridad a su familia, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava y ladrillo para construir un muro perimetral que le permita brindar mayor seguridad a su familia. Con el crédito anterior Ana coloco láminas nuevas en el área de lavadero y pila.
texts.en:
At 45 years old, Ana lives in her own home together with her spouse and her three children who are 14, 12 and 11 years old and can be found studying with the help of Ana and her spouse. Ana works making hammocks, an activity she has done for 10 years, because of which she can now count on customers who seek out her products.

Ana desires to construct a wall to provide more security for her family. Because of this she is seeking a FUSAI loan to purchase: cement, sand, gravel and bricks to construct a perimeter wall that will provide better security for her family. With the prior loan Ana placed new sheet metal over the laundry area and sink.

loans.use: to purchase: cement, sand, gravel and bricks to construct a perimeter wall that will allow her to provide better security for her family.

loans.name: Leovigilda

texts.en:
Leovigilda is forever grateful for the numerous loans granted to her by KIVA and its lenders to be able to sustain and grow her food business. Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She trusts that you could once again lend her funds in the amount of Php 30000 to buy meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings to cook, sell and serve affordable viands for the masses. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business.

Leovigilda dreams that all her hard work will be rewarded by God and open her second eatery at their nearby town. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies .

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Abizeye Sub Grp A Group

texts.en:
Abizeye is a group led by Sifa, who is 38 years old. The group name means “people with faith” in English. She is married and has five children between 9 and 21 years old. They all go to school.

She sells food and has been in this business for the past five years. The other group members sell various items and they all wish to improve their standards of living.

With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. With the profits from the business, she would like to make savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Abanyamutima Cb Group

texts.en: Ildigard is a group leader, 50 years old. She is married with 9 children aged between 4 and 25 years. The group is called ABANYAMUTIMA which means “careful people” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses for them to have a better future. Ildigard sells clothes and has been doing this business for the past 25 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. With the profits from the business, she would like to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Seruya

texts.en:
Seruya is a 50 years old supporting 8 people in her family.

She has a beauty salon, a business she has been doing for the last 7 years, and gets a monthly income of Kes 35,000.

She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase more stock of cereals for sale at a profit.

She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cereals to sell at a profit.

loans.name: Barakat

texts.en:
Barakat is 31 years old and from Nablus city. He is married and a father of two children. He started his business ten years ago. Barakat chose to take a loan from ACAD to buy new women's accessories for his cosmetic store to increase his capital, and then sell them to customers in Nablus so he can earn some money and improve his family's standards of living.

Barakat says that the two main challenges to his business are the high competition in the market and the high supply of the imported accessories from China. He is looking to expand his store so that he can sell more items and serve more customers. Finally, Barakat would like to thank ACAD and Kiva for letting him share his story.

loans.use: to buy new women's accessories for his cosmetics store

loans.name: Nadejda

texts.en:
Nadejda is a 36-year-old trader from Ungheni, Moldova. She sells potatoes, cabbages, onions and other vegetables in an open air market in Ungheni. Nadejda has been selling for six years and likes very much this occupation. She has a friendly family: a daughter, a son and a husband, Alexandru, who works as constructor in Russia. The income from the sales of vegetables is the financial foundation of Nadejda’s family.

The threshold of the Christmas holiday is approaching, and Nadejda wants to purchase more vegetables and fruits for selling. The demand of these goods will increase in next few weeks and Nadejda will earn more and create a true celebration of Christmas for her family.

This loan will help Nadejda to purchase vegetables and fruits for selling.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruit for selling.

loans.name: Abanyamurava Cb Group

texts.en:
Delphine is a group leader; she is 45 years old. She is married with four children, ages 2 to 17 years, and they all attend school.

The group is called ABANYAMURAVA, which means “HARD WORKING” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses for them to have a better future.

Delphine sells soft drinks and has been running this business for the past seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more soda, juice, milk and water to sell.

She plans to have supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy more soda, juice, milk and water to sell.

loans.name: Ganaheza Cb Sub Grp B Group

texts.en:
Ernestine is a group leader. She is 32 years old and is married with 4 children aged 2 to 8 years. They all attend school. 

The group is called Ganaheza which means “To a Bright Future” in english. They sell different items and they wish to expand their business for them to make more profit. Ernestine owns a restaurant and has been doing this business for the past 4 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more rice, beans and meat to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans and meat to sell.

loans.name: Alexandru

texts.en:
Alexandru is a 39-year-old cable provider from Petresti village, Ungheni region, Moldova. He has worked more years in Russia but one year ago he decided to begin his own business, a cable TV service.

The beginning was very difficult for Alexandru because he didn’t have enough knowledge about TV. But desire and enthusiasm didn't allow him to leave the business. Today, Alexandru has 380 pleased subscribers and their number increase every month. He does not stop there, he wants to expand his business in the neighboring village of Sculeni where there are 400 potential subscribers.

Family income depends largely on his business, and business expansion will lead to improve the financial situation in Alexandru’s family. Alexandru will use this loan to purchase a TV station and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a TV station

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice is a 40-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of nine farmers in Teso District.

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Eunice has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Eunice described her harvest as very good last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Eunice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.5 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Geraldine Cecilia

texts.es: Geraldine tiene 36 años de edad, y habita en casa humilde pero propia, junto a sus dos hijos una niña de 14 años y un varón de 7 años de edad, a los que ha logrado sacar adelante como madre soltera. Ella se gana la vida con la venta de medicamentos naturales, lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Los clientes de Geraldine cada día solicitan mayor cantidad de productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en medicina natural para aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Geraldine, 36, lives in a modest house of her own with her two children, a 14-year-old girl and a seven-year-old boy. She has managed to support them as a single mother. She earns a living selling natural medicines, and this work allows her to get the family ahead.

Geraldine's clients are asking every day for more products. She is therefore requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in natural medicine, so she can increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to invest in natural medicines in order to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 48-year-old married man.

Five years ago, he started his school. His dream is to educate all the children in his community. He believes that quality education is based on school environment and all basic facilities.

Now his school has over 88 students in which 48% are female. In order to improve his school building, he has requested a loan of PKR 120,000. In this way he would be able to build a new room for increasing space. He has worked hard to bring his school to the level it is at today and wants to continue to strive to make his school even better.

Ibrahim is a hard worker and a dedicated educator who aims high for his school.

loans.use: to build a new room to increase space in his school.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a 54-year-old trader from Calarasi-town, Moldova. She works part-time in a café in Calarasi. The salary isn’t enough for her to support the family, that is why Nina began her own business. 

In a local shopping center she sells clothes for men and women. Customers have already known Nina for years. She is always very kind to her customers and has a wide assortment of clothes. The business income is a very good addition for Nina’s family.

Due to the Christmas holidays, the demand will increase in the next weeks and Nina wants to purchase more clothes for selling. Nina will use this loan to buy clothes to satisfy her customers on the eve of winter holidays.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a 38-year-old green grocer shop proprietor in Mariakani, Kenya. 

She is a mother of four children. She has been in this business for the last four years and is doing well.

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She  will use the loan to purchase bananas, oranges, onions, tomatoes and kale. The anticipated profit will be used to educate her children and expand her grocery shop. 

She hopes to own a big grocery shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, oranges, onions, tomatoes, kale.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a 35-year-old woman with five children who has been a milk supplier at Voi Kenya for 8 years.

The business does well and her spouse provides additional income.

This is her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to sustain her business and will use the money to purchase milk to resell.

She hopes to own successful businesses in future.

loans.use: to purchase milk.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 27 years old. He is married and has five children.

He has had a chemist business for one year. He will be using the loan to purchase antibiotic syrups for children, e.g. paramox and amoxil and hopes this will help him to pay school fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase antibiotic syrups, such as paramox and amoxil, for children.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 20-year-old single man who supports a sister.

He has had a salon business in Kariakor for two years and earns a monthly income of 11,000 KSH.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and he intends to buy more braids, weaves, hair chemicals, treatments, and a drier.

He plans to save money and repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy  braids, weaves, hair chemicals, treatments,  and a drier.

loans.name: Abizeye Sub B Group

texts.en:
Abizeye is a group led by Angelique, who is 41 years old. The group name means “people with faith” in English.

She is married and has two children, age 14 and 17 years. They both go to school.

She owns a dairy and she has been doing this business for the past four years. The group members sell various items and they all share an idea of working hard to have a better future.

With the loan, she would like to buy more milk for sale. With the profits from the business, she would like to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman blessed with five children, all attend school. They live at their own house that is without electricity and running water.

She has operated a home-based fish selling business for five years and sells to restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

She will use the loan to purchase bundles of fish to resell. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish.

loans.name: Juanita Jorleny

texts.es:
juanita, madres soltera con tres hijos menores de edad, es originaria del sauce, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte de la region, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superacion personal, en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compania de sus hijos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos economicos no pudo estudiar y se vio en la obligacion de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, en la actulidad lucha dia a dia para brindarles un futuro mejor y cumplir sus sueños y metas.

gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad economica la venta fritanga ( comida casera) la cual desempeña de forma ambulante ayudada por un pequeño carreton de mano   el negocio le dedica unas  doce horas diarias de las preparacion hasta la venta del mismo como: tacos, maduros, gallo pinto, tajadas, manuelitas, enchiladas , refresco naturales etc. el objetivo del credito es invertir en productos comestibles para la preparacion de la fritanga, aumentar la clientela y en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ganancias. Juanita agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como es Nicaragua paraa tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juanita is a single mother with three underage children from Sauce, located to the north of the region. She is hardworking, responsible and determined to succeed. In her free time she enjoys the company of her children.

 Unfortunately she was not able to study due to a lack of financial resources and had to work in order to help out with household expenses. She fights every day to provide a better future and to fulfill her dreams and goals.

Thanks to a will to succeed she works selling fritanga (homemade food) as a street vendor, with the help of a small cart. She usually works about twelve hours a day, preparing and selling food: tacos, bananas, rice and beans, fried plantains, crepes, enchiladas, refreshments, etc. 

The purpose of the loan is to invest in food products for the preparation of fritanga, to increase her clientele and to obtain better profits in the near future. 

Juanita is grateful for the help Kiva investors provide to people of limited resources and from poor countries, like Nicaragua, in achieving dignified means of employment.

loans.use: to buy food products for the preparation of fritanga.

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen

texts.es:
REYNA DE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD,CASADA CON DOS HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, ES ORIGINARIA DE MANAGUA, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL,  EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHA DIA DIA PARA SALIR ADELANTE CON SU FAMILIA, Y BRINDALES UN FUTURO  MEJOR A SUS HIJOS, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO PUDO ESTUDIAR PERO LE HUBIER GUSTADO ESTUDIAR ENFERMERIA PROFESIONAL, EN LA ACTULIDAD SUS METAS Y OBJETIVO ES BRINDARLES UN FUTURO MEJOR A SUS HIJOS Y PROPORCIONARLES MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA.

GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UN SALON DE BELLEZA EL CUAL LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION, ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DIEZ HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS SERVICIOS, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA COMO TINTES, RUBOR, UÑAS ACRILICAS, ALISADOS, SOMBRAS, RUBOR, PINTURAS DE UÑAS, ETC.
texts.en:
Reyna, age 43, is married and has two minor children. She is from Managua. She is known for being hard-working and responsible with the desire for personal improvement. She struggles every day in order to get ahead with her family and to provide her children with a better future. Unfortunately, she was not able to go to school due to the lack of financial resources. However, she would have liked to have studied to be a nurse.

Her current goals and objectives are to provide a better future for her children and to give them better living conditions. Thanks to her desire to get ahead, she has a business activity, a beauty salon. It is located at her house. She works ten hours a day providing her services.

The objective of the loan is to invest in beauty products like dyes, blush , acrylic nails, straighteners, eye shadow, and nail polish, etc.

loans.use: to buy beauty products like dyes, body waves, coloring, straighteners, and highlights.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 32-year-old mother from Siaya,Kenya. She is a widow and supports three children aged 20, 12 and 10.

She has operated a retail shop for four years and earns a monthly income of 9,000 KES.

She is taking out her 3rd loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase sugar, cooking oil, maize flour, and soap. She will use the anticipated profit to increase her stock.

Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, bars of soap, and other  items.

loans.name: Neysa Deana

texts.en:
Neysa Deana, 27 years old, is from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Her life partner is Lione, a factory worker. The couple make a living to meet their needs.

Neysa has operated a tricycle service for three years. A tricycle is a motorcycle with a side car that carries four passengers. It is a common means of transportation in the Philippines and serves as a taxi for short distance travel.

Proper and regular maintenance of her tricycle is necessary to ensure efficient and safe service. She will use 15000 PHP to repair the tricycle which will support good performance of her unit and a steady income.

Neysa Deana's simple dream is to acquire another tricycle unit and lead a stable life. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to repair her tricycle.

loans.name: Jalaki's Group

texts.en:
Jalaki, standing to the left in the photograph, is a differently abled lady living with her husband and a son who is 15 years old.

She is engaged in the activity of weaving handkerchiefs and saris (Indian traditional dress for women). Her husband helps her with the weaving.

The financial condition of her family is not so good. She brings materials like cotton, thread and colors from a dealer and gives back the finished goods to him. In return, she gets only the labor cost, which is very little.

She has a plan to buy materials directly from the market and sell back the finished product in the market. Doing this will increase her income.

She and her group member have requested a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase materials for weaving handkerchiefs and saris. She wants to develop her business and provide a better living style for her family. She also wants to save some money for her family’s future and see her son go to a good college.

Jalaki is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase materials for weaving handkerchiefs and saris.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman blessed with one young child. They live at their own house that is without electricity and running water.

She has operated a home-based fish selling business for over three years to sell to restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

She will use 30,000 KSH to purchase bundles of fish to resell. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish.

loans.name: Surya' S Group

texts.en:
Surya, a lady with immense patience and perseverance, is the one standing in the middle in the photograph. She is a humble resident of a interior tribal village of Sonepur, Odisha,India. Surya is married to a carpenter and has a daughter in her care.Their uncertain source of income has never allowed Surya to build a toilet in her house.For this reason she treks a long distance in order to find a suitable place to relieve herself at odd hours. She does not find this unsanitary practice safe. She can sense the risk of getting bitten by insects and feels exposed to crime.

Therefore, Surya, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan in the amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan to build a clean, well-equipped and hygienic toilet and attach a latrine pan to it.

This loan can protect Surya from harmful contagious diseases and promote cleanliness and safety in the community. She is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support.

loans.use: to build a clean, well-equipped and hygienic toilet and attach a latrine pan to it.

loans.name: Rabiú

texts.en:
Rabiú is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Rabiú has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rabiú would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rabiú can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Rabiú will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Rabiú is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to  eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 45-year-old married woman blessed with 4 children. She is married to Samson, a businessman.

She has had a farming business for 10 years and earns 35,000 KSH each month. She requests 50,000 KSH from VisionFund Kenya as her second loan after successfully repaying the previous.

She will use the loan to purchase a motorcycle.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established farming business and enjoy a better live with her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Ganaheza Cb Sub Grp A Group

texts.en:
Bernadette is a group leader, 43 years old. She is married and has five children between 7 and 18 years old. The group is called Ganaheza, which means “Bright Future” in English. The members sell various products and they wish to expand their businesses and hence have a better future.

Bernadette owns a shop and has been running this business for the past 15 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more soap, sugar, biscuits, salt and rice to sell. With the profits from the business, she would like to improve her standard of living and make savings.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, biscuits, salt and rice to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Isabel

texts.es:
Silvia, nuevamente solicita un crédito para poder aprovechar la temporada navideña y lo hará con la compra de pollos para engordar y luego venderlos, de esta manera abastecerá a sus clientes y mantendrá la fuente de ingresos funcionando.
Ella dice que el crédito anterior le fue de gran ayuda ya que pudo fortalecer su negocio, incremento su inventario y pudo percibir buenas ganancias que le permitieron mejorar la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar. Las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar se mantienen pero las condiciones económicas han mejorado en gran manera.
texts.en:
Silvia is requesting a loan once again. She is doing so in order to be able to take advantage of the Christmas season. She will buy chickens to fatten and sell. This way she will supply her customers and keep her source of income in operation.

She says that the previous loan was a big help because she was able to strengthen her business and increase her inventory. She was also able to get good earnings, which allowed her family to improve its quality of life. Her family's living conditions remain the same, but their financial situation has greatly improved.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a single woman with one school-aged child. She owns a house that is without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Maria operates a vegetables stall at the market. She faces a challenge of competition in her place of operation.

She wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Kabita's Group

texts.en:
Kabita is the 53-year-old lady standing on the extreme left in the photograph. She hails from a village of Sonepur, Odisha, India.This humble lady has a family of six. Kabita is a farmer by trade and cultivates paddy and maize in her small piece of land. Her husband, being an elderly person, is often ill and is not able to work regularly anymore. So, Kabita is the only breadwinner in her family.

Kabita has two daughters. Her elder daughter got married three years ago and her younger daughter is continuing her studies. After meeting the daily household expenses and the medical expenses of her husband, Kabita is hardly able to save any money.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan in the amount of 45,000 INR. Kabita will utilise her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees for her daughter's banking course. The loan amount will help her daughter complete her education smoothly and will help her in getting a good job with a pretty good package so that she can upgrade her living standard.

Kabita is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to pay the course fees of her daughter's banking course

loans.name: Chandrakanti's Group

texts.en:
Chandrakanti is a newly married, charming lady standing in a orange saree on the extreme right hand side in the photograph. She is a humble resident of a tribal and interior village of Sonepur, Odisha, India.She lives with her husband who is a grocer in a shop near her house. With a limited income, Chandrakanti finds it hard to build a toilet in her house. She depends upon a open field to attend to nature's call. She does not find this unsanitary practice safe.

Therefore, Chandrakanti, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean, well-equipped and hygienic toilet and attach sanitary fittings.

This loan amount can protect Chandrakanti from harmful contagious diseases and promote cleanliness in the community. She is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support.

loans.use: to build a clean, well-equipped and hygienic toilet and attach sanitary fittings.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a maize farmer from Garibi village. As a Babban Gona member, Moses is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Moses would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Moses can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Moses no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per Hectare of land, Moses hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Trinh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs.Trinh, born in 1984, is a Thai ethnic woman. She has been in the program of M7-MFI since January 2013. Her family consists of four members, including her husband, her son, and her daughter living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, and the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family. She wants to expand the breeding by raising chickens but she does not have enough money to invest in the breeding. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
She hopes that the loan amount will help her family develop the breeding model well and all members of her family will have better living conditions. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to expand the breeding by raising chickens.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Rosa Mercedes estudio una carrera técnica hizo un curso de corte y confección  realiza trabajos dentro de su casa en una pequeña maquina antigua que es a pedal. Requiere del préstamo de dinero para la compra de máquinas de coser   como ser una zigzag, maquina costura recta y una maquina surfiladora de esta manera poder emprender su negocio y abrir un taller donde las personas puedan conocer su trabajo y poder tener mejores ingresos, la señora comenta que los ojales (cueros)sor filados los hace a mano y tarda más tiempo, la maquinaria le ayudaría en gran manera ya que son eléctricas y son rápidas y el tiempo lo ocuparía haciendo nuevas prendas comenta que a fines de año hay más demanda en el área de costura donde las personas requieren más servicio y contando con la maquinaria va poder realizar los trabajos la Sra. Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y responsable de estado civil soltera tiene un hija y se siente capaz de realizar sus metas a futuro teniendo su nueva maquinaria.
texts.en:
Rosa Mercedes studied for a technical profession. She took a course on tailoring and dressmaking and works from home using a small, old, pedal-operated sewing machine. She needs this loan to buy sewing machines such as a zigzag machine, a straight-stitch machine and a seam-sewing machine, to establish her business and open a workshop where people can discover her work and she can increase her income.

She says that she makes buttonholes (leather) by hand, which takes longer, and the machines would be of great help to her as they are electrical and work quickly. She would use the time to make new items of clothing. She says that there is higher demand for tailoring towards the end of the year, when people need more services, and that if she has the machines she will be able to do this work.

Rosa is a hard-working, responsible single woman with a daughter. She believes she will be able to meet her goals in future when she has these new machines.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine (zigzag, straight-stitch and a seam-sewing machine) to provide a variety of products and so generate more income for her family.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Manal from Tulkarem city. She is a widow and has two children. Manal used to work in salons for other employers for daily wages. After nine years of experience, she sold some of her gold jewelry to have some capital and open her own salon.

Manal has a success story with ACAD, previously completing one loan, and now she has requested this loan to prepare and renovate her beauty salon.

The two main challenges for Manal's business are having too many competitors in this market, and the seasonality of the work. Manal hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve and expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to prepare and renovate her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mayra Isabel

texts.es: Mayra es una madre soltera de 34 años de edad que trabaja desde su vivienda ubicada en un barrio del municipio de Malambo, ella se dedica a la peluquería y expende productos de belleza entre ellos tintes, shampoo, tratamientos capilares, mascarillas hidratantes, esmaltes, polvos y maquillajes profesionales. Su única hija de 16 años se encuentra cursando estudios académicos y es su motor motivacional para emprender nuevos retos y propuestas que permitan un crecimiento profesional en su carrera como estilista.
