Mayra es muy entregada a su negocio, ella diariamente apertura a las 8 a.m. y cierra a las 8 p.m., sin embargo en la temporada navideña su horario de atención es más extendido al recibir mucha más clientela de lo acostumbrado, es por ello que su inventario debe ser mayor y realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar productos de belleza de alta rotación como aliceres, queratinas, shampoo, masajes, cepillos y esmaltes. Mayra a futuro desea mejorar la imagen de su negocio y su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mayra is a single mother, aged 34 years, who works from home in a neighbourhood of Malambo municipality. She works as a hair-dresser and sells beauty products, including dyes, shampoo, hair treatments, hydrating masks, nail polishes, powders and professional make-up. Her only daughter is 16 years old and is taking academic courses, and she is the main motivation for Mayra to take on new goals and proposals to allow professional growth in her career as a stylist.

Mayra is very involved with her business. She opens it at 8 a.m. every day and closes at 8 p.m. However, her working hours are longer in the Christmas season, as she has many more customers than usual. For this reason, she needs a larger inventory and requested a Kiva loan, an opportunity to connect financial life through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy beauty products with high turnover such as straighteners, keratin products, shampoo, massages, brushes and nail polishes.

In future, Mayra wants to improve her business's image and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products with high turnover such as straighteners, keratin products, shampoo, massages, brushes and nail polishes.

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es:
La Sra. Benigna se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo el Sr. Justino, ambos trabajan en la agricultura hace 10 años en sus terrenos agrícolas donde cultivan papa, trigo y tarwi en pequeñas parcelas. Tienen dos hijos dependientes de sus ingresos.
En la comunidad donde trabajan los terrenos cuentan con riego para la producción agrícola, pero por falta de recursos económicos a la Sra. Benigna y su esposo no les alcanza el dinero para comprar mayor cantidad de semillas y abonos para así cultivar en mayor cantidad, puesto que lo que cultivan solo les alcanza para el sustento de su familia y no tienen para invertir, a veces los señores tienen que trabajar de jornaleros en otros terrenos. El esposo de la Sra. Benigna también se dedica a trabajar como ayudante de albañil cuando termina la temporada de cosecha y siembra. Por estos motivos mencionados la Sra. Benigna necesita de la ayuda para poder comprar semilla de papa y abono orgánico y así poder sembrar en mayor cantidad y mejorar su economía y poder brindar un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Benigna works in agriculture together with her husband, Justino. They have both worked in agriculture for ten years. They work small parcels of land where they grow potatoes, wheat, and 'tarwi' [chocho beans]. They have two children who are dependent upon their income. The land in the community where they work has irrigation for agriculture production.

However, due to the lack of financial resources, Benigna and her husband do not have enough money to buy a greater quantity of seeds and fertilizer to cultivate in greater quantity. Given that their crops are only enough for family sustenance, they do not have anything to invest. At times they have to work as day workers on other land. Benigna's husband also works as a bricklayer's assistant at the end of the planting and harvesting seasons.

For these reasons Benigna needs the help in order to be able to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer. This way she will plant a larger quantity, improve her finances, and be able to provide a better future for her son.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer to plant in greater quantity and improve her finances in order to provide her family with a better future.

loans.name: Victorious Mixed School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Kate. She is the Head Teacher of Victorious Mixed Day & Boarding School, a mixed school in the urban area of Hoima with 850 students. Victorious Mixed Day & Boarding School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Victorious Mixed Day & Boarding School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Kate ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
For the past five years, Cecilia has raised hogs to cater for the needs and expenses of the entire household. She is a resident in the town of Corella. She is a 42-year-old, married woman and has six children; three of them are still attending school.

She sells to the locals and town settlers in her place. Hog raising is a lucrative business in her place; that is why she decided to join CEVI to access loans. Cecilia has requested a loan to invest in pig feed and supplements.

She would like to boost her earnings by raising more quality hogs and having sufficient supply of feeds to become sustainable. Slowly, she could be able to set aside enough savings to invest in any business opportunities.

In the future, Cecilia is looking forward to having a stable source and extends thanks for the support.

loans.use: to invest in pig feed and supplements.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village. As a Babban Gona member, Hajara is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hajara would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Hajara can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hajara no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Hajara hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Benkadi N°1 Group

texts.fr:
Marie est la dame qui  tient le bélier par ses cornes sur la photo. Marie fait l’élevage des moutons est   mariée, mère de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons et 02 filles.  Ses enfants sont âgé de 05 à 12 ans dont 02 fréquentent l’école.
Marie apporte beaucoup à sa famille c’est une cliente solvable qui s’est toujours bien comporte, Elle fait recourt au RMCR depuis 08 ans. Son mari fait l'agriculture et le petit commerce.
Marie achète ses  moutons dans les marchés environnants et revend dans les mêmes marchés.   Le profit généré  la permet  de prendre en charge entre autre  les frais scolaires, médicaux, l’habillement et l’alimentation de la famille
Marie rencontre souvent le problème de  mévente de ses moutons, mais malgré tout elle arrive à en sortir.  Dans l’avenir Marie souhaite avoir un montant plus élevé pour acheter beaucoup plus de moutons afin d’accroitre son profit.
texts.en:
Marie is the woman who is holding the ram by the horns in the photo. She raises sheep, is married, and is the mother of four children, two boys and two girls. Her children are aged from 5 to 12 years. Two of them attend school.

Marie brings in a great deal for her family; she is a solvent client who has always shown appropriate behavior. She has been coming to RMCR for eight years. Her husband is a farmer and does small-scale trading.

Marie buys her sheep in surrounding markets and resells them in the same markets. The profit she makes allows her, among other things, to cover school fees, medical expenses, clothing and food for the family.

Marie is often challenged by poor sales of her sheep, but she always manages. In future, she would like to borrow a higher amount so as to buy more sheep and grow her profit.

loans.use: to buy sheep, raise them, then sell them.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 30 years old. He is single, but supports three dependents.

Joseph sells phone accessories, a business he has done for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Joseph has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 45,000, which he will use to add stock of phone accessories.

With the anticipated profits, Joseph will be able to repay his loan as well as restock his business. His hope and dream for the future is to prosper in his business.

loans.use: to add stock of phone accessories.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Idiris

texts.en:
Idiris is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Idiris has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Idiris would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Idiris can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Idiris will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Idiris is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and his family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Luwazi Group

texts.en:
Faida is 20 years old and married. Her husband works as a sawyer. She has one child and five relatives that depend on her.

Faida owns a fish-selling business. She started her business with the aim of paying school fees for her children and owning a good house. She would like to use this loan to buy more fish, bananas, flour, and cooking oil to stock up her business. The profits from the business will enable her to provide for her family. Two of her family members helps with the activities of the business.

Faida would like to see her children finish getting their education and she would also like to buy an engine boat for fishing.

loans.use: to buy more fish, bananas, flour, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Umoza Group

texts.en:
Dameless is 60 years old and widowed. She provides for her two children, two orphans, and two others.

Dameless owns a fish business and a farming business. She has requested this loan to buy more fish for her fish business. The profits from the business will help her to provide household necessities for her family. She started her business to support her family financially since she lost her husband.

Her plan is to build rental houses and also to acquire a machine for processing tinned fish.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Mama's Love Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thùy is 30 years old and she is married with 4 children.

She has operated a food stallt selling fish for 6 years.
Thùy lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Thùy faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

In 2012, Thùy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thùy has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the "Mama's love" group, which consists of 5 members.
With her business profit, Thùy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school and for her business to do well.
The child's mother in the photo is a member in this group, she agree to post her child's photo in Kiva's website.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 20 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Bulus

texts.en:
Bulus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Bulus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Bulus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Bulus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Bulus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Bulus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Mahauta Gimba village. As a member of Babban Gona, Ibrahim is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Ibrahim is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Phibi

texts.en:
Phibi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Phibi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

As a Babban Gona member, Phibi will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Phibi is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Khawlah

texts.en: Khawla is an ambitious woman who wanted to have her own tailoring workshop but was not able ‎to have that because of her family’s financial situation. So she postponed the idea and then ‎decided to start on a small scale at home doing small jobs till she can stand on her own feet. ‎Khawla bought a sewing machine and start doing basic tailoring and sewing work for her friends ‎and neighbors. Now she is applying for a loan to help her buy some fabric in order to do more ‎clothes tailoring work and expand the business to include tailoring bed mattresses. ‎

loans.use: to help her buy some fabric in order to do more ‎clothes tailoring work

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Elisha has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

As a Babban Gona member, Elisha will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Elisha is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer from Waziri village. As a Babban Gona member, Maryamu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land, Maryamu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer from Gidan Samaila village. As a Babban Gona member, Maryamu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Maryamu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Maryamu hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: St. Michael High School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Richard. He is the Head Teacher of St. Michael High School, a mixed school in the urban area of Sonde in Mukono with 700 students. St. Michael School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Michael School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Richard ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Manasseh

texts.en:
Manasseh is a maize farmer from Gidan Samaila village. As a Babban Gona member, Manasseh is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Manasseh would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Manasseh can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Manasseh no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Manasseh hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Joshua

Joshua is a maize farmer from Masama village. As a Babban Gona member, Joshua is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Joshua would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Joshua can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Joshua no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Joshua hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Styopa

texts.en:
Styopa is 47 years old and he with his wife and two school-aged sons live in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. Styopa used to work as a driver, then he regularly left for an abroad works in Russian Federation but now he is only farming. Styopa has s rather great variety of cattle, so correspondingly a lot work to do in it. As he mentions he used to do all the work with great pleasure and easily, until his health problems started and till today it greatly limits his active work about his farm and makes him feel rather week.

This loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams Styopa asks since he must pass a medical exam and after also a course of treatment at the hospital for the control of his health state.

loans.use: for passing a medical exam and also a course of treatment at the hospital for the control of his health state.

loans.name: Ikirezi Sub Group A

texts.en:
Patricie is a group leader; aged 44.She is married with 4 children aged between 4 and 13 years. The group is called IKIREZI means “Good people” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

She sells cattle and she has been running a business for 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cattle for selling. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for selling.

loans.name: Rashila

texts.en:
Rashila is maize farmer from Makwala village. As a member of Babban Gona, Rashila is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rashila would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Rashila can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Rashila is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family, and in the end, hopes to use her increased earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jp Inusa

texts.en:
JP Inusa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, JP Inusa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, JP Inusa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, JP Inusa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, JP Inusa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. JP Inusa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Addaú

texts.en:
Addaú is a maize farmer from Chediya village. As a member of Babban Gona, Addaú is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Addaú would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Addaú can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Addaú is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to buy maize-grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: 28 летный начинающий бизнес мен Алишер. Он родился и вырос в семье дехканов. Его дедушка и отец занимались сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Алишер решил идти по стопам родителей и сохранить их деятельность. Он построил новый и большой коровник для выращивания скотов. Алишер хочет взять кредит для купли несколько скота и поскорее начать деятельность. С такими планами он обратился за кредитом.
texts.en: Alisher is a 28-year old beginning businessman. He was born and raised in a family of farmers. His grandfather and father did agricultural work. Alisher decided to follow their example and continue this business. He has built a new big cowshed. Alisher would like to take out a loan to buy several heads of cattle and launch his business as soon as possible. With these plans he has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Djafar

texts.en:
Djafar has been in the manufacturing business for many years. He is enjoys doing his business. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from the region of Fuzuli, but he lives in Baku city with his family. He needs his third loan in the amount of 1900AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Djafar has applied to Komak company.

With this loan he wants to buy materials and necessary machine for improving his business, which is preparing stone facing for walls. He says he is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help. This is his second loan.

loans.use: to buy the necessary machine and materials for preparing stone facing for walls.

loans.name: Manizha

texts.en:
Manizha is a bright and beautiful girl. She is studying at the university with good and excellent marks. She is a fourth-year student. She is studying very well. She wants to become the best specialist. Her favorite subjects are history, chemistry and psychology. She participates in a lot of circles.

The financial condition of her family is not good. Her parents are workers and have a small salary. It’s hard for her to pay the tuition of the university. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 somoni with this aim. She hopes with your help she will pay for the tuition of the university.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition.

loans.name: Davlatmurod

texts.en:
Davlatmurod is a bright and capable boy. He is married and is studying at the university, with good and excellent marks. He is the first year student. He wants to become the best specialist. He is studying for degrees in chemistry and psychology.

The condition of his family is so bad. It’s hard for him to pay the contract for University. He is asking for a loan of 6000 Somoni with this aim. He hopes with you help and support, he will pay the contract at the University.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for BSc. degrees in Chemistry and Psychology.

loans.name: Ayimkhol

texts.en:
Ayimkhol is widowed. She is a head of dehkan (individual or family) farm. She is a very kind and responsible woman. She has five children. Ayimkhol always tries for the well-being of her children, and she is the only breadwinner of the family.

Ayimkhol has been busy with growing vegetables for more than four years. She grows different kinds of vegetables. She wants to enlarge the harvest for the next year. She needs seeds and fuel.

She will spend her loan on buying cottonseeds, wheat seeds, potato seeds, rice seeds and fuel; that’s why she needs the money. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni with this aim.

She hopes for your help and your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fuel for new sowing season.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn has received and fully paid a number of loans in the past and is thankful that they have helped sustain her direct selling of personal products business. Her income enables her to save and assist her family's needs.

Jennelyn has gone into buying and selling different kinds of kitchen and household appliances and is now doing quite well. She hopes you can again grant her a PHP 15,000 loan to pay for flat irons, electric fans, rice cookers, stoves, blenders, etc. She thanks KIVA and its supporters for supporting her business. As a single woman she highly appreciates the help.

Jennelyn dreams to put up her own store to display the appliances that she sells. She trusts that God will continue to bless and guide her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy home appliances to resell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Julia y su esposo, viven en Cochabamba provincia chapare, tienen 40 y 41 años de edad respectivamente de estado civil concubinos, económicamente son independientes, ambos se dedican a la actividad de agricultura siembran papa y papaliza, para la venta de sus productos cuenta con un mercado consolidado la feria semanal de Colomi, La señora Julia requiere el préstamo para la compra de 1 cabeza de ganado vacuno lechero, debido a que sus ahorros lo invirtieron en la compra de insumos agrícolas.                                                                                                                                                                       Por último, la señora Julia y su esposo se sintieron contentos al tener la oportunidad de acceder al préstamo, además de poder contar con nuestra ayuda porque con la compra de abono orgánico y productos agroquímicos podrán obtener un mejor ingreso y incrementará su patrimonio familiar y de esa manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia hacia futuro.
texts.en:
Julia and her husband are 40 and 41 years old. They live together in the Chapare Province of Cochabamba. They are financially independent and both work in agriculture growing potatoes and papalizas (a root crop that is common in the Andean region of South America). They sell their products in the community market at the Colomi weekly market fair.

Julia needs this loan to buy a milk cow because she uses her savings to buy supplies.

Julia and her husband were happy to have this opportunity to obtain a loan and to count on our help as well because by buying organic compost and agrochemical products they can bring in more income and increase their family holdings and, in turn, improve their family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow so she can improve production and sales and thus generate a better income for her family.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 53 years old. He is married with 7 children.

He has had a motorcycle transportation business for 5 years. He has requested a loan of Ksh 30,000 from Vision Fund Kenya. He will be using the loan to purchase spares pads for his motorcycle and to pay mechanic for doing the service.

He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children and to improve his housing structure.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to live a successful life together with his family.

loans.use: to purchase spares brake pads for his motorcycle and to pay  the mechanic for doing the service.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melanie is 32 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Melanie has a "buy-and-sell" banana business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Narcesta

texts.en:
Narcesta works hard to support her family. Narcesta is single, 45 years old, and has a business buying and selling rice grain in the Philippines.

Narcesta requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

Narcesta has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Narcesta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik is 80 years old and he lives with his beloved wife in Kapan city of Syunik region. Edik many years worked at the Kadjaran city combine as a mechanic. At the same combine his wife used to work as an accountant. Now both of them are unemployed and they are pensioners. Edik became engaged in agricultural works especially in gardening. He has a lot of apple, pear and persimmon trees in his orchard. He is also specialized in swine breeding. He has pigs and piglets in his farm and he sells a lot of pork to city butchers.

Edik mentions that he is happy with his farm work, since having no other occupation he does all the work needed with great pleasure and care, of course with the help of his beloved wife. Now this loan of 250.000 Armenian drams Edik asks as he must buy fodder for his pigs and he needs to provide his pigs with as much fodder for winter as possible.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his pigs and he needs to provide his pigs with as much fodder possible for winter

loans.name: Alh. Dogara

texts.en:
Alh. Dogara is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alh. Dogara has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Dogara would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alh. Dogara can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Dogara will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alh. Dogara is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Cessiri N°2 Group

texts.fr:
Daouda est le monsieur qui a sa main levé  sur la photo. Daouda  est un cultivateur  malien, âgé de 41 ans, marié et père de 05 enfants âgées de 12 ans à 06  ans  dont  01 fréquente l’école coranique. Sa conjointe fait le ménage et le petit commerce, c’est un client solvable du RMCR.
Daouda fait l’élevage de bœuf  depuis  06 ans. Il  s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants  et revend  dans les mêmes marchés, parfois il envoie ses animaux dans les marchés lointains. Le profit qu’il réalise lui permet de  subvenir aux  besoins de sa famille (sante, éducation et habillement).
Il  emprunte de l’argent auprès de RMCR pour financer et accroitre son activité d’élevage bovin au moment propice afin d’accroitre son profit. 
Daouda est  souvent confronté au problème de mévente de ses bovins au marché, il  souhaite  amené  lui-même ses  animaux au marché lointain c’est pourquoi il souhaite  avoir un prêt plus  élevé  pour acheter plus de bœufs afin d’accroitre ses révénus.
texts.en:
Daouda is the one raising his hand in the photo. He is a Malian farmer, 41 years old, married and the father of five children ranging from six to 12 years of age, one of whom attends an islamic school. His spouse takes her of the household and works as a vendor. Daouda is a creditworthy customer of RMCR. He has been raising cattle for six years. He stocks up at the nearby markets and also resells there. Sometimes he forwards his cattle to more distant markets. 

His revenue allows him to provide for family needs (healthcare, education and clothing). He borrows from RMCR in order to finance and develop his cattle business at the right moment to increase his profit. Daouda's challenge is slow sales. He would like to bring his animals to the distant markets himself, which is why he is seeking a larger loan to buy more cattle and increase his revenues.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en:
Gambo is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Gambo has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Gambo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Gambo can store his maize and sell it at a future date, for up to 37% above the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Gambo will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to USD 2,000 per hectare of land. Gambo is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Bitrus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bitrus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Bitrus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Bitrus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Bitrus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Tabarrik

texts.en: Tabarrik is married and has a daughter. Her husband is a worker and her daughter is studying her first course at university. Tabarrik is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the region of Fuzuli, but she is now settled in the special dormitory for IDP in Baku. Tabarrik cooks national Azerbaijan dishes and sells their to customers; she also baby nurse. Today she needs her first loan in the amount of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan she wants to buy a new fridge, pots, a stove and pans.  In the future, she wants to have a cooking store and to provide a better future for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge, pots, stove and pans.

loans.name: Dana

texts.en:
Dana is a 35-year-old, Lebanese, married woman, living with her husband and three school-aged children.

Her husband is qualified from the Internal Security Forces and, in parallel, has a small mobile and rechargeable cards shop in his town. As for Dana, she does not work, she is only dedicated to her home and children.

Today, Dana is in need of a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her children’s school fees. It makes her very happy that she will be able to secure them a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay her children’s school fees

loans.name: Ngân's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ngân is 50 years old and she is married. She lives in Yen Dinh district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry and cows, for 10 years.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable.

The main hardship that Ngân faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cows to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Ngân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Ngân hopes to maintain a successful business. She also hopes for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cows to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Sisters Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bảy is 32 years old and married with two children. She has had a retail business selling medication for more than ten years.

Bảy lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Bảy faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to resell. This is Bảy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of the "Sisters" group, which consists of five members.

With her business profit, Bảy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to resell.

loans.name: Dellana Lucia

texts.es: Dellana de 19 años es una joven que aprendió de su padre el oficio de realizar mantenimiento y recarga de extintores, su padre durante años fue bombero y en su labor tomó capacitaciones que le permitieron ejercer a cabalidad su labor y adquirir para su vida un aprendizaje que años más tarde adoptaría para su propio negocio.  En el año 2009 emprendió su negocio y su hija Dellana siendo aún una niña sentía curiosidad por esta labor y tan pronto como cumplió su mayoría de edad ella decidió ayudarle a su padre pero desde la parte comercial buscando clientes.  Dellana realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar repuestos para mantenimientos de extintores: manómetros, válvulas, cilindros, mangueras e insumos. Con esta financiación podrá contar con los repuestos necesarios para reparaciones inmediatas y mejorará sus tiempos de entrega.
texts.en:
Dellana, 19, is a young woman who learned the trade of maintaining and refurbishing fire extinguishers from her father, who was a firefighter for years. As part of his job, he took training courses that enabled him to skillfully perform this work, acquiring a lifelong skill that years later he would use for his own business.

In 2009 he launched his business, and his daughter Dellana, still a child, was interested in the work. As soon as she became of age, she decided to help her father, but from the business side, finding customers. Dellana applied for a kiva loan, which offered a chance to get involved in financial matters through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and buy spare parts for extinguishers: meters, valves, cylinders, hoses and supplies. With this loan they will have enough parts on hand to perform repairs immediately and improve their turnaround times.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for maintaining fire extinguishers: meters, valves, cylinders, hoses and supplies.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is the age of 59 years old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her son owns an electrical shop in which he sells electrical goods. He provides services to his clients for the maintenance of electric goods also. For the growth of his business and the desire to generate maximum profit for his family, he wants to buy more electrical goods. Therefore, Najma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can buy bulbs, tubes and energy savers, switches, bulb holders, sockets, etc. to offer to his customers.

Najma hopes that her son will be able to grow his business soon and she is thankful to Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods such as bulbs, tubes and energy savers, switches, bulb holders, sockets, etc for her son's electrician shop.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo is married with five children.  He operates a service-based business providing transportation in his community to make a living.  His wife sells grocery goods in their general store, earning well for the family.  

Previously, Marcelo borrowed from GDMPC micro credit to buy spare motorcycle parts and renew the registration, which he successfully repaid.  Now Marcelo is requesting another loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy spare parts for motor maintenance. 

He plans to improve his business by having another motorcycle unit for rental and transportation services.  In the future, Marcelo wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motor repair.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ali has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Ali would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ali can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Ali will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ali is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a maize farmer from Makwala village. As a Babban Gona member, Deborah is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Deborah would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Deborah can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Deborah no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Deborah hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Cesiri Group

texts.fr:
Tomake  est le monsieur qui tient le bœuf par les cornes sur la Photo. IL fait l’embouche et l’élevage des bovins, Tomake est un client solvable du RMCR. 
C’est un malien âgé de 60 ans, marié, père de 5 enfants âgées de 4 à 12 ans dont 4 scolarisé,  sa femme fait le petit commerce. 
IL prend le prêt avec le  RMCR pour faire l’embouche  et l’élevage bovin, il exerce cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés de sa localité et revend dans les mêmes marchés.  Il est souvent confronté au problème de mévente des animaux. Très dévoué dans son activités Le profit qu’il gagne lui permet de prendre en charge les  dépenses de sa famille. Dans les jours à venir il compte avoir plus d’argent pour  pouvoir acheter beaucoup d’animaux afin d’accroitre son profit.
texts.en:
Tomake is the man who is holding the bullock by it's horns in the photo. He breeds and fattens cattle. Tomake is a solvent client of RMCR.

He is a 60 year old Malian, married with five children aged between four and 12. Four of the children attend school, his wife works in a small business. He requests a loan from the RMCR to fatten and breed cattle. He has been in this work for over 10 years. He buys his stock in the local markets and makes his sales in the same markets. He often has a problem when there is a slump in the sales. He is very devoted to his business, the profit that he earns enables him to cover the family expenses. In the future, he hopes to have more money to be able to buy many more animals and to increase his profit.

loans.use: to manage his livestock farm selling beef.

loans.name: Elizabeth Santos

texts.es:
Elizabeth con 46 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa familiar,junto a su cónyuge y su hijo,en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de artesania como collares,pulsera y otros, elaborados con piedras pilazo y de cuarzo,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 10 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de material para la elaboración de collares,pulseras,etc. De esta manera le facilitará seguir trabajando y mejorar sus ingresos.

Elizabeth si cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old and in a common law marriage. She lives in her family home, with her partner and son, in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, in the department of Lambayeque, in Perú. She has very good references, both personal and professional, from the residents of the area. The inhabitants of that area work primarily in agriculture, business and cattle raising.

Elizabeth works making artisanal jewelry, such as necklaces, bracelets, etc., made with quartz and other stones. She has more than 10 years experience in this field. She seeks a loan to buy material to make necklaces, bracelets, etc. This will allow her to continue working and improve her earnings.

Elizabeth has borrowing experience. She is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy materials for making necklaces, bracelets, etc.

loans.name: Haydee Noemy

texts.es: Haydee de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 11 años y con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda contruyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografia pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un creito para la compra de los materiales de construccion necesarios para poder contruir el cuarto y asi tener una vivienda mas amplia.
texts.en: 51-year-old Haydee lives in her own house with her family unit. She has had a convenience store at her house for 11 years. With the earnings from her sales, she would like to improve her home by building a room in the location shown in the picture. As she does not have enough money, she is requesting a loan to buy the necessary construction materials to build the room and have a larger home.

loans.use: to buy the necessary construction materials.

loans.name: Cessiri N°1 Group

texts.fr:
Amidou  est le Monsieur  qui  a sa  main levé  sur la photo est un cultivateur  malien, âgé de 60 ans, marié et père de 7 enfants âgées de 20 à 12 ans  dont  2 fréquentent l’école,sa femme fait le ménage.
Beaucoup d’expérience dans son activité Il fait l’élevage  de moutons il y a 7ans de cela, et il a l’amour de son  activité. Il rembourse toujours bien les emprunts contracté auprès du RMCR.
 Amidou s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants  et revend  dans les mêmes marchés. Le profit qu’il réalise lui permet de  subvenir aux  besoins de sa famille entre autre, les frais scolaires, frais de santé et les frais d’habillements.
Depuis 09 ans il emprunte auprès du   RMCR  pour pouvoir accroitre son activité d’élevage de moutons. 
Amidou est  souvent confronté au problème de mévente de ses animaux au marché, il  souhaite  avoir un prêt plus élevé pour devenir exportateur de moutons. 
Dans l’avenir il souhaite  avoir un prêt  élevé pour acheter beaucoup de moutons afin de gagner plus de profits
texts.en:
Amadou is the gentleman with his hand raised in the photo. He is a Malian farmer, aged 60. He is married with seven children aged between 20 and 12 of whom two attend school. His wife takes care of the housekeeping

Amadou has a lot of experience in his business as he has been rearing sheep for seven years now. He loves his work. He always repays the loans that he takes out from the RMCR.

Amadou buys his stock in the local markets and makes his sales in the same markets. The profit that he makes enables him to provide for his family, for example their school fees, their health care, and their clothing.

He has been borrowing from the RMCR for nine years to expand his sheep rearing business.

Amadou often suffers from poor sales prices at the market, he would like to take out a bigger loan to go into the business of exporting sheep.

In the future, he hopes to take out a big loan to buy many sheep so that he can make more profit.

loans.use: in his business rearing sheep for resale.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
La socia Nery  pertenece al banco comunal SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA.
La socia sigue  dedicándose  al trabajo como profesora del nivel primario, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera poder obtener más ganancias en su trabajo para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para materiales didácticos.
texts.en:
Nery belongs to the communal bank Sayhua De Chichubamba.

This borrower still works as a primary school teacher. Her job allows her to provide for her family. She is an enterprising woman who wants to make more income in order to continue supporting her household. She is grateful for her previous loan and promises to comply with her payment terms. She is requesting this loan to buy teaching materials.

loans.use: to buy teaching materials.

loans.name: Angelena

texts.en:
Angelena is deeply grateful that she was able to sustain her store through the generous support of Kiva and its lenders. This has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business.

Once again Angelena trusts that you can lend her funds in the amount of PHP 19,000 to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles. Her store means a lot to her since it has been the source of income which sustained her family's basic needs. She maintains a positive attitude even if at times she encounters problems collecting receivables.

Angelena aims to rent a place in a commercial area to attract more customers. She also hopes her house construction will soon be completed. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to restock her store.

La socia Elizabeth continua dedicándose al negocio de artesanía,  la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera poder obtener más ganancias en su trabajo para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares para los clientes que le soliciten, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas entre otros.

Elizabeth still works selling arts and crafts. She is an enterprising woman who wants to make more profits in order to continue supporting her family. She continues to sell fabric, sweaters, blankets, and looms to the customers that come to her. This work allows her to make a living.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with her payment terms. She is requesting this loan to buy sweaters and other items.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and other items.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments on time.  She wants to be able to continue working to support her family.  

Paulina is requesting a loan to buy carrots, among other things.

He has been doing this business for a long time, and it is going well thanks to the hard work that he puts into it every day.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to making his payments on time.  He wants to be able to continue working to support his family.  

Mario is requesting a loan to buy a laptop.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is an Organic and Fair Trade Certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Ntronang near Akim Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 61 years old and married with 10 children, three are having Senior High School education, four at basic level of education and others have completed their schooling. John believes Organic Oil Palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a knife to aid him in harvesting and maintenance of his oil palm fields.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

Kwame believes that organic palm oil is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva microloan so that he can purchase a Malaysian knife to help him prune and harvest his palm oil fruit.

texts.en: Kofi is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 59 years old and married with 3 children, one has completed tertiary education and two are still having Senior High School education. Kofi believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase knife for harvesting and pruning of oil palm farm.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

Dickson is an Organic and Fair trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Asoum in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 68 years old, divorced with seven children, three of which are still having Senior High School education and others having their Basic Education.
Dickson believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a harvesting / pruning knife to improve yields.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Seth

texts.en: Seth is an Organic and Fair trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 66 years old and married with 8 Children, all his children have completed School. Seth believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that he can purchase a harvesting knife for harvesting and maintenance of the his farm.

loans.use: To pay for Harvesting/Pruning knife.

loans.name: Mohammed
