Mohammed is an organic and fair trade-certified palm oil farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the eastern region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 62 years old and married with nine children. Two of his children are undertaking tertiary education while the others are receiving senior high school education and basic education.

Mohammed believes organic palm oil is profitable and helps to protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro-loan to buy a knife for pruning and harvesting palm oil.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 52 years old and married with nine children. Two of his children are having tertiary education and others having Senior High School education and basic education. Ernest believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a knife to help him in harvesting and pruning of oil palm and cocoa.

loans.use: To pay for Harvesting/Pruning knife

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is an organic and fair trade-certified palm oil farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the eastern region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 57 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still receiving senior high school education while the other is in primary school.

Isaac believes that organic palm oil is sustainable and that it helps to develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro-loan so he can purchase a knife for harvesting palm oil and pruning.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is an organic and fair trade-certified palm oil farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the eastern region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 67 years old and married with six children. Three of his children are still receiving senior high school education while two are undertaking tertiary education.

Samuel believes that organic palm oil is profitable and that it helps to improve health through the non-application of hazardous chemicals. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro-loan so he can purchase a knife for harvesting palm oil and pruning on his farm.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 68 years old and married with 5 children. All his children have completed Senior High School. Charles believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to buy a knife for harvesting and pruning of his cocoa and oil palm.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en:
Ebenezer is an organic and fair trade-certified palm oil farmer who lives in Akim-Ntronang near Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the eastern region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 43 years old and married with five children, two of whom are undertaking junior high school education while the others are receiving basic education.

Ebenezer believes that organic palm oil is sustainable and that it helps to develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro-loan so he can buy a knife for harvesting palm oil and pruning his palm oil fields.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Daniel K.

texts.en: Daniel is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Bomso in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 44 years old and married with 5 children. Two of his children are seeking basic education, and the others are seeking senior high school and tertiary education. Daniel believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan to purchase a Malaysian knife for harvesting and for the maintenance of his farm.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Seth Adu

texts.en: Seth is an Organic and Fair Trade certified oil palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abomosu in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 44 years old and married with 10 children. Two of his children have basic education, and the others have Senior High and tertiary education. Seth believes organic oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a Malaysian knife for harvesting and maintenance of his farm.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Bomso in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 68 years old and married with 5 children. All his children have completed school.

Kofi believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a Malaysian knife to aid in the harvesting and pruning of his oil palm field for more yield.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Kwasi

texts.en:
Kwasi is an organic and Fair Trade-certified palm foil armer who lives in Bomso in the Kwaebibirem district of the eastern region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 47 years old and married with 6 children. Three of his children are having a basic education, and others having a senior high school education.

Kwasi believes organic palm oil is profitable and helps protect the environment.

In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro loan to purchase a Malaysian knife for harvesting and the maintenance of his farm.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Leonarda continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia leva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo sus verduras a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zanahorias al por mayor.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leonarda is a member of the Sayhua de Chichabamba communal bank, located in the district of Urubamba, province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

She continues to make a living with her business selling vegetables. She has been doing this business for a long time, and it is going well thanks to the hard work that she puts into it every day. She continues filling vegetable orders for customers, since that is how she is able to move her family forwards.  

Leonarda is requesting a loan to buy carrots wholesale.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy carrots wholesale.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a hardworking married woman; shown in the photo with her son. She has been successfully running a business selling bed sheets and bedspreads for many years. She always has a good collection to offer and has attained a regular list of customers.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a Murabaha loan of 40000 PKR to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs. It will help her to increase her sales. She wishes to spend part of her revenues on her family expenses. She also wants to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs

loans.name: Seth

texts.en: Seth is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Abaam in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 43 years old and married with 4 children. Two of his children are having basic education, and the other having Senior High School education. Seth believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a Malaysian knife for harvesting and maintenance of his farm.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting/pruning knife.

loans.name: Mary Wambui

texts.en: Mary has always wanted a to own a biogas system but did know a reliable biogas installer.  She learned about Takamoto biogas loans through a neighbour and got interested.  With this loan she will be able to have smoke free and convenient fuel for her homestead.

loans.use: to buy a bio-digester for clean reliable cooking.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is an organic and fair trade-certified palm oil farmer who lives in Akim Ntronang near Ntronang-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the eastern region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 49 years old and married with eight children. Some of his children have completed school and others are receiving senior high school education.

Philip believes that organic palm oil is sustainable and that it helps to develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva micro-loan to purchase a harvesting knife for maintenance of his farm and for harvesting palm oil.

loans.use: to pay for a harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is an Organic and Fair trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. She is 51 years old and married with 3 Children, one of her children has completed Senior High School education. Ama believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop her community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, she wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that she can purchase a knife for harvesting and pruning of her oil palm fields.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Jose Moris

texts.es: Jose de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al transporte de carga desde hace mas de 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar y  por los precios accesibles, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su camión para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose is 56 years old and lives in his own home with his wife.  He has made a living transporting cargo for more than 10 years.  He has a lot of customers because of his responsible driving and accessible prices.  He uses his earnings to pay for some of the household expenses.  

Jose is requesting a loan to buy tires and do maintenance on his truck so that he can continue with his work and make better profits.

loans.use: to buy tires and do maintenance on his truck.

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abdullahi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Abdullahi can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abdullahi will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Abdullahi is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Timothy has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Timothy would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Timothy can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Timothy will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Timothy is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mujeres De La Rosa Group

texts.es:
Virginia, tiene 56 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos y reside en una comunidad del municipio de Yoro junto a uno de sus hijos. Doña Virginia, tiene su propio negocio desde hace 9 años ella vende productos alimenticios como granos básicos, pollo y también calzado y ropa de manera ambulante. Además compra cerdos y los engorda para venderlos en época de navidad. Ha solicitado el cuarto ciclo de préstamo en la institución, con el cual va aprovechar para comprar cerdos para el destazo y vender carne en esta temporada navideña. Con las ganancias piensa ayudar a su hijo con la educación.
El préstamo es grupal y se llama Mujeres de la Rosa, integrado por cinco personas que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican al comercio, venta de granos básicos y venta de cerdos. Han solicitado un préstamo grupal de 68,000 lempiras para comprar cerdos para la venta en temporada navideña y surtir de granos básicos el negocio. En la foto está a la izquierda Reina, Glenda, Elsa de blusa rosado, Virginia de falda cuadriculada y Josefina a la izquierda.
texts.en:
Virginia is 56 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with her partner.  She has 4 children and lives in a community in the town of Yoro with one of her children.  Virginia has had her own business for 9 years.  She is a traveling salesman and she sells foodstuffs such as basic grains and chicken, as well clothing and footwear.  She also buys pigs to butcher and sells pork during the Christmas season.  She has requested her 4th cycle of loans from the institution, which she wants to use to buy pigs to butcher and sell pork during this Christmas season.  She intends to use the profits to help her son with his education.  

This is a group loan for the Mujeres de Rosa group, made up of 5 people who live in the same community and make a living through trade, basic grain sales, and pig sales.  They have requested a group loan of 68,000 lempiras to buy pigs to sell during the Christmas season and to stock their business with basic grains.  Pictured in the photo, from the right to left, are Reina, Glenda, Elsa in the pink shirt, Virginia in the plaid skirt, and Josefina.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher and sell pork this season.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hamza has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hamza would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Hamza can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Hamza will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Hamza is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.en:
Juan is 75 years old and Afro-Ecuatorian. He’s married and the father of 5 children, all of them grown. Nowadays he lives with his wife and his granddaughter, who is nineteen and in 6 months will finish high school. They live in Mascarilla, a small town located in the rural zone of Imbabura. Since Juan was a child his family and neighborhood has been dedicated to farming, but most of the population always have economic problems with investing in their land.

Juan is old and can’t work in the field like he could when he was young. He has a hectare of sugar cane and is looking for finance to buy fertilizer and pay for labor and irrigation. He has to contract more laborers than before because he only supervises their work. His wife helps by preparing meals for Juan and his workers.

Juan and his wife expect their granddaughter to go to university. Always they have saved a little part of their earnings to in the future pay for their granddaughter’s university education.

Juan will appreciate your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor and irrigation.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yahaya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as cash to purchase food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for a price that is up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya will benefit from marketing support that could help him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Yahaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family members, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid is 62 years old. He is living in the Bilasuvar region with his family. He is married and has 3 sons, one of whom is married. Vahid is already a grandfather, but he is a tireless person, who never stops working for the sake of his family. He is a very hardworking person and loves his job as a farmer.

He is a farmer and is involved in daily farming activities. He has some cattle and raises small calves in his own yard. He usually fattens them and sells their meat in the local market. He has been doing this for the last twenty years after seeing his parents do the same when he was a child, so he has vast experience. People in Azerbaijan prepare traditional foods mostly with meat, and a lot of people like to consume meat. Since he knows that the existing demand is high in the local bazaar, he is also planning to expand the business a bit. To meet the demand, he needs to fatten his calves and to buy a few more cows. Currently, he is planning to expand the farm. In order to expand his farming business, he needs to buy two more calves. For this, he needs 1,200 AZN. He hopes that Kiva lenders will show their support.

loans.use: to buy 2 more calves

loans.name: Qaras

texts.en:
Qaras is 36 years old and is a very diligent and passionate person. Qaras is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Bilasuvar refugee settlement. He is married, lives with his large family, and also takes care of his elderly parents. He has a son and a daughter. At his age, he knows that he has the great responsibility to both earn income and raise his children properly.

He is a pharmacist, and people in his neighborhood call him as an honest doctor. He is very energetic and is an expert in his field. He takes care of people's necessities and always has a good customer base. He knows that success requires dedication. He studied pharmacy in Baku and now wants to contribute to the people in his settlement. Qaras likes his job, helping to cure sicknesses with the medicines he gives. Being a refugee, he knows that he must help people who have desperate needs and especially those who became veterans in the war. He is more familiar with local area people and knows the people's needs and demands. Qaras is a well-reputed pharmacist, and he has the advantage of people trusting him. Currently, he is planning to buy new stock of medicines, which are in demand, and he needs 1,200 AZN to do this. Hopefully, Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy new stock of medicines.

loans.name: Eldeniz

texts.en:
Eldeniz is 27 years old, and he is a refugee from the Bilasuvar region. He is married, and he has a son and a daughter. Eldeniz's family is large, and he also supports his elderly parents and younger siblings. He is very hardworking and is a diligent person. He is trying to earn enough income by raising cattle and sheep. In this way, he takes care of his family's needs. He is very energetic and passionate about his job. There are many people in the local market who respect Eldeniz for his dedication, honesty, and business principles. He is a well-known farmer who does a great job in meeting customers' needs.

He has a small shop where he brings natural meat to sell in the market. In the local market, there aren't many people who can provide real, natural meat. That's why people like buying from Eldeniz. Demand is growing in the market because people prefer traditional foods, like kufta and bozbash that consist of mutton and beef, so Eldeniz is planning to expand. Currently, he needs a 1,200 AZN loan to buy three calves. Hopefully, Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy three calves.

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Zahid is 57 years old. He is refugee, living in the refugee settlement called Bilasuvar is the south part of the country. He resides with his family, including his father and mother. To provide a good income for his family, Zahid is involved in agriculture, which he has been doing for more than 20 years. He has a vast knowledge about agriculture and experience running successful farming activities. He has studied agricultural subjects. He raises sheep, fattens them, and then takes their meat to the local bazaar where there is a big demand. Most of the traditional dishes such as kebabs and kufta and rice consist of meat. He keeps 10-15 sheep on his own land. 

Zahid requested a loan for 1,200 AZN, which he will use to buy sheep for fattening and subsequent sale. He intends to channel his earnings toward developing his business and improving family conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Homobono

texts.en: Homobono is a farmer who lives in Tenamazapa, a small town in an area known as the Mountain in Guerrero, Mexico. Like many others in his community, he lives on what he grows: corn, beans or pumpkins. Also like many others he lacks electricity and depends on candles to illuminate his house at night. This option is expensive, inefficient, and dangerous in part because candles release carbon particles that can cause respiratory problems. Homonobo wants his children to have better light after dark so they can do their homework and excel at school. At the same time, he wants to improve their quality of life and prevent respiratory diseases. That is why he is requesting a loan to install solar panels, which will also save his family $120 pesos per month.

loans.use: to buy a solar system that will improve his family's life and allow his children to study safely after dark.

loans.name: Gullu

texts.en:
Gullu is a 55-year-old internally displaced person (IDP) from the Bilasuvar region. She is married and has a son and two daughters. Additionally, she helps her elderly mother, who is living in a refugee settlement.

She raises some chickens and also grows vegetables and fruits in the yard. She loves this job. With the support of her family, especially her husband, Gullu has been running quite a successful farming business. Her husband is a teacher at school, but he helps her with great passion. She has more than 15 years of experience. She also relies on her children's support in managing the farm; they help her water and clean the yard and do other related tasks. They support each other very well. Gullu is running the farm with great passion and love because she wants to take care of her family.

Gullu sells natural chicken meat, eggs, vegetables, and fruits in the local market. In Azerbaijan, there is great demand for meat and vegetables to make traditional foods, like dolma and bozbash, and there is also demand for fruits to make after-dinner desserts. She is currently planning to expand the business. She needs 1,900 AZN to buy new stock of chickens. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy new stock of chickens.

loans.name: Flavio

texts.en:
Flavio lives in Tenamazapa, a remote and small town located in the mountain region of Guerrero, which is considered one of the poorest areas of Mexico. He is a farmer who works all day in the field to support his family, although sometimes the selling of corn and beans is not enough to cover the basic needs. His wife is a housewife, but she also helps in the family economy, sewing clothes during the day.

The light source that Flavio and his family uses are candles; this option is expensive, inefficient, and dangerous. Besides, candles release some carbon particles that can lead to respiratory problems, and due to their inefficiency, can hurt the eyes if the person tries to do activities like read or sew.

Flavio wants to purchase a solar-powered system that will allow him and his family to have a better quality of life. He will be able to save 100 pesos per month, his kids will have more hours to study during the night, his wife will be able to sew during nights, and he will have more time to do another activity to earn money.

loans.use: to purchase a solar-powered system that will enable him and his family to have better opportunities to study and work.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel and his family live in a small town named Tenamazapa in the state of Guerrero.  He is a farmer who grows beans, corn and pumpkins. Many families in this area lack electricity, so they use candles and wood for illumination. The smoke that these sources produce can cause pulmonary damage, and they are expensive and inefficient. Joel is very concerned about his family's health, which is why he is requesting this loan to buy a solar system that is safe to use inside, illuminates well, and costs $95 fewer pesos per month than candles and wood.

loans.use: to buy a solar systems to illuminate his house and improve his family's life.

loans.name: Fany Janeth

texts.es: Fany, de 35 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, vive junto a su esposo y una hija en el municipio de la Lima, Cortes. Ella cuenta con un negocio de pulpería desde hace 2 años en su casa donde ofrece productos como ser arroz, frijoles, refrescos, harina, condimentos, churros, confitería, refrescos, carnes y lácteos. Ella solicita la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras para invertir en productos como útiles escolares, productos enlatados y carnes rojas para surtir su negocio. Con ello espera aumentar su clientela para mejorar sus ventas e ingresos. Tiene como meta invertir en remodelar el local donde tiene el negocio para que sea más grande y cómodo y poder brindar mejor servicio a los clientes. Su gran sueño es que su hija curse los estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Fany, age 35, has four children.  She lives with her husband and one daughter in the town of Lima, Cortes.  For the past two years she has had a grocery store business in her home.  She sells items such as rice, beans, soda, flour, seasonings, churros, candy, meat, and dairy products.  

She is asking for 10,000 Lempiras to invest in products such as school supplies, canned goods, and red meats in order to stock her business.  With this investment she hopes to increase her customer base in order to improve her sales and income.  

She has a goal of remodeling the place where she has her business so that it is larger and more comfortable, in order to give her customers better service.  Her big dream is that her daughter would enroll in higher education.

loans.use: to invest in products such as school supplies, canned goods, and red meats to stock her business

loans.name: Ana Coralia

texts.es: Ana de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica desde hace 20 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, age 49, lives in her own home with her partner.  She has worked for 20 years making and selling tortillas.  Her business is located in her place of residence, and she has a lot of customers.  With the earnings she receives, she is able to cover some of the household expenses.  

She is asking for a loan to buy corn by the quintal and also lime in order to be able to continue making tortillas.  In this way she can have a better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal, as well as lime.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is an ambitious farmer who wants to turn his dairy farm into a model for sustainable, small-scale productive farms. He decided to invest in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to treat the manure of his 130 cows and transform it into renewable energy (biogas) and nutrient-rich organic fertilizer for domestic and productive uses.

Indeed, he used to pile up his animals' waste on his farm, where it was emitting greenhouse gases and contaminating the environment. Through his biodigester, Jose will be able to save the money he used to spend on LP gas and chemical fertilizers, in order to invest in the expansion of his farm.

Among others, he wants to buy more cows and increase his corn production. His farm will become more cost-effective and sustainable as he starts applying the organic fertilizer to nourish the soil in a natural manner by applying the organic fertilizer produced in the biodigester. He looks forward to transforming a problem into a solution and to show that waste actually is a resource!

This loan represents 78% of the price of the biodigester; the remaining part is paid directly by Jose.

loans.use: to invest in a 200-cubic meter waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha pertenece al banco comunal SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue con su negocio de venta de verduras, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia sigue vendiendo zanahorias, papas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de zanahorias al por mayor
texts.en:
Martha belongs to the Sayhua de Chichubamba communal bank.  This bank is located in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

This group member still has a business selling vegetables.  She has been in this business for a good while now, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business each day.  She still sells carrots and potatoes, among other items.  She wants to be able to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family in this way.

She asked for a loan to buy carrots in bulk.

loans.use: to buy carrots in bulk

loans.name: Kulu

texts.en:
Kulu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Kulu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Kulu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Kulu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Kulu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Kulu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to purchase food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.en:
Cesar is 60 years old and Afro-Ecuadorian. He is married and the father of four children, all of them grown. He lives with his wife and youngest children in Mascarilla. This area is characterized by agricultural potential, and is located in northern Ecuador.

Cesar has a field of sugar cane and a small garden at home where he grows avocados and lemons. The field of sugar cane is three months old, and he needs a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for irrigation.

For a sugar cane field, this stage is very important because if the cane receives good care, in the future the buyer will pay better. Cesar is worried about irrigation because this summer was hard, and the drought continues. His wife helps in the field, too. His son is 18 years old, and he still goes to high school. On weekends, he works with his father.

Cesar hopes to count on your support, and with the earnings from the crops, he wants to buy a computer for his son because he will go to university next year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for irrigation.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: la señora Dora siempre mantuvo la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida con trabajo constante y esfuerzo junto a su cónyuge, quien actualmente trabaja como minero en el cerro rico de Potosí y la señora se dedicada a la elaboración de mantas a mano, actualmente tiene un hijo de un año que esta al cuidado de la madre y tiene el deseo de brindarle un futuro con mejores perspectivas, se hace notar que la familia es unida siempre buscando mejorar la calidad de vida de todos sus integrantes, es en tal sentido hace un año atrás se capacitó en tejidos a mano con la fundación "Educación para el desarrollo" en Fautapo, además en el Instituto Técnico industrial "Nuevo Amanecer" y actualmente es la principal fuente de ingreso de la familia elaborando mantas a mano de diversa variedad y posterior comercialización, y su cónyuge colabora con los gastos básicos con su actividad minera, siendo la actividad de su cónyuge una alternativa importante para el desarrollo familiar y así mismo buscan fuentes de financiamiento para incrementar su capacidad de funcionamiento y mejorar su nivel de inventarios, gama de sus mantas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dora had always hoped to improve her quality of life with constant work and effort along with her spouse, who currently works as a miner in the Cerro Rico of Potosí. She makes a living hand knitting blankets.

She currently has a one year old son who is in her mother's care and she wishes to offer him a better future. It's noticeable that it's a close family and always looking to improve the quality of life of all its members. That's why a year ago she trained on hand knitting with the foundation "Educación para el desarrollo" (Education for development) in Fautapo, as well as at the Industrial Technical Institute "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Sunrise).

She is currently the main source of income for her family, hand knitting and then selling a variety of blankets, and her spouse helps with basic expenses through his mining work, this being a important option for the family development. Moreover, they are looking for funding sources to increase their operating capacity and improve the level of stock and assortment of the blankets.

loans.use: to buy supplies to improve and expand her blanket production in order to have better options and income for her family.

loans.name: Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Jeannette is a 54-year-old married woman with three children. She has operated vegetables and fruits business for ten years. She works everyday from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. While the work is tough and the hours are long, Jeannette is committed to her business so that her children may prosper. She is the president of ABISUNGANYE group and she shown in the photo holding passbook in her hands.

Jeannette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase purchase more vegetables and fruits for sale. She will use the loan to earn more profits, reinvest for better financial stability, pay her children's school fees, pay medical insurance, and buy new clothes for her children. Jeannette hopes to earn enough money to buy a general store.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a maize farmer in Gidan Megiya village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior supplies that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Gabriel had to sell his maize at harvest, when prices are at their lowest, to meet immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Gabriel can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when prices are up to 37% higher than at harvest. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Gabriel no longer feels pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare, he hopes to achieve better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Zaphaniya

texts.en: Zaphaniya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. He anticipates a good harvest this season because he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Zaphaniya had to sell his crop at harvest, when prices are lowest, to meet his immediate needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Zaphaniya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than at harvest time. As a Babban Gona member, Zaphaniya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare. He is grateful for the opportunity to improve the life of his family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Afiniki

texts.en: Afiniki is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. She expects a good harvest this season because she has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.  Before joining Babban Gona, Afiniki had to sell her maize at harvest, when prices are lowest, to meet her immediate needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Afiniki can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, she also benefits from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare. Afiniki is grateful to have the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Alh. Yakubu

texts.en:
Alhaji Yakubu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Yakubu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Yakubu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Yakubu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba es una confeccionista de 51 años de edad que ha sacado adelante a su hogar con esmero y dedicación,  ella es viuda y al no contar con el apoyo de su cónyuge, ha tenido que permanecer largas jornadas en su taller velando por entregar toda la producción requerida por sus clientes. Ella reside con sus hijos en un humilde barrio del municipio de Soledad y en esta misma localidad se encuentra la gran mayoría de sus clientes: amas de casa y trabajadores de empresas, quienes solicitan de sus servicios costura y clínica de ropa.  En la temporada navideña sus producción se incrementa y requiere de materias primas e insumos, para ello realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar telas de diferentes clases, hilos, botones, cremalleras y pellones. Alba desea mejorar la imagen de su negocio y captar más clientes.
texts.en:
Alba is a 51 year old seamstress who has gotten her household ahead with great care and dedication. She is a widow and not having the support of her husband she has had to spend long days in her workshop to look after delivering all the production required by her clients.

She lives with her children in a humble neighborhood of the municipality of Soledad and in this same area the majority of her clients are found: housewives and companies who request her services sewing and repairing clothing.

During the Christmas season her production increases and she requires raw materials and supplies. So she is requesting a loan from Kiva, an opportunity to access the financial world through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy different kinds of fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and interfacing. Alba wants to improve the image of her business and gain more clients.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and interfacing.

loans.name: Sri Cendana Group

texts.en:
Combining two businesses increased the income for the family, which happened in the Sri Cendana Group. They used their last loan to improve their businesses in pig raising and other businesses such as agricultural, trading, and services. Now they can set aside the profit as savings.

After they made their payment to MUK, the group agreed to request another loan in order to expand their businesses. Ni Ketut will use her loan to buy superior piglets, seeds, and fertilizer for her garden. She hopes to renovate her house and makes wider cages for her piglets. Others members will use their portion of loan to increase the population of pigs and as capital for their other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets, seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Dunia Aracely

texts.es: Dunia, tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos, en el municipio de la Lima, Cortes. Ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de mercadería donde ofrece productos como ser lociones, cremas, maquillajes, desodorantes, por encargo o catálogos. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 2 años en su casa y los fines de semana se dedican a la venta de comida. Ella solicita la cantidad de 4,000 Lempiras que utilizara para comprar ropa y sandalias para la temporada navideña, esto le ayudará a aumentar sus ventas y aumentar su clientela. Su meta es terminar de pagar su casa para luego poner un negocio de comida más formal, para poder ayudar a la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Dunia is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the municipality of la Lima, Cortes. She has a business selling merchandise where she offers products like lotions, creams, make-up and deodorants by order and by catalog. She has had this business for two years at her house and on weekends she works selling food.

She is requesting the amount of 4,000 HNL which she will use to buy clothing and sandals for the Christmas season. This will help to increase her sales and her clientele. Her goal is to finish paying for her house and later install a more formal food business there, to be able to help with the economic stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing and sandals to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Beatriz continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de flores, la socia es una mujer emprendedora ella espera poder obtener más ganancias para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de rosas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "SAYHUA DE CHICHUBAMBA" communal bank. The bank is located in the province of Urubamba and Cusco department.

Beatriz continues to work in her business selling flowers. She is an enterprising woman who hopes to obtain more earnings and in this way continue to support her family. She continues to sell her merchandise to her clients at their request, this being the way she gets her family ahead.

The member is requesting the loan to buy roses amongst others.

loans.use: to buy roses amongst others.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking woman with six children who earns a living raising pigs. She adds to her earnings with profits from her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Elena has applied for a 14,000 PHP through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes that one day she will have saved enough money to further develop her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Luna works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Luna is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Luna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is maize farmer from Bakula village. As a member of Babban Gona, Iliya is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
Iliya is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to  buy maize grinding machines

loans.use: to buy himself food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Asabe

texts.en:
Asabe is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Asabe has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Asabe would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Asabe can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Asabe will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Asabe is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to move into a better home with her family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Auwalu

texts.en:
Auwalu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Auwalu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Auwalu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Auwalu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Auwalu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 59-year-old widow. She has five children, three of whom are married while another two are still at school. For the past six years she has operated a small shop where she sells items for daily use such as sugar, coffee, mosquito repellent, biscuits, shampoo, detergent and so forth.

In the past Maria wanted to add more merchandise to her shop, but a lack of capital prevented her from doing so. She has now joined TLM and applied for a 1,750,000 IDR loan. This money will enable her to buy more items such as wheat, flour, sugar, cooking oil, butter and kerosene to sell.

Maria is so grateful because with the help of TLM she may achieve what she plans for and hopes for the successful of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items such as wheat, flour, sugar, cooking oil, butter and kerosene to stock her shop.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 57 years old, married, and has two children.

Adelina is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Adelina has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Adelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 45 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemarie operates a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. 

Rosemarie requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fishing nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell in her general store business.

Jessica has been in this business for 25 years. She earns additional income from a photocopier business.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ginelyn

texts.en:
Ginelyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ginelyn is 48 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Ginelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, fish, meat, spices, etc.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, fish, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 60 years old, married, and has 11 children, two of whom attend school. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for eight years.

Magdalena requested her eighth loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and repair her pigpens. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and repair her pigpens.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analie is 35 years old, and three of her children are still in school.

Analie has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of dried fish and other materials for her business.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish and other materials for her business.
